31 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_MACROS_DEFINE_MACROS_HPP

34 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/version_macros.hpp>
35 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
36 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
37 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
38 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
39 //
40 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
41 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
42 
43 // Check version definitions if already defined.
44 #if defined(FK_YAML_MAJOR_VERSION) && defined(FK_YAML_MINOR_VERSION) && \
45  defined(FK_YAML_PATCH_VERSION)
46 #if FK_YAML_MAJOR_VERSION != 0 || FK_YAML_MINOR_VERSION != 4 || FK_YAML_PATCH_VERSION != 0
47 #warning Already included a different version of the fkYAML library!
48 #else
49 // define macros to skip defining macros down below.
50 #define FK_YAML_VERCHECK_SUCCEEDED
51 #endif
52 #endif
53 
54 #ifndef FK_YAML_VERCHECK_SUCCEEDED
55 
56 #define FK_YAML_MAJOR_VERSION 0
57 #define FK_YAML_MINOR_VERSION 4
58 #define FK_YAML_PATCH_VERSION 0
59 
60 #define FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION_CONCAT_IMPL(major, minor, patch) v##major##_##minor##_##patch
61 
62 #define FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION_CONCAT(major, minor, patch) \
63  FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION_CONCAT_IMPL(major, minor, patch)
64 
65 #define FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION \
66  FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION_CONCAT(FK_YAML_MAJOR_VERSION, FK_YAML_MINOR_VERSION, \
67  FK_YAML_PATCH_VERSION)
68 
69 #define FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN \
70  namespace fkyaml \
71  { \
72  inline namespace FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION \
73  {
74 
75 #define FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END \
76  } /* inline namespace FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_VERSION */ \
77  } // namespace fkyaml
78 
79 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN \
80  FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN \
81  namespace detail \
82  {
83 
84 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END \
85  } /* namespace detail */ \
86  FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END
87 
88 #endif // !defined(FK_YAML_VERCHECK_SUCCEEDED)
89 
90 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/cpp_config_macros.hpp>
91 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
92 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
93 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
94 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
95 //
96 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
97 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
98 
99 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_MACROS_CPP_CONFIG_MACROS_HPP
100 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_MACROS_CPP_CONFIG_MACROS_HPP
101 
102 // This file is assumed to be included only by version_macros.hpp file.
103 // To avoid redundant inclusion, do not include version_macros.hpp file as the other files do.
104 
105 // With the MSVC compilers, the value of __cplusplus is by default always "199611L"(C++98).
106 // To avoid that, the library instead references _MSVC_LANG which is always set a correct value.
107 // See https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/msvc-now-correctly-reports-__cplusplus/ for more
108 // details.
109 #if defined(_MSVC_LANG) && !defined(__clang__)
110 #define FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS _MSVC_LANG
111 #else
112 #define FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS __cplusplus
113 #endif
114 
115 // C++ language standard detection
116 // Skip detection if the definitions listed below already exist.
117 #if !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_23) && !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20) && \
118  !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17) && !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14) && !defined(FK_YAML_CXX_11)
119 #if FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS >= 202302L
120 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_23
121 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20
122 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
123 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
124 #elif FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS >= 202002L
125 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20
126 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
127 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
128 #elif FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS >= 201703L
129 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
130 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
131 #elif FK_YAML_CPLUSPLUS >= 201402L
132 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
133 #endif
134 
135 // C++11 is the minimum required version of the fkYAML library.
136 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_11
137 #endif
138 
139 // switch usage of the deprecated attribute. [[deprecated]] is available since C++14.
140 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14)
141 #define FK_YAML_DEPRECATED(msg) [[deprecated(msg)]]
142 #else
143 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
144 #define FK_YAML_DEPRECATED(msg) __declspec(deprecated(msg))
145 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
146 #define FK_YAML_DEPRECATED(msg) __attribute__((deprecated(msg)))
147 #else
148 #define FK_YAML_DEPRECATED(msg)
149 #endif
150 #endif
151 
152 // switch usage of inline variables which have been available since C++17.
153 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17)
154 #define FK_YAML_INLINE_VAR inline
155 #else
156 #define FK_YAML_INLINE_VAR
157 #endif
158 
159 // switch usage of constexpr keyward depending on active C++ standard.
160 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17)
161 #define FK_YAML_CXX17_CONSTEXPR constexpr
162 #else
163 #define FK_YAML_CXX17_CONSTEXPR
164 #endif
165 
166 // Detect __has_* macros.
167 // The following macros replace redundant `defined(__has_*) && __has_*(...)`.
168 
169 #ifdef __has_include
170 #define FK_YAML_HAS_INCLUDE(header) __has_include(header)
171 #else
172 #define FK_YAML_HAS_INCLUDE(header) (0)
173 #endif
174 
175 #ifdef __has_builtin
176 #define FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(builtin) __has_builtin(builtin)
177 #else
178 #define FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(builtin) (0)
179 #endif
180 
181 #ifdef __has_cpp_attribute
182 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(attr) __has_cpp_attribute(attr)
183 #else
184 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(attr) (0)
185 #endif
186 
187 #ifdef __has_feature
188 #define FK_YAML_HAS_FEATURE(feat) __has_feature(feat)
189 #else
190 #define FK_YAML_HAS_FEATURE(feat) (0)
191 #endif
192 
193 // switch usage of the no_sanitize attribute only when Clang sanitizer is active.
194 #if defined(__clang__) && FK_YAML_HAS_FEATURE(address_sanitizer)
195 #define FK_YAML_NO_SANITIZE(...) __attribute__((no_sanitize(__VA_ARGS__)))
196 #else
197 #define FK_YAML_NO_SANITIZE(...)
198 #endif
199 
200 #if FK_YAML_HAS_INCLUDE(<version>)
201 // <version> is available since C++20
202 #include <version>
203 #endif
204 
205 //
206 // C++ feature detections
207 //
208 
209 // switch usages of the std::to_chars()/std::from_chars() functions which have been available since
210 // C++17.
211 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17) && defined(__cpp_lib_to_chars) && __cpp_lib_to_chars >= 201611L
212 #define FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS (1)
213 #else
214 #define FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS (0)
215 #endif
216 
217 // switch usage of char8_t which has been available since C++20.
218 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20) && defined(__cpp_char8_t) && __cpp_char8_t >= 201811L
219 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T (1)
220 #else
221 #define FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T (0)
222 #endif
223 
224 //
225 // utility macros
226 //
227 
228 // switch usage of [[likely]] C++ attribute which has been available since C++20.
229 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20) && FK_YAML_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(likely) >= 201803L
230 #define FK_YAML_LIKELY(expr) (!!(expr)) [[likely]]
231 #elif FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_expect)
232 #define FK_YAML_LIKELY(expr) (__builtin_expect(!!(expr), 1))
233 #else
234 #define FK_YAML_LIKELY(expr) (!!(expr))
235 #endif
236 
237 // switch usage of [[unlikely]] C++ attribute which has been available since C++20.
238 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20) && FK_YAML_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(unlikely) >= 201803L
239 #define FK_YAML_UNLIKELY(expr) (!!(expr)) [[unlikely]]
240 #elif FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_expect)
241 #define FK_YAML_UNLIKELY(expr) (__builtin_expect(!!(expr), 0))
242 #else
243 #define FK_YAML_UNLIKELY(expr) (!!(expr))
244 #endif
245 
246 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_MACROS_CPP_CONFIG_MACROS_HPP */
247 
248 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_MACROS_DEFINE_MACROS_HPP */
249 
250 // #include <fkYAML/detail/assert.hpp>
251 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
252 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
253 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
254 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
255 //
256 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
257 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
258 
259 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_ASSERT_HPP
260 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_ASSERT_HPP
261 
262 // if FK_YAML_ASSERT is not user-defined. apply the default assert impl.
263 #ifndef FK_YAML_ASSERT
264 #ifndef NDEBUG
265 #include <cassert>
266 #define FK_YAML_ASSERT(x) assert(x)
267 #else
268 #define FK_YAML_ASSERT(x)
269 #endif
270 #endif
271 
272 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ASSERT_HPP */

300 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_NODE_TRAITS_HPP

305 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/detect.hpp>

307 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
308 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0

314 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_DETECT_HPP
315 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_DETECT_HPP
316 
317 #include <iterator>
318 #include <type_traits>

320 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
321 
322 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
323 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
324 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
325 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
326 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML

330 
331 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_STL_SUPPLEMENT_HPP
332 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_STL_SUPPLEMENT_HPP
333 
334 #include <cstddef>
335 #include <type_traits>
336 
337 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
338 
339 #ifdef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
340 #include <utility>
341 #endif
342 
343 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
344 
346 // For contributors:
347 // This file is for supplementing future C++ STL implementations to utilize some useful features
348 // implemented in C++14 or better.
349 // This file is needed to keep the fkYAML library requirement to C++11.
350 // **DO NOT** implement features which are not included any version of STL in this file.
351 // Such implementations must be in the type_traits.hpp file.
353 
354 #ifndef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14
355 
360 template <typename T> using add_pointer_t = typename std::add_pointer<T>::type;
361 
367 template <bool Condition, typename T = void>
368 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<Condition, T>::type;
369 
374 template <typename T>
375 struct is_null_pointer : std::is_same<std::nullptr_t, typename std::remove_cv<T>::type>
376 {
377 };
378 
383 template <typename T> using remove_cv_t = typename std::remove_cv<T>::type;
384 
389 template <typename T> using remove_pointer_t = typename std::remove_pointer<T>::type;
390 
395 template <typename T> using remove_reference_t = typename std::remove_reference<T>::type;
396 
397 template <typename T, T... I> struct integer_sequence
398 {
399  using value_type = T;
400  static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept
401  {
402  return sizeof...(I);
403  }
404 };
405 
406 #if !FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__make_integer_seq) && !FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__integer_pack)
407 
408 namespace make_int_seq_impl
409 {
410 
411 template <typename IntSeq0, typename IntSeq1> struct merger;
412 
413 template <typename T, T... Ints0, T... Ints1>
414 struct merger<integer_sequence<T, Ints0...>, integer_sequence<T, Ints1...>>
415 {
416  using type = integer_sequence<T, Ints0..., (sizeof...(Ints0) + Ints1)...>;
417 };
418 
419 template <typename T, std::size_t Num> struct generator
420 {
421  using type = typename merger<typename generator<T, Num / 2>::type,
422  typename generator<T, Num - Num / 2>::type>::type;
423 };
424 
425 template <typename T> struct generator<T, 0>
426 {
427  using type = integer_sequence<T>;
428 };
429 
430 template <typename T> struct generator<T, 1>
431 {
432  using type = integer_sequence<T, 0>;
433 };
434 
435 } // namespace make_int_seq_impl
436 
437 #endif
438 
439 template <typename T, T Num>
440 using make_integer_sequence
441 #if FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__make_integer_seq)
442  // clang defines built-in __make_integer_seq to generate an integer sequence.
443  = __make_integer_seq<integer_sequence, T, Num>;
444 #elif FK_YAML_HAS_BUILTIN(__integer_pack)
445  // GCC or other compilers may implement built-in __integer_pack to generate an
446  // integer sequence.
447  = integer_sequence<T, __integer_pack(Num)...>;
448 #else
449  // fallback to the library implementation of make_integer_sequence.
450  = typename make_int_seq_impl::generator<T, Num>::type;
451 #endif
452 
453 template <std::size_t... Idx> using index_sequence = integer_sequence<std::size_t, Idx...>;
454 
455 template <std::size_t Num> using make_index_sequence = make_integer_sequence<std::size_t, Num>;
456 
457 template <typename... Types> using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Types)>;
458 
459 #else // !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14)
460 
461 using std::add_pointer_t;
462 using std::enable_if_t;
463 using std::index_sequence;
464 using std::index_sequence_for;
465 using std::integer_sequence;
466 using std::is_null_pointer;
467 using std::make_index_sequence;
468 using std::make_integer_sequence;
469 using std::remove_cv_t;
470 using std::remove_pointer_t;
471 using std::remove_reference_t;
472 
473 #endif // !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_14)
474 
475 #ifndef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
476 
479 template <bool Val> using bool_constant = std::integral_constant<bool, Val>;
480 
487 template <typename... Traits> struct conjunction : std::true_type
488 {
489 };
490 
493 template <typename Trait> struct conjunction<Trait> : Trait
494 {
495 };
496 
501 template <typename First, typename... Rest>
502 struct conjunction<First, Rest...>
503  : std::conditional<First::value, conjunction<Rest...>, First>::type
504 {
505 };
506 
513 template <typename... Traits> struct disjunction : std::false_type
514 {
515 };
516 
519 template <typename Trait> struct disjunction<Trait> : Trait
520 {
521 };
522 
527 template <typename First, typename... Rest>
528 struct disjunction<First, Rest...>
529  : std::conditional<First::value, First, disjunction<Rest...>>::type
530 {
531 };
532 
537 template <typename Trait> struct negation : std::integral_constant<bool, !Trait::value>
538 {
539 };
540 
543 template <typename... Types> struct make_void
544 {
545  using type = void;
546 };
547 
552 template <typename... Types> using void_t = typename make_void<Types...>::type;
553 
554 #else // !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17)
555 
556 using std::bool_constant;
557 using std::conjunction;
558 using std::disjunction;
559 using std::negation;
560 using std::void_t;
561 
562 #endif // !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17)
563 
564 #ifndef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_20
565 
570 template <typename T>
571 using remove_cvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
572 
573 #else
574 
575 using std::remove_cvref_t;
576 
577 #endif
578 
583 // LCOV_EXCL_START
584 [[noreturn]] inline void unreachable()
585 {
586  // use compiler specific extensions if possible.
587  // undefined behavior should be raised by an empty function with noreturn attribute.
588 
589 #if defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_23) || \
590  (defined(__cpp_lib_unreachable) && __cpp_lib_unreachable >= 202202L)
591  std::unreachable();
592 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__) // MSVC
593  __assume(false);
594 #else
595  __builtin_unreachable();
596 #endif
597 }
598 // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
599 
600 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
601 
602 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_STL_SUPPLEMENT_HPP */
603 
604 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
605 
607 struct nonesuch
608 {
609  nonesuch() = delete;
610  ~nonesuch() = delete;
611  nonesuch(const nonesuch &) = delete;
612  nonesuch(nonesuch &&) = delete;
613  nonesuch &operator=(const nonesuch &) = delete;
614  nonesuch &operator=(nonesuch &&) = delete;
615 };
616 
618 namespace detector_impl
619 {
620 
626 template <typename Default, typename AlwaysVoid, template <typename...> class Op, typename... Args>
627 struct detector : std::false_type
628 {
630  using type = Default;
631 };
632 
637 template <typename Default, template <typename...> class Op, typename... Args>
638 struct detector<Default, void_t<Op<Args...>>, Op, Args...> : std::true_type
639 {
641  using type = Op<Args...>;
642 };
643 
644 } // namespace detector_impl
645 
649 template <template <typename...> class Op, typename... Args>
650 using is_detected = detector_impl::detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>;
651 
655 template <template <typename...> class Op, typename... Args>
656 using detected_t = typename detector_impl::detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::type;
657 
662 template <typename Expected, template <typename...> class Op, typename... Args>
663 using is_detected_exact = std::is_same<Expected, detected_t<Op, Args...>>;
664 
666 namespace detect
667 {
668 
671 template <typename T> using iterator_t = typename T::iterator;
672 
675 template <typename T> using key_type_t = typename T::key_type;
676 
679 template <typename T> using mapped_type_t = typename T::mapped_type;
680 
683 template <typename T> using value_type_t = typename T::value_type;
684 
687 template <typename T> using difference_type_t = typename T::difference_type;
688 
691 template <typename T> using pointer_t = typename T::pointer;
692 
695 template <typename T> using reference_t = typename T::reference;
696 
699 template <typename T> using iterator_category_t = typename T::iterator_category;
700 
703 template <typename T> using container_type_t = typename T::container_type;
704 
707 template <typename T, typename... Args>
708 using emplace_fn_t = decltype(std::declval<T>().emplace(std::declval<Args>()...));
709 
712 template <typename T>
713 using reserve_fn_t = decltype(std::declval<T>().reserve(std::declval<typename T::size_type>()));
714 
717 template <typename T> using has_iterator = is_detected<iterator_t, T>;
718 
721 template <typename T> using has_key_type = is_detected<key_type_t, T>;
722 
725 template <typename T> using has_mapped_type = is_detected<mapped_type_t, T>;
726 
729 template <typename T> using has_value_type = is_detected<value_type_t, T>;
730 
733 template <typename T>
734 struct is_iterator_traits
735  : conjunction<is_detected<difference_type_t, T>, has_value_type<T>, is_detected<pointer_t, T>,
736  is_detected<reference_t, T>, is_detected<iterator_category_t, T>>
737 {
738 };
739 
742 template <typename T> using has_container_type = is_detected<container_type_t, T>;
743 
746 template <typename T, typename... Args> using has_emplace = is_detected<emplace_fn_t, T, Args...>;
747 
750 template <typename T> using has_reserve = is_detected<reserve_fn_t, T>;
751 
752 // fallback to these STL functions.
753 using std::begin;
754 using std::end;
755 
758 template <typename T, typename = void> struct has_begin_end : std::false_type
759 {
760 };
761 
764 template <typename T>
765 struct has_begin_end<T, void_t<decltype(begin(std::declval<T>()), end(std::declval<T>()))>>
766  : std::true_type
767 {
768 };
769 
770 } // namespace detect
771 
772 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
773 
774 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_DETECT_HPP */
775 
776 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
777 
778 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
779 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
780 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
781 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
782 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
783 //
784 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
785 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
786 
787 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_TYPE_TRAITS_HPP
788 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_TYPE_TRAITS_HPP
789 
790 #include <iterator>
791 #include <limits>
792 #include <type_traits>
793 
794 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
795 
796 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/detect.hpp>
797 
798 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
799 
800 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
801 
807 template <typename Comparator, typename T, typename U, typename = void>
808 struct is_comparable : std::false_type
809 {
810 };
811 
816 template <typename Comparator, typename T, typename U>
817 struct is_comparable<
818  Comparator, T, U,
819  void_t<decltype(std::declval<Comparator>()(std::declval<T>(), std::declval<U>())),
820  decltype(std::declval<Comparator>()(std::declval<U>(), std::declval<T>()))>>
821  : std::true_type
822 {
823 };
824 
829 template <typename Comparator, typename ObjectKeyType, typename KeyType>
830 using is_usable_as_key_type =
831  typename std::conditional<is_comparable<Comparator, ObjectKeyType, KeyType>::value,
832  std::true_type, std::false_type>::type;
833 
837 template <typename IntegralType, typename = void> struct is_non_bool_integral : std::false_type
838 {
839 };
840 
844 template <typename IntegralType>
845 struct is_non_bool_integral<
846  IntegralType, enable_if_t<conjunction<std::is_integral<IntegralType>,
847  negation<std::is_same<bool, IntegralType>>>::value>>
848  : std::true_type
849 {
850 };
851 
854 template <typename... Types> using is_all_signed = conjunction<std::is_signed<Types>...>;
855 
858 template <typename... Types> using is_all_unsigned = conjunction<std::is_unsigned<Types>...>;
859 
865 template <typename TargetIntegerType, typename CompatibleIntegerType, typename = void>
866 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type
867 {
868 };
869 
874 template <typename TargetIntegerType, typename CompatibleIntegerType>
875 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<
876  TargetIntegerType, CompatibleIntegerType,
877  enable_if_t<is_non_bool_integral<CompatibleIntegerType>::value>> : std::true_type
878 {
879 };
880 
885 template <typename TargetIntegerType, typename CompatibleIntegerType>
886 struct is_compatible_integer_type
887  : is_compatible_integer_type_impl<TargetIntegerType, CompatibleIntegerType>
888 {
889 };
890 
894 template <typename T, typename = void> struct is_complete_type : std::false_type
895 {
896 };
897 
900 template <typename T> struct is_complete_type<T, decltype(void(sizeof(T)))> : std::true_type
901 {
902 };
903 
907 template <typename ItrType, typename T>
908 using is_iterator_of =
909  std::is_same<remove_cv_t<typename std::iterator_traits<ItrType>::value_type>, T>;
910 
913 template <typename T> struct static_const
914 {
915  static FK_YAML_INLINE_VAR constexpr T value{}; // NOLINT(readability-identifier-naming)
916 };
917 
918 #ifndef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
923 template <typename T> constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
924 #endif
925 
928 template <typename T> struct type_tag
929 {
931  using type = T;
932 };
933 
936 template <typename... Types> struct get_head_type;
937 
940 template <> struct get_head_type<>
941 {
943  using type = void;
944 };
945 
950 template <typename First, typename... Rest> struct get_head_type<First, Rest...>
951 {
953  using type = First;
954 };
955 
958 template <typename... Types> using head_type = typename get_head_type<Types...>::type;
959 
960 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
961 
962 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_TYPE_TRAITS_HPP */
963 
964 // #include <fkYAML/fkyaml_fwd.hpp>
965 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
966 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
967 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
968 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
969 //
970 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
971 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
972 
973 #ifndef FK_YAML_FKYAML_FWD_HPP
974 #define FK_YAML_FKYAML_FWD_HPP
975 
976 #include <cstdint>
977 #include <map>
978 #include <string>
979 #include <vector>
980 
981 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/version_macros.hpp>
982 
983 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
984 
988 template <typename ValueType, typename = void> class node_value_converter;
989 
992 template <template <typename, typename...> class SequenceType = std::vector,
993  template <typename, typename, typename...> class MappingType = std::map,
994  typename BooleanType = bool, typename IntegerType = std::int64_t,
995  typename FloatNumberType = double, typename StringType = std::string,
996  template <typename, typename = void> class ConverterType = node_value_converter>
997 class basic_node;
998 
1001 using node = basic_node<>;
1002 
1009 template <typename Key, typename Value, typename IgnoredCompare, typename Allocator>
1010 class ordered_map;
1011 
1012 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END
1013 
1014 #endif /* FK_YAML_FKYAML_FWD_HPP */
1015 
1016 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1017 
1019 // is_basic_node traits
1021 
1024 template <typename T> struct is_basic_node : std::false_type
1025 {
1026 };
1027 
1036 template <template <typename, typename...> class SequenceType,
1037  template <typename, typename, typename...> class MappingType, typename BooleanType,
1038  typename IntegerType, typename FloatNumberType, typename StringType,
1039  template <typename, typename> class Converter>
1040 struct is_basic_node<basic_node<SequenceType, MappingType, BooleanType, IntegerType,
1041  FloatNumberType, StringType, Converter>> : std::true_type
1042 {
1043 };
1044 
1046 // is_node_ref_storage traits
1048 
1049 // forward declaration for node_ref_storage<...>
1050 template <typename> class node_ref_storage;
1051 
1055 template <typename T> struct is_node_ref_storage : std::false_type
1056 {
1057 };
1058 
1061 template <typename T> struct is_node_ref_storage<node_ref_storage<T>> : std::true_type
1062 {
1063 };
1064 
1066 // basic_node conversion API representative types
1068 
1072 template <typename T, typename... Args>
1073 using from_node_function_t = decltype(T::from_node(std::declval<Args>()...));
1074 
1078 template <typename T, typename... Args>
1079 using to_node_function_t = decltype(T::to_node(std::declval<Args>()...));
1080 
1082 // basic_node conversion API detection traits
1084 
1090 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T, typename = void>
1091 struct has_from_node : std::false_type
1092 {
1093 };
1094 
1099 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T>
1100 struct has_from_node<BasicNodeType, T, enable_if_t<!is_basic_node<T>::value>>
1101 {
1102  using converter = typename BasicNodeType::template value_converter_type<T, void>;
1103 
1104  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-identifier-naming)
1105  static constexpr bool value =
1106  is_detected_exact<void, from_node_function_t, converter, const BasicNodeType &, T &>::value;
1107 };
1108 
1115 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T, typename = void> struct has_to_node : std::false_type
1116 {
1117 };
1118 
1122 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T>
1123 struct has_to_node<BasicNodeType, T, enable_if_t<!is_basic_node<T>::value>>
1124 {
1125  using converter = typename BasicNodeType::template value_converter_type<T, void>;
1126 
1127  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-identifier-naming)
1128  static constexpr bool value =
1129  is_detected_exact<void, to_node_function_t, converter, BasicNodeType &, T>::value;
1130 };
1131 
1133 // is_node_compatible_type traits
1135 
1141 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename CompatibleType, typename = void>
1142 struct is_node_compatible_type_impl : std::false_type
1143 {
1144 };
1145 
1150 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename CompatibleType>
1151 struct is_node_compatible_type_impl<
1152  BasicNodeType, CompatibleType,
1153  enable_if_t<conjunction<is_complete_type<CompatibleType>,
1154  has_to_node<BasicNodeType, CompatibleType>>::value>> : std::true_type
1155 {
1156 };
1157 
1161 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename CompatibleType>
1162 struct is_node_compatible_type : is_node_compatible_type_impl<BasicNodeType, CompatibleType>
1163 {
1164 };
1165 
1166 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
1167 
1168 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_META_NODE_TRAITS_HPP */
1169 
1170 // #include <fkYAML/yaml_version_type.hpp>
1171 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1172 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1173 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1174 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1175 //
1176 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1177 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1178 
1179 #ifndef FK_YAML_YAML_VERSION_TYPE_HPP
1180 #define FK_YAML_YAML_VERSION_TYPE_HPP
1181 
1182 #include <cstdint>
1183 
1184 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1185 
1186 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
1187 
1188 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1189 
1190 enum class yaml_version_type : std::uint8_t
1191 {
1192  VERSION_1_1,
1193  VERSION_1_2,
1194 };
1195 
1196 inline const char *to_string(yaml_version_type t) noexcept
1197 {
1198  switch (t)
1199  {
1200  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_1:
1201  return "VERSION_1_1";
1202  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_2:
1203  return "VERSION_1_2";
1204  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1205  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1206  }
1207 }
1208 
1209 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END
1210 
1211 #endif /* FK_YAML_YAML_VERSION_TYPE_HPP */
1212 
1213 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1214 
1216 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename = enable_if_t<is_basic_node<BasicNodeType>::value>>
1217 struct document_metainfo
1218 {
1220  yaml_version_type version{yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_2};
1222  bool is_version_specified{false};
1224  std::string primary_handle_prefix;
1226  std::string secondary_handle_prefix;
1228  std::map<std::string /*handle*/, std::string /*prefix*/> named_handle_map;
1230  std::multimap<std::string /*anchor name*/, BasicNodeType> anchor_table{};
1231 };
1232 
1233 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
1234 
1235 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_DOCUMENT_METAINFO_HPP */
1236 
1237 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/deserializer.hpp>
1238 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1239 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1240 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1241 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1242 //
1243 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1244 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1245 
1246 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_DESERIALIZER_HPP
1247 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_DESERIALIZER_HPP
1248 
1249 #include <algorithm>
1250 #include <deque>
1251 #include <vector>
1252 
1253 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1254 
1255 // #include <fkYAML/detail/document_metainfo.hpp>
1256 
1257 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/lexical_analyzer.hpp>
1258 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1259 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1260 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1261 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1262 //
1263 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1264 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1265 
1266 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_LEXICAL_ANALYZER_HPP
1267 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_LEXICAL_ANALYZER_HPP
1268 
1269 #include <algorithm>
1270 #include <cctype>
1271 #include <cstdlib>
1272 
1273 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1274 
1275 // #include <fkYAML/detail/assert.hpp>
1276 
1277 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/uri_encoding.hpp>
1278 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1279 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1280 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1281 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1282 //
1283 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1284 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1285 
1286 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_URI_ENCODING_HPP
1287 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_URI_ENCODING_HPP
1288 
1289 #include <cctype>
1290 #include <string>
1291 
1292 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1293 
1294 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1295 
1297 class uri_encoding
1298 {
1299  public:
1304  static bool validate(const char *begin, const char *end) noexcept
1305  {
1306  if (begin == end)
1307  {
1308  return true;
1309  }
1310 
1311  const char *current = begin;
1312 
1313  for (; current != end; ++current)
1314  {
1315  if (*current == '%')
1316  {
1317  const bool are_valid_octets = validate_octets(++current, end);
1318  if (!are_valid_octets)
1319  {
1320  return false;
1321  }
1322 
1323  continue;
1324  }
1325 
1326  const bool is_allowed_character = validate_character(*current);
1327  if (!is_allowed_character)
1328  {
1329  return false;
1330  }
1331  }
1332 
1333  return true;
1334  }
1335 
1336  private:
1341  static bool validate_octets(const char *&begin, const char *&end)
1342  {
1343  for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++, ++begin)
1344  {
1345  if (begin == end)
1346  {
1347  return false;
1348  }
1349 
1350  // Normalize a character for a-f/A-F comparison
1351  const int octet = std::tolower(*begin);
1352 
1353  if ('0' <= octet && octet <= '9')
1354  {
1355  continue;
1356  }
1357 
1358  if ('a' <= octet && octet <= 'f')
1359  {
1360  continue;
1361  }
1362 
1363  return false;
1364  }
1365 
1366  return true;
1367  }
1368 
1372  static bool validate_character(const char c)
1373  {
1374  // Check if the current character is one of reserved/unreserved characters which are allowed
1375  // for use. See the following links for details:
1376  // * reserved characters: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.2
1377  // * unreserved characters: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.3
1378 
1379  switch (c)
1380  {
1381  // reserved characters (gen-delims)
1382  case ':':
1383  case '/':
1384  case '?':
1385  case '#':
1386  case '[':
1387  case ']':
1388  case '@':
1389  // reserved characters (sub-delims)
1390  case '!':
1391  case '$':
1392  case '&':
1393  case '\'':
1394  case '(':
1395  case ')':
1396  case '*':
1397  case '+':
1398  case ',':
1399  case ';':
1400  case '=':
1401  // unreserved characters
1402  case '-':
1403  case '.':
1404  case '_':
1405  case '~':
1406  return true;
1407  default:
1408  // alphabets and numbers are also allowed.
1409  return static_cast<bool>(std::isalnum(c));
1410  }
1411  }
1412 };
1413 
1414 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
1415 
1416 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_URI_ENCODING_HPP */
1417 
1418 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/utf_encodings.hpp>
1419 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1420 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1421 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1422 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1423 //
1424 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1425 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1426 
1427 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_UTF_ENCODINGS_HPP
1428 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_UTF_ENCODINGS_HPP
1429 
1430 #include <array>
1431 #include <cstdint>
1432 
1433 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1434 
1435 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
1436 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1437 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1438 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1439 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1440 //
1441 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1442 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1443 
1444 #ifndef FK_YAML_EXCEPTION_HPP
1445 #define FK_YAML_EXCEPTION_HPP
1446 
1447 #include <array>
1448 #include <initializer_list>
1449 #include <stdexcept>
1450 #include <string>
1451 
1452 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1453 
1454 // #include <fkYAML/detail/string_formatter.hpp>
1455 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1456 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1457 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1458 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1459 //
1460 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1461 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1462 
1463 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_STRING_FORMATTER_HPP
1464 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_STRING_FORMATTER_HPP
1465 
1466 #include <cstdarg>
1467 #include <cstdio>
1468 #include <memory>
1469 #include <string>
1470 
1471 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1472 
1473 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1474 
1475 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cert-dcl50-cpp)
1476 inline std::string format(const char *fmt, ...)
1477 {
1478  // NOLINTBEGIN(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-array-to-pointer-decay,hicpp-no-array-decay)
1479  va_list vl;
1480  va_start(vl, fmt);
1481  int size = std::vsnprintf(nullptr, 0, fmt, vl);
1482  va_end(vl);
1483 
1484  // LCOV_EXCL_START
1485  if (size < 0)
1486  {
1487  return "";
1488  }
1489  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
1490 
1491  const std::unique_ptr<char[]> buffer{new char[size + 1]{}};
1492 
1493  va_start(vl, fmt);
1494  size = std::vsnprintf(buffer.get(), size + 1, fmt, vl);
1495  va_end(vl);
1496  // NOLINTEND(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-array-to-pointer-decay,hicpp-no-array-decay)
1497 
1498  return {buffer.get(), static_cast<std::size_t>(size)};
1499 }
1500 
1501 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
1502 
1503 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_STRING_FORMATTER_HPP */
1504 
1505 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/node_t.hpp>
1506 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1507 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1508 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1509 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1510 //
1511 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1512 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1513 
1514 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_NODE_T_HPP
1515 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_NODE_T_HPP
1516 
1517 #include <cstdint>
1518 
1519 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1520 
1521 // #include <fkYAML/node_type.hpp>
1522 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
1523 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
1524 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
1525 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
1526 //
1527 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
1528 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
1529 
1530 #ifndef FK_YAML_NODE_TYPE_HPP
1531 #define FK_YAML_NODE_TYPE_HPP
1532 
1533 #include <cstdint>
1534 
1535 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
1536 
1537 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
1538 
1539 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1540 
1541 enum class node_type : std::uint8_t
1542 {
1543  SEQUENCE,
1544  MAPPING,
1545  NULL_OBJECT,
1546  BOOLEAN,
1547  INTEGER,
1548  FLOAT,
1549  STRING,
1550 };
1551 
1552 inline const char *to_string(node_type t) noexcept
1553 {
1554  switch (t)
1555  {
1556  case node_type::SEQUENCE:
1557  return "SEQUENCE";
1558  case node_type::MAPPING:
1559  return "MAPPING";
1560  case node_type::NULL_OBJECT:
1561  return "NULL_OBJECT";
1562  case node_type::BOOLEAN:
1563  return "BOOLEAN";
1564  case node_type::INTEGER:
1565  return "INTEGER";
1566  case node_type::FLOAT:
1567  return "FLOAT";
1568  case node_type::STRING:
1569  return "STRING";
1570  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1571  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1572  }
1573 }
1574 
1575 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END
1576 
1577 #endif /* FK_YAML_NODE_TYPE_HPP */
1578 
1579 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1580 
1582 enum class node_t : std::uint8_t
1583 {
1584  SEQUENCE,
1585  MAPPING,
1586  NULL_OBJECT,
1587  BOOLEAN,
1588  INTEGER,
1589  FLOAT_NUMBER,
1590  STRING,
1591 };
1592 
1593 inline const char *to_string(node_t t) noexcept
1594 {
1595  switch (t)
1596  {
1597  case node_t::SEQUENCE:
1598  return "sequence";
1599  case node_t::MAPPING:
1600  return "mapping";
1601  case node_t::NULL_OBJECT:
1602  return "null";
1603  case node_t::BOOLEAN:
1604  return "boolean";
1605  case node_t::INTEGER:
1606  return "integer";
1607  case node_t::FLOAT_NUMBER:
1608  return "float";
1609  case node_t::STRING:
1610  return "string";
1611  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1612  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1613  }
1614 }
1615 
1616 inline node_t convert_from_node_type(node_type t)
1617 {
1618  switch (t)
1619  {
1620  case node_type::SEQUENCE:
1621  return node_t::SEQUENCE;
1622  case node_type::MAPPING:
1623  return node_t::MAPPING;
1624  case node_type::NULL_OBJECT:
1625  return node_t::NULL_OBJECT;
1626  case node_type::BOOLEAN:
1627  return node_t::BOOLEAN;
1628  case node_type::INTEGER:
1629  return node_t::INTEGER;
1630  case node_type::FLOAT:
1631  return node_t::FLOAT_NUMBER;
1632  case node_type::STRING:
1633  return node_t::STRING;
1634  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1635  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1636  }
1637 }
1638 
1639 inline node_type convert_to_node_type(node_t t)
1640 {
1641  switch (t)
1642  {
1643  case node_t::SEQUENCE:
1644  return node_type::SEQUENCE;
1645  case node_t::MAPPING:
1646  return node_type::MAPPING;
1647  case node_t::NULL_OBJECT:
1648  return node_type::NULL_OBJECT;
1649  case node_t::BOOLEAN:
1650  return node_type::BOOLEAN;
1651  case node_t::INTEGER:
1652  return node_type::INTEGER;
1653  case node_t::FLOAT_NUMBER:
1654  return node_type::FLOAT;
1655  case node_t::STRING:
1656  return node_type::STRING;
1657  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1658  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1659  }
1660 }
1661 
1662 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
1663 
1664 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_NODE_T_HPP */
1665 
1666 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1667 
1670 class exception : public std::exception
1671 {
1672  public:
1675  exception() = default;
1676 
1680  explicit exception(const char *msg) noexcept
1681  {
1682  if (msg)
1683  {
1684  m_error_msg = msg;
1685  }
1686  }
1687 
1688  public:
1693  const char *what() const noexcept override
1694  {
1695  return m_error_msg.c_str();
1696  }
1697 
1698  private:
1700  std::string m_error_msg;
1701 };
1702 
1705 class invalid_encoding : public exception
1706 {
1707  public:
1711  explicit invalid_encoding(const char *msg, const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> &u8) noexcept
1712  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, u8).c_str())
1713  {
1714  }
1715 
1720  explicit invalid_encoding(const char *msg, std::array<char16_t, 2> u16) noexcept
1721  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, u16).c_str())
1722  {
1723  }
1724 
1728  explicit invalid_encoding(const char *msg, char32_t u32) noexcept
1729  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, u32).c_str())
1730  {
1731  }
1732 
1733  private:
1734  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg,
1735  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> &u8) noexcept
1736  {
1737  const auto *itr = u8.begin();
1738  const auto *end_itr = u8.end();
1739  std::string formatted = detail::format("invalid_encoding: %s in=[ 0x%02x", msg, *itr++);
1740  while (itr != end_itr)
1741  {
1742  formatted += detail::format(", 0x%02x", *itr++);
1743  }
1744  formatted += " ]";
1745  return formatted;
1746  }
1747 
1753  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg, std::array<char16_t, 2> u16) noexcept
1754  {
1755  // uint16_t is large enough for UTF-16 encoded elements.
1756  return detail::format("invalid_encoding: %s in=[ 0x%04x, 0x%04x ]", msg,
1757  static_cast<uint16_t>(u16[0]), static_cast<uint16_t>(u16[1]));
1758  }
1759 
1764  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg, char32_t u32) noexcept
1765  {
1766  // uint32_t is large enough for UTF-32 encoded elements.
1767  return detail::format("invalid_encoding: %s in=0x%08x", msg, static_cast<uint32_t>(u32));
1768  }
1769 };
1770 
1773 class parse_error : public exception
1774 {
1775  public:
1781  explicit parse_error(const char *msg, uint32_t lines, uint32_t cols_in_line) noexcept
1782  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, lines, cols_in_line).c_str())
1783  {
1784  }
1785 
1786  private:
1787  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg, uint32_t lines,
1788  uint32_t cols_in_line) noexcept
1789  {
1790  return detail::format("parse_error: %s (at line %u, column %u)", msg, lines, cols_in_line);
1791  }
1792 };
1793 
1796 class type_error : public exception
1797 {
1798  public:
1802  explicit type_error(const char *msg, node_type type) noexcept
1803  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, type).c_str())
1804  {
1805  }
1806 
1811  FK_YAML_DEPRECATED("Since 0.3.12; Use explicit type_error(const char*, node_type)")
1812  explicit type_error(const char *msg, detail::node_t type) noexcept
1813  : type_error(msg, detail::convert_to_node_type(type))
1814  {
1815  }
1816 
1817  private:
1822  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg, node_type type) noexcept
1823  {
1824  return detail::format("type_error: %s type=%s", msg, to_string(type));
1825  }
1826 };
1827 
1830 class out_of_range : public exception
1831 {
1832  public:
1835  explicit out_of_range(int index) noexcept : exception(generate_error_message(index).c_str())
1836  {
1837  }
1838 
1841  explicit out_of_range(const char *key) noexcept : exception(generate_error_message(key).c_str())
1842  {
1843  }
1844 
1845  private:
1846  static std::string generate_error_message(int index) noexcept
1847  {
1848  return detail::format("out_of_range: index %d is out of range", index);
1849  }
1850 
1851  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *key) noexcept
1852  {
1853  return detail::format("out_of_range: key \'%s\' is not found.", key);
1854  }
1855 };
1856 
1859 class invalid_tag : public exception
1860 {
1861  public:
1865  explicit invalid_tag(const char *msg, const char *tag)
1866  : exception(generate_error_message(msg, tag).c_str())
1867  {
1868  }
1869 
1870  private:
1871  static std::string generate_error_message(const char *msg, const char *tag) noexcept
1872  {
1873  return detail::format("invalid_tag: %s tag=%s", msg, tag);
1874  }
1875 };
1876 
1877 FK_YAML_NAMESPACE_END
1878 
1879 #endif /* FK_YAML_EXCEPTION_HPP */
1880 
1881 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
1882 
1884 // UTF-8 Encoding ///
1886 
1888 namespace utf8
1889 {
1890 
1894 inline uint32_t get_num_bytes(uint8_t first_byte)
1895 {
1896  // The first byte starts with 0b0XXX'XXXX -> 1-byte character
1897  if (first_byte < 0x80)
1898  {
1899  return 1;
1900  }
1901  // The first byte starts with 0b110X'XXXX -> 2-byte character
1902  if ((first_byte & 0xE0) == 0xC0)
1903  {
1904  return 2;
1905  }
1906  // The first byte starts with 0b1110'XXXX -> 3-byte character
1907  if ((first_byte & 0xF0) == 0xE0)
1908  {
1909  return 3;
1910  }
1911  // The first byte starts with 0b1111'0XXX -> 4-byte character
1912  if ((first_byte & 0xF8) == 0xF0)
1913  {
1914  return 4;
1915  }
1916 
1917  // The first byte starts with 0b10XX'XXXX or 0b1111'1XXX -> invalid
1918  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", {first_byte});
1919 }
1920 
1924 inline bool validate(const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> &byte_array) noexcept
1925 {
1926  switch (byte_array.size())
1927  {
1928  case 1:
1929  // U+0000..U+007F
1930  return *byte_array.begin() <= 0x7Fu;
1931  case 2: {
1932  const auto *itr = byte_array.begin();
1933  const uint8_t first = *itr++;
1934  const uint8_t second = *itr;
1935 
1936  // U+0080..U+07FF
1937  // 1st Byte: 0xC2..0xDF
1938  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1939  if (0xC2u <= first && first <= 0xDFu)
1940  {
1941  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0xBFu)
1942  {
1943  return true;
1944  }
1945  }
1946 
1947  // The rest of byte combinations are invalid.
1948  return false;
1949  }
1950  case 3: {
1951  const auto *itr = byte_array.begin();
1952  const uint8_t first = *itr++;
1953  const uint8_t second = *itr++;
1954  const uint8_t third = *itr;
1955 
1956  // U+1000..U+CFFF:
1957  // 1st Byte: 0xE0..0xEC
1958  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1959  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1960  if (0xE0u <= first && first <= 0xECu)
1961  {
1962  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0xBFu)
1963  {
1964  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
1965  {
1966  return true;
1967  }
1968  }
1969  return false;
1970  }
1971 
1972  // U+D000..U+D7FF:
1973  // 1st Byte: 0xED
1974  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0x9F
1975  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1976  if (first == 0xEDu)
1977  {
1978  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0x9Fu)
1979  {
1980  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
1981  {
1982  return true;
1983  }
1984  }
1985  return false;
1986  }
1987 
1988  // U+E000..U+FFFF:
1989  // 1st Byte: 0xEE..0xEF
1990  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1991  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
1992  if (first == 0xEEu || first == 0xEFu)
1993  {
1994  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0xBFu)
1995  {
1996  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
1997  {
1998  return true;
1999  }
2000  }
2001  return false;
2002  }
2003 
2004  // The rest of byte combinations are invalid.
2005  return false;
2006  }
2007  case 4: {
2008  const auto *itr = byte_array.begin();
2009  const uint8_t first = *itr++;
2010  const uint8_t second = *itr++;
2011  const uint8_t third = *itr++;
2012  const uint8_t fourth = *itr;
2013 
2014  // U+10000..U+3FFFF:
2015  // 1st Byte: 0xF0
2016  // 2nd Byte: 0x90..0xBF
2017  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2018  // 4th Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2019  if (first == 0xF0u)
2020  {
2021  if (0x90u <= second && second <= 0xBFu)
2022  {
2023  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
2024  {
2025  if (0x80u <= fourth && fourth <= 0xBFu)
2026  {
2027  return true;
2028  }
2029  }
2030  }
2031  return false;
2032  }
2033 
2034  // U+40000..U+FFFFF:
2035  // 1st Byte: 0xF1..0xF3
2036  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2037  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2038  // 4th Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2039  if (0xF1u <= first && first <= 0xF3u)
2040  {
2041  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0xBFu)
2042  {
2043  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
2044  {
2045  if (0x80u <= fourth && fourth <= 0xBFu)
2046  {
2047  return true;
2048  }
2049  }
2050  }
2051  return false;
2052  }
2053 
2054  // U+100000..U+10FFFF:
2055  // 1st Byte: 0xF4
2056  // 2nd Byte: 0x80..0x8F
2057  // 3rd Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2058  // 4th Byte: 0x80..0xBF
2059  if (first == 0xF4u)
2060  {
2061  if (0x80u <= second && second <= 0x8Fu)
2062  {
2063  if (0x80u <= third && third <= 0xBFu)
2064  {
2065  if (0x80u <= fourth && fourth <= 0xBFu)
2066  {
2067  return true;
2068  }
2069  }
2070  }
2071  return false;
2072  }
2073 
2074  // The rest of byte combinations are invalid.
2075  return false;
2076  }
2077  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2078  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2079  }
2080 }
2081 
2087 inline void from_utf16(std::array<char16_t, 2> utf16, std::array<uint8_t, 4> &utf8,
2088  uint32_t &consumed_size, uint32_t &encoded_size)
2089 {
2090  if (utf16[0] < 0x80u)
2091  {
2092  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf16[0] & 0x7Fu);
2093  consumed_size = 1;
2094  encoded_size = 1;
2095  }
2096  else if (utf16[0] <= 0x7FFu)
2097  {
2098  const auto utf8_chunk =
2099  static_cast<uint16_t>(0xC080u | ((utf16[0] & 0x07C0u) << 2) | (utf16[0] & 0x3Fu));
2100  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF00u) >> 8);
2101  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x00FFu);
2102  consumed_size = 1;
2103  encoded_size = 2;
2104  }
2105  else if (utf16[0] < 0xD800u || 0xE000u <= utf16[0])
2106  {
2107  const auto utf8_chunk =
2108  static_cast<uint32_t>(0xE08080u | ((utf16[0] & 0xF000u) << 4) |
2109  ((utf16[0] & 0x0FC0u) << 2) | (utf16[0] & 0x3Fu));
2110  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF0000u) >> 16);
2111  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x00FF00u) >> 8);
2112  utf8[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x0000FFu);
2113  consumed_size = 1;
2114  encoded_size = 3;
2115  }
2116  else if (utf16[0] <= 0xDBFFu && 0xDC00u <= utf16[1] && utf16[1] <= 0xDFFFu)
2117  {
2118  // surrogate pair
2119  const uint32_t code_point = 0x10000u + ((utf16[0] & 0x03FFu) << 10) + (utf16[1] & 0x03FFu);
2120  const auto utf8_chunk = static_cast<uint32_t>(
2121  0xF0808080u | ((code_point & 0x1C0000u) << 6) | ((code_point & 0x03F000u) << 4) |
2122  ((code_point & 0x0FC0u) << 2) | (code_point & 0x3Fu));
2123  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF000000u) >> 24);
2124  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x00FF0000u) >> 16);
2125  utf8[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x0000FF00u) >> 8);
2126  utf8[3] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x000000FFu);
2127  consumed_size = 2;
2128  encoded_size = 4;
2129  }
2130  else
2131  {
2132  throw invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-16 encoding detected.", utf16);
2133  }
2134 }
2135 
2140 inline void from_utf32(const char32_t utf32, std::array<uint8_t, 4> &utf8, uint32_t &encoded_size)
2141 {
2142  if (utf32 < 0x80u)
2143  {
2144  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf32 & 0x007F);
2145  encoded_size = 1;
2146  }
2147  else if (utf32 <= 0x7FFu)
2148  {
2149  const auto utf8_chunk =
2150  static_cast<uint16_t>(0xC080u | ((utf32 & 0x07C0u) << 2) | (utf32 & 0x3Fu));
2151  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF00u) >> 8);
2152  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x00FFu);
2153  encoded_size = 2;
2154  }
2155  else if (utf32 <= 0xFFFFu)
2156  {
2157  const auto utf8_chunk = static_cast<uint32_t>(0xE08080u | ((utf32 & 0xF000u) << 4) |
2158  ((utf32 & 0x0FC0u) << 2) | (utf32 & 0x3F));
2159  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF0000u) >> 16);
2160  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x00FF00u) >> 8);
2161  utf8[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x0000FFu);
2162  encoded_size = 3;
2163  }
2164  else if (utf32 <= 0x10FFFFu)
2165  {
2166  const auto utf8_chunk = static_cast<uint32_t>(0xF0808080u | ((utf32 & 0x1C0000u) << 6) |
2167  ((utf32 & 0x03F000u) << 4) |
2168  ((utf32 & 0x0FC0u) << 2) | (utf32 & 0x3Fu));
2169  utf8[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0xFF000000u) >> 24);
2170  utf8[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x00FF0000u) >> 16);
2171  utf8[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>((utf8_chunk & 0x0000FF00u) >> 8);
2172  utf8[3] = static_cast<uint8_t>(utf8_chunk & 0x000000FFu);
2173  encoded_size = 4;
2174  }
2175  else
2176  {
2177  throw invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-32 encoding detected.", utf32);
2178  }
2179 }
2180 
2181 } // namespace utf8
2182 
2183 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
2184 
2185 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_UTF_ENCODINGS_HPP */
2186 
2187 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/block_scalar_header.hpp>
2188 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
2189 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
2190 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
2191 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
2192 //
2193 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
2194 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
2195 
2196 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_BLOCK_SCALAR_HEADER_HPP
2197 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_BLOCK_SCALAR_HEADER_HPP
2198 
2199 #include <cstdint>
2200 
2201 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
2202 
2203 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
2204 
2206 enum class chomping_indicator_t : std::uint8_t
2207 {
2208  STRIP,
2209  CLIP,
2211  KEEP,
2212 };
2213 
2215 struct block_scalar_header
2216 {
2218  chomping_indicator_t chomp{chomping_indicator_t::CLIP};
2220  uint32_t indent{0};
2221 };
2222 
2223 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
2224 
2225 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_BLOCK_SCALAR_HEADER_HPP */
2226 
2227 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/position_tracker.hpp>
2228 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
2229 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
2230 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
2231 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
2232 //
2233 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
2234 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
2235 
2236 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_POSITION_TRACKER_HPP
2237 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_POSITION_TRACKER_HPP
2238 
2239 #include <algorithm>
2240 
2241 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
2242 
2243 // #include <fkYAML/detail/str_view.hpp>
2244 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
2245 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
2246 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
2247 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
2248 //
2249 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
2250 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
2251 
2252 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_STR_VIEW_HPP
2253 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_STR_VIEW_HPP
2254 
2255 #include <limits>
2256 #include <string>
2257 
2258 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
2259 
2260 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
2261 
2262 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
2263 
2264 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
2265 
2266 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
2267 
2277 template <typename CharT, typename Traits = std::char_traits<CharT>> class basic_str_view
2278 {
2279  static_assert(!std::is_array<CharT>::value, "CharT must not be an array type.");
2280  static_assert(std::is_trivial<CharT>::value && std::is_standard_layout<CharT>::value,
2281  "CharT must be a trivial, standard layout type.");
2282  static_assert(std::is_same<CharT, typename Traits::char_type>::value,
2283  "CharT & Traits::char_type must be the same type.");
2284 
2285  public:
2287  using traits_type = Traits;
2289  using value_type = CharT;
2291  using pointer = value_type *;
2293  using const_pointer = const value_type *;
2295  using reference = value_type &;
2297  using const_reference = const value_type &;
2299  using const_iterator = const value_type *;
2302  using iterator = const_iterator;
2304  using const_reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator>;
2307  using reverse_iterator = const_reverse_iterator;
2309  using size_type = std::size_t;
2311  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
2312 
2314  static constexpr size_type npos = static_cast<size_type>(-1);
2315 
2317  constexpr basic_str_view() noexcept = default;
2318 
2320  ~basic_str_view() noexcept = default;
2321 
2324  constexpr basic_str_view(const basic_str_view &) noexcept = default;
2325 
2328  constexpr basic_str_view(basic_str_view &&) noexcept = default;
2329 
2334  template <
2335  typename CharPtrT,
2336  enable_if_t<conjunction<negation<std::is_array<CharPtrT>>, std::is_pointer<CharPtrT>,
2337  disjunction<std::is_same<CharPtrT, value_type *>,
2338  std::is_same<CharPtrT, const value_type *>>>::value,
2339  int> = 0>
2340  FK_YAML_CXX17_CONSTEXPR basic_str_view(CharPtrT p_str) noexcept
2341  : m_len(traits_type::length(p_str)), mp_str(p_str)
2342  {
2343  }
2344 
2351  template <std::size_t N>
2352  constexpr basic_str_view(const value_type (&str)[N]) noexcept : m_len(N - 1), mp_str(&str[0])
2353  {
2354  }
2355 
2357  basic_str_view(std::nullptr_t) = delete;
2358 
2363  constexpr basic_str_view(const value_type *p_str, size_type len) noexcept
2364  : m_len(len), mp_str(p_str)
2365  {
2366  }
2367 
2372  template <typename ItrType,
2373  enable_if_t<conjunction<is_iterator_of<ItrType, CharT>,
2374  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
2375  typename std::iterator_traits<
2376  ItrType>::iterator_category>>::value,
2377  int> = 0>
2378  basic_str_view(ItrType first, ItrType last) noexcept : m_len(last - first), mp_str(&*first)
2379  {
2380  }
2381 
2384  basic_str_view(const std::basic_string<CharT> &str) noexcept
2385  : m_len(str.length()), mp_str(str.data())
2386  {
2387  }
2388 
2392  basic_str_view &operator=(const basic_str_view &) noexcept = default;
2393 
2397  basic_str_view &operator=(basic_str_view &&) noexcept = default;
2398 
2401  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
2402  {
2403  return mp_str;
2404  }
2405 
2408  const_iterator end() const noexcept
2409  {
2410  return mp_str + m_len;
2411  }
2412 
2415  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
2416  {
2417  return mp_str;
2418  }
2419 
2422  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
2423  {
2424  return mp_str + m_len;
2425  }
2426 
2429  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
2430  {
2431  return const_reverse_iterator(end());
2432  }
2433 
2436  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
2437  {
2438  return const_reverse_iterator(begin());
2439  }
2440 
2443  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
2444  {
2445  return const_reverse_iterator(end());
2446  }
2447 
2450  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
2451  {
2452  return const_reverse_iterator(begin());
2453  }
2454 
2457  size_type size() const noexcept
2458  {
2459  return m_len;
2460  }
2461 
2464  size_type length() const noexcept
2465  {
2466  return m_len;
2467  }
2468 
2471  constexpr size_type max_size() const noexcept
2472  {
2473  return static_cast<size_type>(std::numeric_limits<difference_type>::max());
2474  }
2475 
2478  bool empty() const noexcept
2479  {
2480  return m_len == 0;
2481  }
2482 
2486  const_reference operator[](size_type pos) const noexcept
2487  {
2488  return *(mp_str + pos);
2489  }
2490 
2496  const_reference at(size_type pos) const
2497  {
2498  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos >= m_len)
2499  {
2500  throw fkyaml::out_of_range(static_cast<int>(pos));
2501  }
2502  return *(mp_str + pos);
2503  }
2504 
2507  const_reference front() const noexcept
2508  {
2509  return *mp_str;
2510  }
2511 
2514  const_reference back() const
2515  {
2516  return *(mp_str + m_len - 1);
2517  }
2518 
2521  const_pointer data() const noexcept
2522  {
2523  return mp_str;
2524  }
2525 
2528  void remove_prefix(size_type n) noexcept
2529  {
2530  mp_str += n;
2531  m_len -= n;
2532  }
2533 
2536  void remove_suffix(size_type n) noexcept
2537  {
2538  m_len -= n;
2539  }
2540 
2543  void swap(basic_str_view &other) noexcept
2544  {
2545  auto tmp = *this;
2546  *this = other;
2547  other = tmp;
2548  }
2549 
2557  size_type copy(CharT *p_str, size_type n, size_type pos = 0) const
2558  {
2559  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos > m_len)
2560  {
2561  throw fkyaml::out_of_range(static_cast<int>(pos));
2562  }
2563  const size_type rlen = std::min(n, m_len - pos);
2564  traits_type::copy(p_str, mp_str + pos, rlen);
2565  return rlen;
2566  }
2567 
2574  basic_str_view substr(size_type pos = 0, size_type n = npos) const
2575  {
2576  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos > m_len)
2577  {
2578  throw fkyaml::out_of_range(static_cast<int>(pos));
2579  }
2580  const size_type rlen = std::min(n, m_len - pos);
2581  return basic_str_view(mp_str + pos, rlen);
2582  }
2583 
2588  int compare(basic_str_view sv) const noexcept
2589  {
2590  const size_type rlen = std::min(m_len, sv.m_len);
2591  int ret = traits_type::compare(mp_str, sv.mp_str, rlen);
2592 
2593  if (ret == 0)
2594  {
2595  using int_limits = std::numeric_limits<int>;
2596  const difference_type diff = m_len > sv.m_len
2597  ? m_len - sv.m_len
2598  : static_cast<difference_type>(-1) *
2599  static_cast<difference_type>(sv.m_len - m_len);
2600 
2601  if (diff > int_limits::max())
2602  {
2603  ret = int_limits::max();
2604  }
2605  else if (diff < int_limits::min())
2606  {
2607  ret = int_limits::min();
2608  }
2609  else
2610  {
2611  ret = static_cast<int>(diff);
2612  }
2613  }
2614 
2615  return ret;
2616  }
2617 
2624  int compare(size_type pos1, size_type n1, basic_str_view sv) const
2625  {
2626  return substr(pos1, n1).compare(sv);
2627  }
2628 
2637  int compare(size_type pos1, size_type n1, basic_str_view sv, size_type pos2, size_type n2) const
2638  {
2639  return substr(pos1, n1).compare(sv.substr(pos2, n2));
2640  }
2641 
2645  int compare(const CharT *s) const
2646  {
2647  return compare(basic_str_view(s));
2648  }
2649 
2656  int compare(size_type pos1, size_type n1, const CharT *s) const
2657  {
2658  return substr(pos1, n1).compare(basic_str_view(s));
2659  }
2660 
2668  int compare(size_type pos1, size_type n1, const CharT *s, size_type n2) const
2669  {
2670  return substr(pos1, n1).compare(basic_str_view(s, n2));
2671  }
2672 
2676  bool starts_with(basic_str_view sv) const
2677  {
2678  return substr(0, sv.size()) == sv;
2679  }
2680 
2684  bool starts_with(CharT c) const noexcept
2685  {
2686  return !empty() && traits_type::eq(front(), c);
2687  }
2688 
2692  bool starts_with(const CharT *s) const
2693  {
2694  return starts_with(basic_str_view(s));
2695  }
2696 
2700  bool ends_with(basic_str_view sv) const noexcept
2701  {
2702  const size_type size = m_len;
2703  const size_type sv_size = sv.size();
2704  return size >= sv_size && traits_type::compare(end() - sv_size, sv.data(), sv_size) == 0;
2705  }
2706 
2710  bool ends_with(CharT c) const noexcept
2711  {
2712  return !empty() && traits_type::eq(back(), c);
2713  }
2714 
2718  bool ends_with(const CharT *s) const noexcept
2719  {
2720  return ends_with(basic_str_view(s));
2721  }
2722 
2726  bool contains(basic_str_view sv) const noexcept
2727  {
2728  return find(sv) != npos;
2729  }
2730 
2734  bool contains(CharT c) const noexcept
2735  {
2736  return find(c) != npos;
2737  }
2738 
2742  bool contains(const CharT *s) const noexcept
2743  {
2744  return find(s) != npos;
2745  }
2746 
2753  size_type find(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2754  {
2755  return find(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
2756  }
2757 
2763  size_type find(CharT c, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2764  {
2765  size_type ret = npos;
2766 
2767  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (pos < m_len)
2768  {
2769  const size_type n = m_len - pos;
2770  const CharT *p_found = traits_type::find(mp_str + pos, n, c);
2771  if (p_found)
2772  {
2773  ret = p_found - mp_str;
2774  }
2775  }
2776 
2777  return ret;
2778  }
2779 
2787  size_type find(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
2788  {
2789  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (n == 0)
2790  {
2791  return pos <= m_len ? pos : npos;
2792  }
2793 
2794  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos >= m_len)
2795  {
2796  return npos;
2797  }
2798 
2799  CharT s0 = s[0];
2800  const CharT *p_first = mp_str + pos;
2801  const CharT *p_last = mp_str + m_len;
2802  size_type len = m_len - pos;
2803 
2804  while (len >= n)
2805  {
2806  // find the first occurence of s0
2807  p_first = traits_type::find(p_first, len - n + 1, s0);
2808  if (!p_first)
2809  {
2810  return npos;
2811  }
2812 
2813  // compare the full strings from the first occurence of s0
2814  if (traits_type::compare(p_first, s, n) == 0)
2815  {
2816  return p_first - mp_str;
2817  }
2818 
2819  len = p_last - (++p_first);
2820  }
2821 
2822  return npos;
2823  }
2824 
2831  size_type find(const CharT *s, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2832  {
2833  return find(basic_str_view(s), pos);
2834  }
2835 
2842  size_type rfind(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
2843  {
2844  return rfind(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
2845  }
2846 
2853  size_type rfind(CharT c, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
2854  {
2855  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_len == 0)
2856  {
2857  return npos;
2858  }
2859 
2860  const size_type idx = std::min(m_len - 1, pos);
2861 
2862  for (size_type i = 0; i <= idx; i++)
2863  {
2864  if (traits_type::eq(mp_str[idx - i], c))
2865  {
2866  return idx - i;
2867  }
2868  }
2869 
2870  return npos;
2871  }
2872 
2880  size_type rfind(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
2881  {
2882  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (n <= m_len)
2883  {
2884  pos = std::min(m_len - n, pos) + 1;
2885 
2886  do
2887  {
2888  if (traits_type::compare(mp_str + --pos, s, n) == 0)
2889  {
2890  return pos;
2891  }
2892  } while (pos > 0);
2893  }
2894 
2895  return npos;
2896  }
2897 
2904  size_type rfind(const CharT *s, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
2905  {
2906  return rfind(basic_str_view(s), pos);
2907  }
2908 
2915  size_type find_first_of(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2916  {
2917  return find_first_of(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
2918  }
2919 
2925  size_type find_first_of(CharT c, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2926  {
2927  return find(c, pos);
2928  }
2929 
2937  size_type find_first_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
2938  {
2939  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (n == 0)
2940  {
2941  return npos;
2942  }
2943 
2944  for (size_type idx = pos; idx < m_len; ++idx)
2945  {
2946  const CharT *p_found = traits_type::find(s, n, mp_str[idx]);
2947  if (p_found)
2948  {
2949  return idx;
2950  }
2951  }
2952 
2953  return npos;
2954  }
2955 
2962  size_type find_first_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
2963  {
2964  return find_first_of(basic_str_view(s), pos);
2965  }
2966 
2973  size_type find_last_of(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
2974  {
2975  return find_last_of(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
2976  }
2977 
2983  size_type find_last_of(CharT c, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
2984  {
2985  return rfind(c, pos);
2986  }
2987 
2995  size_type find_last_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
2996  {
2997  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (n <= m_len)
2998  {
2999  pos = std::min(m_len - n - 1, pos);
3000 
3001  do
3002  {
3003  const CharT *p_found = traits_type::find(s, n, mp_str[pos]);
3004  if (p_found)
3005  {
3006  return pos;
3007  }
3008  } while (pos-- != 0);
3009  }
3010 
3011  return npos;
3012  }
3013 
3020  size_type find_last_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
3021  {
3022  return find_last_of(basic_str_view(s), pos);
3023  }
3024 
3031  size_type find_first_not_of(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
3032  {
3033  return find_first_not_of(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
3034  }
3035 
3041  size_type find_first_not_of(CharT c, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
3042  {
3043  for (; pos < m_len; ++pos)
3044  {
3045  if (!traits_type::eq(mp_str[pos], c))
3046  {
3047  return pos;
3048  }
3049  }
3050 
3051  return npos;
3052  }
3053 
3061  size_type find_first_not_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
3062  {
3063  for (; pos < m_len; ++pos)
3064  {
3065  const CharT *p_found = traits_type::find(s, n, mp_str[pos]);
3066  if (!p_found)
3067  {
3068  return pos;
3069  }
3070  }
3071 
3072  return npos;
3073  }
3074 
3081  size_type find_first_not_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos = 0) const noexcept
3082  {
3083  return find_first_not_of(basic_str_view(s), pos);
3084  }
3085 
3092  size_type find_last_not_of(basic_str_view sv, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
3093  {
3094  return find_last_not_of(sv.mp_str, pos, sv.m_len);
3095  }
3096 
3102  size_type find_last_not_of(CharT c, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
3103  {
3104  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (m_len > 0)
3105  {
3106  pos = std::min(m_len, pos);
3107 
3108  do
3109  {
3110  if (!traits_type::eq(mp_str[--pos], c))
3111  {
3112  return pos;
3113  }
3114  } while (pos > 0);
3115  }
3116 
3117  return npos;
3118  }
3119 
3127  size_type find_last_not_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos, size_type n) const noexcept
3128  {
3129  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (n <= m_len)
3130  {
3131  pos = std::min(m_len - n, pos) + 1;
3132 
3133  do
3134  {
3135  const CharT *p_found = traits_type::find(s, n, mp_str[--pos]);
3136  if (!p_found)
3137  {
3138  return pos;
3139  }
3140  } while (pos > 0);
3141  }
3142 
3143  return npos;
3144  }
3145 
3152  size_type find_last_not_of(const CharT *s, size_type pos = npos) const noexcept
3153  {
3154  return find_last_not_of(basic_str_view(s), pos);
3155  }
3156 
3157  private:
3158  size_type m_len{0};
3159  const value_type *mp_str{nullptr};
3160 };
3161 
3162 // Prior to C++17, a static constexpr class member needs an out-of-class definition.
3163 #ifndef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
3164 
3165 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3166 constexpr typename basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>::size_type basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>::npos;
3167 
3168 #endif // !defined(FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17)
3169 
3176 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3177 inline bool operator==(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3178  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3179 {
3180  // Comparing the lengths first will omit unnecessary value comparison in compare().
3181  return lhs.size() == rhs.size() && lhs.compare(rhs) == 0;
3182 }
3183 
3190 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3191 inline bool operator==(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3192  const std::basic_string<CharT, Traits> &rhs) noexcept
3193 {
3194  return lhs == basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(rhs);
3195 }
3196 
3203 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3204 inline bool operator==(const std::basic_string<CharT, Traits> &lhs,
3205  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3206 {
3207  return basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(lhs) == rhs;
3208 }
3209 
3217 template <typename CharT, typename Traits, std::size_t N>
3218 inline bool operator==(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs, const CharT (&rhs)[N]) noexcept
3219 {
3220  // assume `rhs` is null terminated
3221  return lhs == basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(rhs);
3222 }
3223 
3231 template <typename CharT, typename Traits, std::size_t N>
3232 inline bool operator==(const CharT (&lhs)[N], basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3233 {
3234  // assume `lhs` is null terminated
3235  return basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(lhs) == rhs;
3236 }
3237 
3244 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3245 inline bool operator!=(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3246  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3247 {
3248  return !(lhs == rhs);
3249 }
3250 
3257 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3258 inline bool operator!=(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3259  const std::basic_string<CharT, Traits> &rhs) noexcept
3260 {
3261  return !(lhs == basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(rhs));
3262 }
3263 
3270 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3271 inline bool operator!=(const std::basic_string<CharT, Traits> &lhs,
3272  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3273 {
3274  return !(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(lhs) == rhs);
3275 }
3276 
3284 template <typename CharT, typename Traits, std::size_t N>
3285 inline bool operator!=(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs, const CharT (&rhs)[N]) noexcept
3286 {
3287  // assume `rhs` is null terminated.
3288  return !(lhs == basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(rhs, N - 1));
3289 }
3290 
3298 template <typename CharT, typename Traits, std::size_t N>
3299 inline bool operator!=(const CharT (&lhs)[N], basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3300 {
3301  // assume `lhs` is null terminate
3302  return !(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits>(lhs, N - 1) == rhs);
3303 }
3304 
3311 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3312 inline bool operator<(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs, basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3313 {
3314  return lhs.compare(rhs) < 0;
3315 }
3316 
3323 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3324 inline bool operator<=(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3325  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3326 {
3327  return lhs.compare(rhs) <= 0;
3328 }
3329 
3336 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3337 inline bool operator>(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs, basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3338 {
3339  return lhs.compare(rhs) > 0;
3340 }
3341 
3348 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3349 inline bool operator>=(basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> lhs,
3350  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> rhs) noexcept
3351 {
3352  return lhs.compare(rhs) >= 0;
3353 }
3354 
3361 template <typename CharT, typename Traits>
3362 inline std::basic_ostream<CharT, Traits> &operator<<(std::basic_ostream<CharT, Traits> &os,
3363  basic_str_view<CharT, Traits> sv)
3364 {
3365  return os.write(sv.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(sv.size()));
3366 }
3367 
3369 using str_view = basic_str_view<char>;
3370 
3371 #if FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T
3373 using u8str_view = basic_str_view<char8_t>;
3374 #endif
3375 
3377 using u16str_view = basic_str_view<char16_t>;
3378 
3380 using u32str_view = basic_str_view<char32_t>;
3381 
3382 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
3383 
3384 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_STR_VIEW_HPP */
3385 
3386 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
3387 
3389 class position_tracker
3390 {
3391  public:
3392  void set_target_buffer(str_view buffer) noexcept
3393  {
3394  m_begin = m_last = buffer.begin();
3395  m_end = buffer.end();
3396  }
3397 
3402  void update_position(const char *p_current)
3403  {
3404  const auto diff = static_cast<uint32_t>(p_current - m_last);
3405  if (diff == 0)
3406  {
3407  return;
3408  }
3409 
3410  m_cur_pos += diff;
3411  const uint32_t prev_lines_read = m_lines_read;
3412  m_lines_read += static_cast<uint32_t>(std::count(m_last, p_current, '\n'));
3413  m_last = p_current;
3414 
3415  if (prev_lines_read == m_lines_read)
3416  {
3417  m_cur_pos_in_line += diff;
3418  return;
3419  }
3420 
3421  uint32_t count = 0;
3422  const char *p_begin = m_begin;
3423  while (--p_current != p_begin)
3424  {
3425  if (*p_current == '\n')
3426  {
3427  break;
3428  }
3429  count++;
3430  }
3431  m_cur_pos_in_line = count;
3432  }
3433 
3434  uint32_t get_cur_pos() const noexcept
3435  {
3436  return m_cur_pos;
3437  }
3438 
3441  uint32_t get_cur_pos_in_line() const noexcept
3442  {
3443  return m_cur_pos_in_line;
3444  }
3445 
3448  uint32_t get_lines_read() const noexcept
3449  {
3450  return m_lines_read;
3451  }
3452 
3453  private:
3455  const char *m_begin{};
3457  const char *m_end{};
3459  const char *m_last{};
3461  uint32_t m_cur_pos{0};
3463  uint32_t m_cur_pos_in_line{0};
3465  uint32_t m_lines_read{0};
3466 };
3467 
3468 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
3469 
3470 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_POSITION_TRACKER_HPP */
3471 
3472 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
3473 
3474 // #include <fkYAML/detail/str_view.hpp>
3475 
3476 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/lexical_token_t.hpp>
3477 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
3478 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
3479 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
3480 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
3481 //
3482 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
3483 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
3484 
3485 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_LEXICAL_TOKEN_T_HPP
3486 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_LEXICAL_TOKEN_T_HPP
3487 
3488 #include <cstdint>
3489 
3490 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
3491 
3492 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
3493 
3495 enum class lexical_token_t : std::uint8_t
3496 {
3497  END_OF_BUFFER,
3498  EXPLICIT_KEY_PREFIX,
3499  KEY_SEPARATOR,
3500  VALUE_SEPARATOR,
3501  ANCHOR_PREFIX,
3502  ALIAS_PREFIX,
3503  YAML_VER_DIRECTIVE,
3504  TAG_DIRECTIVE,
3505  TAG_PREFIX,
3506  INVALID_DIRECTIVE,
3507  SEQUENCE_BLOCK_PREFIX,
3508  SEQUENCE_FLOW_BEGIN,
3509  SEQUENCE_FLOW_END,
3510  MAPPING_FLOW_BEGIN,
3511  MAPPING_FLOW_END,
3512  PLAIN_SCALAR,
3513  SINGLE_QUOTED_SCALAR,
3514  DOUBLE_QUOTED_SCALAR,
3515  BLOCK_LITERAL_SCALAR,
3516  BLOCK_FOLDED_SCALAR,
3517  END_OF_DIRECTIVES,
3518  END_OF_DOCUMENT,
3519 };
3520 
3521 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
3522 
3523 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_LEXICAL_TOKEN_T_HPP */
3524 
3525 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
3526 
3527 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
3528 
3530 struct lexical_token
3531 {
3532  lexical_token() = default;
3533 
3534  lexical_token(lexical_token_t t, str_view s) noexcept : type(t), str(s)
3535  {
3536  }
3537 
3538  lexical_token(lexical_token_t t) noexcept : type(t)
3539  {
3540  }
3541 
3542  lexical_token(const lexical_token &) = default;
3543  lexical_token &operator=(const lexical_token &) = default;
3544  lexical_token(lexical_token &&) = default;
3545  lexical_token &operator=(lexical_token &&) = default;
3546  ~lexical_token() = default;
3547 
3549  lexical_token_t type{lexical_token_t::END_OF_BUFFER};
3551  str_view str;
3552 };
3553 
3555 class lexical_analyzer
3556 {
3557  // whether the current context is flow(1) or block(0)
3558  static constexpr uint32_t flow_context_bit = 1u << 0u;
3559  // whether the current document part is directive(1) or content(0)
3560  static constexpr uint32_t document_directive_bit = 1u << 1u;
3561 
3562  public:
3565  explicit lexical_analyzer(str_view input_buffer) noexcept
3566  : m_input_buffer(input_buffer), m_cur_itr(m_input_buffer.begin()),
3567  m_end_itr(m_input_buffer.end())
3568  {
