3569  m_pos_tracker.set_target_buffer(m_input_buffer);
3570  }
3571 
3574  lexical_token get_next_token()
3575  {
3576  skip_white_spaces_and_newline_codes();
3577 
3578  m_token_begin_itr = m_cur_itr;
3579  m_pos_tracker.update_position(m_cur_itr);
3580  m_last_token_begin_pos = m_pos_tracker.get_cur_pos_in_line();
3581  m_last_token_begin_line = m_pos_tracker.get_lines_read();
3582 
3583  if (m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
3584  {
3585  return {lexical_token_t::END_OF_BUFFER};
3586  }
3587 
3588  switch (*m_cur_itr)
3589  {
3590  case '?':
3591  if (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
3592  {
3593  return {lexical_token_t::PLAIN_SCALAR, {m_token_begin_itr, 1}};
3594  }
3595 
3596  if (*m_cur_itr == ' ')
3597  {
3598  return {lexical_token_t::EXPLICIT_KEY_PREFIX};
3599  }
3600  break;
3601  case ':': // key separator
3602  if (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
3603  {
3604  return {lexical_token_t::KEY_SEPARATOR};
3605  }
3606 
3607  switch (*m_cur_itr)
3608  {
3609  case ' ':
3610  case '\t':
3611  case '\n':
3612  return {lexical_token_t::KEY_SEPARATOR};
3613  case ',':
3614  case '[':
3615  case ']':
3616  case '{':
3617  case '}':
3618  if (m_state & flow_context_bit)
3619  {
3620  // Flow indicators are not "safe" to be followed in a flow context.
3621  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#733-plain-style for more details.
3622  return {lexical_token_t::KEY_SEPARATOR};
3623  }
3624  break;
3625  default:
3626  break;
3627  }
3628  break;
3629  case ',': // value separator
3630  ++m_cur_itr;
3631  return {lexical_token_t::VALUE_SEPARATOR};
3632  case '&': // anchor prefix
3633  return {lexical_token_t::ANCHOR_PREFIX, extract_anchor_name()};
3634  case '*': // alias prefix
3635  return {lexical_token_t::ALIAS_PREFIX, extract_anchor_name()};
3636  case '!': // tag prefix
3637  return {lexical_token_t::TAG_PREFIX, extract_tag_name()};
3638  case '#': // comment prefix
3639  scan_comment();
3640  return get_next_token();
3641  case '%': // directive prefix
3642  if (m_state & document_directive_bit)
3643  {
3644  return {scan_directive()};
3645  }
3646  // The '%' character can be safely used as the first character in document contents.
3647  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#912-document-markers for more details.
3648  break;
3649  case '-':
3650  switch (*(m_cur_itr + 1))
3651  {
3652  case ' ':
3653  case '\t':
3654  case '\n':
3655  // Move a cursor to the beginning of the next token.
3656  m_cur_itr += 2;
3657  return {lexical_token_t::SEQUENCE_BLOCK_PREFIX};
3658  default:
3659  break;
3660  }
3661 
3662  if ((m_end_itr - m_cur_itr) > 2)
3663  {
3664  const bool is_dir_end = std::equal(m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr + 3, "---");
3665  if (is_dir_end)
3666  {
3667  m_cur_itr += 3;
3668  return {lexical_token_t::END_OF_DIRECTIVES};
3669  }
3670  }
3671 
3672  break;
3673  case '[': // sequence flow begin
3674  ++m_cur_itr;
3675  return {lexical_token_t::SEQUENCE_FLOW_BEGIN};
3676  case ']': // sequence flow end
3677  ++m_cur_itr;
3678  return {lexical_token_t::SEQUENCE_FLOW_END};
3679  case '{': // mapping flow begin
3680  ++m_cur_itr;
3681  return {lexical_token_t::MAPPING_FLOW_BEGIN};
3682  case '}': // mapping flow end
3683  ++m_cur_itr;
3684  return {lexical_token_t::MAPPING_FLOW_END};
3685  case '@':
3686  emit_error("Any token cannot start with at(@). It is a reserved indicator for YAML.");
3687  case '`':
3688  emit_error("Any token cannot start with grave accent(`). It is a reserved indicator "
3689  "for YAML.");
3690  case '\"':
3691  ++m_token_begin_itr;
3692  return {lexical_token_t::DOUBLE_QUOTED_SCALAR, determine_double_quoted_scalar_range()};
3693  case '\'':
3694  ++m_token_begin_itr;
3695  return {lexical_token_t::SINGLE_QUOTED_SCALAR, determine_single_quoted_scalar_range()};
3696  case '.': {
3697  if ((m_end_itr - m_cur_itr) > 2)
3698  {
3699  const bool is_doc_end = std::equal(m_cur_itr, m_cur_itr + 3, "...");
3700  if (is_doc_end)
3701  {
3702  m_cur_itr += 3;
3703  return {lexical_token_t::END_OF_DOCUMENT};
3704  }
3705  }
3706  break;
3707  }
3708  case '|':
3709  case '>': {
3710  const str_view sv{m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
3711  const std::size_t header_end_pos = sv.find('\n');
3712  FK_YAML_ASSERT(header_end_pos != str_view::npos);
3713  const uint32_t base_indent = get_current_indent_level(&sv[header_end_pos]);
3714 
3715  const lexical_token_t type = *m_token_begin_itr == '|'
3716  ? lexical_token_t::BLOCK_LITERAL_SCALAR
3717  : lexical_token_t::BLOCK_FOLDED_SCALAR;
3718  const str_view header_line = sv.substr(1, header_end_pos - 1);
3719  m_block_scalar_header = convert_to_block_scalar_header(header_line);
3720 
3721  m_token_begin_itr = sv.begin() + (header_end_pos + 1);
3722 
3723  return {type,
3724  determine_block_scalar_content_range(base_indent, m_block_scalar_header.indent,
3725  m_block_scalar_header.indent)};
3726  }
3727  default:
3728  break;
3729  }
3730 
3731  return {lexical_token_t::PLAIN_SCALAR, determine_plain_scalar_range()};
3732  }
3733 
3736  uint32_t get_last_token_begin_pos() const noexcept
3737  {
3738  return m_last_token_begin_pos;
3739  }
3740 
3743  uint32_t get_lines_processed() const noexcept
3744  {
3745  return m_last_token_begin_line;
3746  }
3747 
3750  str_view get_yaml_version() const noexcept
3751  {
3752  return m_yaml_version;
3753  }
3754 
3757  str_view get_tag_handle() const noexcept
3758  {
3759  return m_tag_handle;
3760  }
3761 
3764  str_view get_tag_prefix() const noexcept
3765  {
3766  return m_tag_prefix;
3767  }
3768 
3771  block_scalar_header get_block_scalar_header() const noexcept
3772  {
3773  return m_block_scalar_header;
3774  }
3775 
3778  void set_context_state(bool is_flow_context) noexcept
3779  {
3780  m_state &= ~flow_context_bit;
3781  if (is_flow_context)
3782  {
3783  m_state |= flow_context_bit;
3784  }
3785  }
3786 
3789  void set_document_state(bool is_directive) noexcept
3790  {
3791  m_state &= ~document_directive_bit;
3792  if (is_directive)
3793  {
3794  m_state |= document_directive_bit;
3795  }
3796  }
3797 
3798  private:
3799  uint32_t get_current_indent_level(const char *p_line_end)
3800  {
3801  // get the beginning position of the current line.
3802  std::size_t line_begin_pos =
3803  str_view(m_input_buffer.begin(), p_line_end - 1).find_last_of('\n');
3804  if (line_begin_pos == str_view::npos)
3805  {
3806  line_begin_pos = 0;
3807  }
3808  else
3809  {
3810  ++line_begin_pos;
3811  }
3812  const char *p_line_begin = m_input_buffer.begin() + line_begin_pos;
3813  const char *cur_itr = p_line_begin;
3814 
3815  // get the indentation of the current line.
3816  uint32_t indent = 0;
3817  bool indent_found = false;
3818  // 0: none, 1: block seq item, 2: explicit map key, 3: explicit map value
3819  uint32_t context = 0;
3820  while (cur_itr != p_line_end && !indent_found)
3821  {
3822  switch (*cur_itr)
3823  {
3824  case ' ':
3825  ++indent;
3826  ++cur_itr;
3827  break;
3828  case '-':
3829  switch (*(cur_itr + 1))
3830  {
3831  case ' ':
3832  case '\t':
3833  indent += 2;
3834  cur_itr += 2;
3835  context = 1;
3836  break;
3837  default:
3838  indent_found = true;
3839  break;
3840  }
3841  break;
3842  case '?':
3843  if (*(cur_itr + 1) == ' ')
3844  {
3845  indent += 2;
3846  cur_itr += 2;
3847  context = 2;
3848  break;
3849  }
3850 
3851  indent_found = true;
3852  break;
3853  case ':':
3854  switch (*(cur_itr + 1))
3855  {
3856  case ' ':
3857  case '\t':
3858  indent += 2;
3859  cur_itr += 2;
3860  context = 3;
3861  break;
3862  default:
3863  indent_found = true;
3864  break;
3865  }
3866  break;
3867  default:
3868  indent_found = true;
3869  break;
3870  }
3871  }
3872 
3873  // If "- ", "? " and/or ": " occur in the first line of this plain scalar content.
3874  if (context > 0)
3875  {
3876  // Check if the first line contains the key separator ": ".
3877  // If so, the indent value remains the current one.
3878  // Otherwise, the indent value is changed based on the last ocurrence of the above 3.
3879  // In any case, multiline plain scalar content must be indented more than the indent
3880  // value.
3881  const str_view line_content_part{p_line_begin + indent, p_line_end};
3882  std::size_t key_sep_pos = line_content_part.find(": ");
3883  if (key_sep_pos == str_view::npos)
3884  {
3885  key_sep_pos = line_content_part.find(":\t");
3886  }
3887 
3888  if (key_sep_pos == str_view::npos)
3889  {
3890  constexpr char targets[] = "-?:";
3891  FK_YAML_ASSERT(context - 1 < sizeof(targets));
3892  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
3893  const char target_char = targets[context - 1];
3894 
3895  // Find the position of the last ocuurence of "- ", "? " or ": ".
3896  const str_view line_indent_part{p_line_begin, indent};
3897  const std::size_t block_seq_item_begin_pos =
3898  line_indent_part.find_last_of(target_char);
3899  FK_YAML_ASSERT(block_seq_item_begin_pos != str_view::npos);
3900  indent = static_cast<uint32_t>(block_seq_item_begin_pos);
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  return indent;
3905  }
3906 
3908  void scan_comment()
3909  {
3910  FK_YAML_ASSERT(*m_cur_itr == '#');
3911  skip_until_line_end();
3912  }
3913 
3918  lexical_token_t scan_directive()
3919  {
3920  FK_YAML_ASSERT(*m_cur_itr == '%');
3921 
3922  m_token_begin_itr = ++m_cur_itr;
3923 
3924  bool ends_loop = false;
3925  while (!ends_loop && m_cur_itr != m_end_itr)
3926  {
3927  switch (*m_cur_itr)
3928  {
3929  case ' ':
3930  case '\t':
3931  ends_loop = true;
3932  break;
3933  case '\n':
3934  skip_until_line_end();
3935  return lexical_token_t::INVALID_DIRECTIVE;
3936  default:
3937  ++m_cur_itr;
3938  break;
3939  }
3940  }
3941 
3942  const str_view dir_name(m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr);
3943 
3944  if (dir_name == "TAG")
3945  {
3946  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!ends_loop)
3947  {
3948  emit_error("There must be at least one white space between \"%TAG\" and tag info.");
3949  }
3950  skip_white_spaces();
3951  return scan_tag_directive();
3952  }
3953 
3954  if (dir_name == "YAML")
3955  {
3956  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!ends_loop)
3957  {
3958  emit_error("There must be at least one white space between \"%YAML\" and version.");
3959  }
3960  skip_white_spaces();
3961  return scan_yaml_version_directive();
3962  }
3963 
3964  skip_until_line_end();
3965  return lexical_token_t::INVALID_DIRECTIVE;
3966  }
3967 
3970  lexical_token_t scan_tag_directive()
3971  {
3972  m_token_begin_itr = m_cur_itr;
3973 
3974  //
3975  // extract a tag handle
3976  //
3977 
3978  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (*m_cur_itr != '!')
3979  {
3980  emit_error("Tag handle must start with \'!\'.");
3981  }
3982 
3983  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
3984  {
3985  emit_error("invalid TAG directive is found.");
3986  }
3987 
3988  switch (*m_cur_itr)
3989  {
3990  case ' ':
3991  case '\t':
3992  // primary handle (!)
3993  break;
3994  case '!':
3995  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
3996  {
3997  emit_error("invalid TAG directive is found.");
3998  }
3999  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (*m_cur_itr != ' ' && *m_cur_itr != '\t')
4000  {
4001  emit_error("invalid tag handle is found.");
4002  }
4003  break;
4004  default: {
4005  bool ends_loop = false;
4006  do
4007  {
4008  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4009  {
4010  case ' ':
4011  case '\t':
4012  emit_error("invalid tag handle is found.");
4013  case '!': {
4014  if (m_cur_itr + 1 == m_end_itr)
4015  {
4016  ends_loop = true;
4017  break;
4018  }
4019  const char next = *(m_cur_itr + 1);
4020  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (next != ' ' && next != '\t')
4021  {
4022  emit_error("invalid tag handle is found.");
4023  }
4024  ends_loop = true;
4025  break;
4026  }
4027  case '-':
4028  break;
4029  default:
4030  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!isalnum(*m_cur_itr))
4031  {
4032  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#rule-c-named-tag-handle for more
4033  // details.
4034  emit_error("named handle can contain only numbers(0-9), alphabets(A-Z,a-z) "
4035  "and hyphens(-).");
4036  }
4037  break;
4038  }
4039 
4040  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
4041  {
4042  emit_error("invalid TAG directive is found.");
4043  }
4044  } while (!ends_loop);
4045  break;
4046  }
4047  }
4048 
4049  m_tag_handle = str_view{m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr};
4050 
4051  skip_white_spaces();
4052 
4053  //
4054  // extract a tag prefix.
4055  //
4056 
4057  m_token_begin_itr = m_cur_itr;
4058  const char *p_tag_prefix_begin = m_cur_itr;
4059  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4060  {
4061  // a tag prefix must not start with flow indicators to avoid ambiguity.
4062  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#rule-ns-global-tag-prefix for more details.
4063  case ',':
4064  case '[':
4065  case ']':
4066  case '{':
4067  case '}':
4068  emit_error("tag prefix must not start with flow indicators (\',\', [], {}).");
4069  default:
4070  break;
4071  }
4072 
4073  // extract the rest of a tag prefix.
4074  bool ends_loop = false;
4075  do
4076  {
4077  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4078  {
4079  case ' ':
4080  case '\t':
4081  case '\n':
4082  ends_loop = true;
4083  break;
4084  default:
4085  break;
4086  }
4087  } while (!ends_loop && ++m_cur_itr != m_end_itr);
4088 
4089  const bool is_valid = uri_encoding::validate(p_tag_prefix_begin, m_cur_itr);
4090  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
4091  {
4092  emit_error("invalid URI character is found in a tag prefix.");
4093  }
4094 
4095  m_tag_prefix = str_view{p_tag_prefix_begin, m_cur_itr};
4096 
4097  return lexical_token_t::TAG_DIRECTIVE;
4098  }
4099 
4103  lexical_token_t scan_yaml_version_directive()
4104  {
4105  m_token_begin_itr = m_cur_itr;
4106 
4107  bool ends_loop = false;
4108  while (!ends_loop && m_cur_itr != m_end_itr)
4109  {
4110  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4111  {
4112  case ' ':
4113  case '\t':
4114  case '\n':
4115  ends_loop = true;
4116  break;
4117  default:
4118  ++m_cur_itr;
4119  break;
4120  }
4121  }
4122 
4123  m_yaml_version = str_view{m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr};
4124 
4125  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_yaml_version.compare("1.1") != 0 &&
4126  m_yaml_version.compare("1.2") != 0)
4127  {
4128  emit_error("Only 1.1 and 1.2 can be specified as the YAML version.");
4129  }
4130 
4131  return lexical_token_t::YAML_VER_DIRECTIVE;
4132  }
4133 
4136  str_view extract_anchor_name()
4137  {
4138  FK_YAML_ASSERT(*m_cur_itr == '&' || *m_cur_itr == '*');
4139 
4140  m_token_begin_itr = ++m_cur_itr;
4141 
4142  bool ends_loop = false;
4143  for (; m_cur_itr != m_end_itr; ++m_cur_itr)
4144  {
4145  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4146  {
4147  // anchor name must not contain white spaces, newline codes and flow indicators.
4148  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#692-node-anchors for more details.
4149  case ' ':
4150  case '\t':
4151  case '\n':
4152  case '{':
4153  case '}':
4154  case '[':
4155  case ']':
4156  case ',':
4157  ends_loop = true;
4158  break;
4159  default:
4160  break;
4161  }
4162 
4163  if (ends_loop)
4164  {
4165  break;
4166  }
4167  }
4168 
4169  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_token_begin_itr == m_cur_itr)
4170  {
4171  emit_error("anchor name must not be empty.");
4172  }
4173 
4174  return {m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr};
4175  }
4176 
4179  str_view extract_tag_name()
4180  {
4181  FK_YAML_ASSERT(*m_cur_itr == '!');
4182 
4183  if (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
4184  {
4185  // Just "!" is a non-specific tag.
4186  return {m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
4187  }
4188 
4189  bool is_verbatim = false;
4190  bool allows_another_tag_prefix = false;
4191 
4192  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4193  {
4194  case ' ':
4195  case '\n':
4196  // Just "!" is a non-specific tag.
4197  return {m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr};
4198  case '!':
4199  // Secondary tag handles (!!suffix)
4200  break;
4201  case '<':
4202  // Verbatim tags (!<TAG>)
4203  is_verbatim = true;
4204  ++m_cur_itr;
4205  break;
4206  default:
4207  // Either local tags (!suffix) or named handles (!tag!suffix)
4208  allows_another_tag_prefix = true;
4209  break;
4210  }
4211 
4212  bool is_named_handle = false;
4213  bool ends_loop = false;
4214  do
4215  {
4216  if (++m_cur_itr == m_end_itr)
4217  {
4218  break;
4219  }
4220 
4221  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4222  {
4223  // Tag names must not contain spaces or newline codes.
4224  case ' ':
4225  case '\t':
4226  case '\n':
4227  ends_loop = true;
4228  break;
4229  case '!':
4230  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!allows_another_tag_prefix)
4231  {
4232  emit_error("invalid tag prefix (!) is found.");
4233  }
4234 
4235  is_named_handle = true;
4236  // tag prefix must not appear three times.
4237  allows_another_tag_prefix = false;
4238  break;
4239  default:
4240  break;
4241  }
4242  } while (!ends_loop);
4243 
4244  str_view tag_name{m_token_begin_itr, m_cur_itr};
4245 
4246  if (is_verbatim)
4247  {
4248  const char last = tag_name.back();
4249  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (last != '>')
4250  {
4251  emit_error("verbatim tag (!<TAG>) must be ended with \'>\'.");
4252  }
4253 
4254  // only the `TAG` part of the `!<TAG>` for URI validation.
4255  const str_view tag_body = tag_name.substr(2, tag_name.size() - 3);
4256  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (tag_body.empty())
4257  {
4258  emit_error("verbatim tag(!<TAG>) must not be empty.");
4259  }
4260 
4261  const bool is_valid_uri = uri_encoding::validate(tag_body.begin(), tag_body.end());
4262  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid_uri)
4263  {
4264  emit_error("invalid URI character is found in a verbatim tag.");
4265  }
4266 
4267  return tag_name;
4268  }
4269 
4270  if (is_named_handle)
4271  {
4272  const char last = tag_name.back();
4273  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (last == '!')
4274  {
4275  // Tag shorthand must be followed by a non-empty suffix.
4276  // See the "Tag Shorthands" section in https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#691-node-tags.
4277  emit_error("named handle has no suffix.");
4278  }
4279  }
4280 
4281  // get the position of last tag prefix character (!) to extract body of tag shorthands.
4282  // tag shorthand is either primary(!tag), secondary(!!tag) or named(!handle!tag).
4283  const std::size_t last_tag_prefix_pos = tag_name.find_last_of('!');
4284  FK_YAML_ASSERT(last_tag_prefix_pos != str_view::npos);
4285 
4286  const str_view tag_uri = tag_name.substr(last_tag_prefix_pos + 1);
4287  const bool is_valid_uri = uri_encoding::validate(tag_uri.begin(), tag_uri.end());
4288  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid_uri)
4289  {
4290  emit_error("Invalid URI character is found in a named tag handle.");
4291  }
4292 
4293  // Tag shorthands cannot contain flow indicators({}[],).
4294  // See the "Tag Shorthands" section in https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#691-node-tags.
4295  const std::size_t invalid_char_pos = tag_uri.find_first_of("{}[],");
4296  if (invalid_char_pos != str_view::npos)
4297  {
4298  emit_error("Tag shorthand cannot contain flow indicators({}[],).");
4299  }
4300 
4301  return tag_name;
4302  }
4303 
4307  str_view determine_single_quoted_scalar_range()
4308  {
4309  const str_view sv{m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
4310 
4311  std::size_t pos = sv.find('\'');
4312  while (pos != str_view::npos)
4313  {
4314  FK_YAML_ASSERT(pos < sv.size());
4315  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (pos == sv.size() - 1 || sv[pos + 1] != '\'')
4316  {
4317  // closing single quote is found.
4318  m_cur_itr = m_token_begin_itr + (pos + 1);
4319  str_view single_quoted_scalar{m_token_begin_itr, pos};
4320  check_scalar_content(single_quoted_scalar);
4321  return single_quoted_scalar;
4322  }
4323 
4324  // If single quotation marks are repeated twice in a single quoted scalar, they are
4325  // considered as an escaped single quotation mark. Skip the second one which would
4326  // otherwise be detected as a closing single quotation mark in the next loop.
4327  pos = sv.find('\'', pos + 2);
4328  }
4329 
4330  m_cur_itr = m_end_itr; // update for error information
4331  emit_error("Invalid end of input buffer in a single-quoted scalar token.");
4332  }
4333 
4337  str_view determine_double_quoted_scalar_range()
4338  {
4339  const str_view sv{m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
4340 
4341  std::size_t pos = sv.find('\"');
4342  while (pos != str_view::npos)
4343  {
4344  FK_YAML_ASSERT(pos < sv.size());
4345 
4346  bool is_closed = true;
4347  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (pos > 0)
4348  {
4349  // Double quotation marks can be escaped by a preceding backslash and the number of
4350  // backslashes matters to determine if the found double quotation mark is escaped
4351  // since the backslash itself can also be escaped:
4352  // * odd number of backslashes -> double quotation mark IS escaped (e.g., "\\\"")
4353  // * even number of backslashes -> double quotation mark IS NOT escaped (e.g.,
4354  // "\\"")
4355  uint32_t backslash_counts = 0;
4356  const char *p = m_token_begin_itr + (pos - 1);
4357  do
4358  {
4359  if (*p-- != '\\')
4360  {
4361  break;
4362  }
4363  ++backslash_counts;
4364  } while (p != m_token_begin_itr);
4365  is_closed = ((backslash_counts & 1u) == 0); // true: even, false: odd
4366  }
4367 
4368  if (is_closed)
4369  {
4370  // closing double quote is found.
4371  m_cur_itr = m_token_begin_itr + (pos + 1);
4372  str_view double_quoted_salar{m_token_begin_itr, pos};
4373  check_scalar_content(double_quoted_salar);
4374  return double_quoted_salar;
4375  }
4376 
4377  pos = sv.find('\"', pos + 1);
4378  }
4379 
4380  m_cur_itr = m_end_itr; // update for error information
4381  emit_error("Invalid end of input buffer in a double-quoted scalar token.");
4382  }
4383 
4386  str_view determine_plain_scalar_range()
4387  {
4388  const str_view sv{m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
4389 
4390  // flow indicators are checked only within a flow context.
4391  const str_view filter = (m_state & flow_context_bit) ? "\n :{}[]," : "\n :";
4392  std::size_t pos = sv.find_first_of(filter);
4393  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos == str_view::npos)
4394  {
4395  check_scalar_content(sv);
4396  m_cur_itr = m_end_itr;
4397  return sv;
4398  }
4399 
4400  bool ends_loop = false;
4401  uint32_t indent = std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max();
4402  do
4403  {
4404  FK_YAML_ASSERT(pos < sv.size());
4405  switch (sv[pos])
4406  {
4407  case '\n': {
4408  if (indent == std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max())
4409  {
4410  indent = get_current_indent_level(&sv[pos]);
4411  }
4412 
4413  constexpr str_view space_filter{" \t\n"};
4414  const std::size_t non_space_pos = sv.find_first_not_of(space_filter, pos);
4415  const std::size_t last_newline_pos = sv.find_last_of('\n', non_space_pos);
4416  FK_YAML_ASSERT(last_newline_pos != str_view::npos);
4417 
4418  if (non_space_pos == str_view::npos ||
4419  non_space_pos - last_newline_pos - 1 <= indent)
4420  {
4421  ends_loop = true;
4422  break;
4423  }
4424 
4425  pos = non_space_pos;
4426  break;
4427  }
4428  case ' ':
4429  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (pos == sv.size() - 1)
4430  {
4431  // trim trailing space.
4432  ends_loop = true;
4433  break;
4434  }
4435 
4436  // Allow a space in a plain scalar only if the space is surrounded by non-space
4437  // characters, but not followed by the comment prefix " #". Also, flow indicators
4438  // are not allowed to be followed after a space in a flow context. See
4439  // https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#733-plain-style for more details.
4440  switch (sv[pos + 1])
4441  {
4442  case ' ':
4443  case '\t':
4444  case '\n':
4445  case '#':
4446  ends_loop = true;
4447  break;
4448  case ':':
4449  // " :" is permitted in a plain style string token, but not when followed by a
4450  // space.
4451  ends_loop = (pos < sv.size() - 2) && (sv[pos + 2] == ' ');
4452  break;
4453  case '{':
4454  case '}':
4455  case '[':
4456  case ']':
4457  case ',':
4458  ends_loop = (m_state & flow_context_bit);
4459  break;
4460  default:
4461  break;
4462  }
4463  break;
4464  case ':':
4465  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (pos + 1 < sv.size())
4466  {
4467  switch (sv[pos + 1])
4468  {
4469  case ' ':
4470  case '\t':
4471  case '\n':
4472  ends_loop = true;
4473  break;
4474  default:
4475  break;
4476  }
4477  }
4478  break;
4479  case '{':
4480  case '}':
4481  case '[':
4482  case ']':
4483  case ',':
4484  // This check is enabled only in a flow context.
4485  ends_loop = true;
4486  break;
4487  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
4488  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
4489  }
4490 
4491  if (ends_loop)
4492  {
4493  break;
4494  }
4495 
4496  pos = sv.find_first_of(filter, pos + 1);
4497  } while (pos != str_view::npos);
4498 
4499  str_view plain_scalar = sv.substr(0, pos);
4500  check_scalar_content(plain_scalar);
4501  m_cur_itr = plain_scalar.end();
4502  return plain_scalar;
4503  }
4504 
4511  str_view determine_block_scalar_content_range(uint32_t base_indent, uint32_t indicated_indent,
4512  uint32_t &content_indent)
4513  {
4514  const str_view sv{m_token_begin_itr, m_end_itr};
4515  const std::size_t remain_input_len = sv.size();
4516 
4517  // Handle leading all-space lines.
4518  uint32_t cur_indent = 0;
4519  uint32_t max_leading_indent = 0;
4520  const char *cur_itr = m_token_begin_itr;
4521  bool stop_increment = false;
4522 
4523  while (cur_itr != m_end_itr)
4524  {
4525  switch (*cur_itr++)
4526  {
4527  case ' ':
4528  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (!stop_increment)
4529  {
4530  ++cur_indent;
4531  }
4532  continue;
4533  case '\t':
4534  // Tabs are not counted as an indent character but still part of an empty line.
4535  // See https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#rule-s-indent and
4536  // https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#64-empty-lines.
4537  stop_increment = true;
4538  continue;
4539  case '\n':
4540  max_leading_indent = std::max(cur_indent, max_leading_indent);
4541  cur_indent = 0;
4542  stop_increment = false;
4543  continue;
4544  default:
4545  break;
4546  }
4547  break;
4548  }
4549 
4550  // all the block scalar contents are empty lines, and no subsequent token exists.
4551  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (cur_itr == m_end_itr)
4552  {
4553  // Without the following iterator update, lexer cannot reach the end of input buffer and
4554  // causes infinite loops from the next loop. (https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML/pull/410)
4555  m_cur_itr = m_end_itr;
4556 
4557  // If there's no non-empty line, the content indentation level is equal to the number of
4558  // spaces on the longest line.
4559  // https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#8111-block-indentation-indicator
4560  content_indent = indicated_indent == 0 ? std::max(cur_indent, max_leading_indent)
4561  : base_indent + indicated_indent;
4562  return sv;
4563  }
4564 
4565  // Any leading empty line must not contain more spaces than the first non-empty line.
4566  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (cur_indent < max_leading_indent)
4567  {
4568  emit_error(
4569  "Any leading empty line must not be more indented than the first non-empty line.");
4570  }
4571 
4572  if (indicated_indent == 0)
4573  {
4574  FK_YAML_ASSERT(base_indent < cur_indent);
4575  indicated_indent = cur_indent - base_indent;
4576  }
4577  else if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (cur_indent < base_indent + indicated_indent)
4578  {
4579  emit_error("The first non-empty line in the block scalar is less indented.");
4580  }
4581 
4582  std::size_t last_newline_pos = sv.find('\n', cur_itr - m_token_begin_itr + 1);
4583  if (last_newline_pos == str_view::npos)
4584  {
4585  last_newline_pos = remain_input_len;
4586  }
4587 
4588  content_indent = base_indent + indicated_indent;
4589  while (last_newline_pos < remain_input_len)
4590  {
4591  std::size_t cur_line_end_pos = sv.find('\n', last_newline_pos + 1);
4592  if (cur_line_end_pos == str_view::npos)
4593  {
4594  cur_line_end_pos = remain_input_len;
4595  }
4596 
4597  const std::size_t cur_line_content_begin_pos =
4598  sv.find_first_not_of(' ', last_newline_pos + 1);
4599  if (cur_line_content_begin_pos == str_view::npos)
4600  {
4601  last_newline_pos = cur_line_end_pos;
4602  continue;
4603  }
4604 
4605  FK_YAML_ASSERT(last_newline_pos < cur_line_content_begin_pos);
4606  cur_indent = static_cast<uint32_t>(cur_line_content_begin_pos - last_newline_pos - 1);
4607  if (cur_indent < content_indent && sv[cur_line_content_begin_pos] != '\n')
4608  {
4609  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (cur_indent > base_indent)
4610  {
4611  // This path assumes an input like the following:
4612  // ```yaml
4613  // foo: |
4614  // text
4615  // invalid # this line is less indented than the content indent level (2)
4616  // # but more indented than the base indent level (0)
4617  // ```
4618  // In such cases, the less indented line cannot be the start of the next token.
4619  emit_error("A content line of the block scalar is less indented.");
4620  }
4621 
4622  // Interpret less indented non-space characters as the start of the next token.
4623  break;
4624  }
4625 
4626  last_newline_pos = cur_line_end_pos;
4627  }
4628 
4629  // include last newline character if not all characters have been consumed yet.
4630  if (last_newline_pos < remain_input_len)
4631  {
4632  ++last_newline_pos;
4633  }
4634 
4635  m_cur_itr = m_token_begin_itr + last_newline_pos;
4636  return sv.substr(0, last_newline_pos);
4637  }
4638 
4641  void check_scalar_content(const str_view &scalar) const
4642  {
4643  const char *p_current = scalar.begin();
4644  const char *p_end = scalar.end();
4645 
4646  while (p_current != p_end)
4647  {
4648  const uint32_t num_bytes = utf8::get_num_bytes(static_cast<uint8_t>(*p_current));
4649  if (num_bytes > 1)
4650  {
4651  // Multibyte characters are already checked in the input_adapter module.
4652  p_current += num_bytes;
4653  continue;
4654  }
4655 
4656  switch (*p_current++)
4657  {
4658  // 0x00(NULL) has already been handled above.
4659  case 0x01:
4660  emit_error("Control character U+0001 (SOH) must be escaped to \\u0001.");
4661  case 0x02:
4662  emit_error("Control character U+0002 (STX) must be escaped to \\u0002.");
4663  case 0x03:
4664  emit_error("Control character U+0003 (ETX) must be escaped to \\u0003.");
4665  case 0x04:
4666  emit_error("Control character U+0004 (EOT) must be escaped to \\u0004.");
4667  case 0x05:
4668  emit_error("Control character U+0005 (ENQ) must be escaped to \\u0005.");
4669  case 0x06:
4670  emit_error("Control character U+0006 (ACK) must be escaped to \\u0006.");
4671  case 0x07:
4672  emit_error("Control character U+0007 (BEL) must be escaped to \\a or \\u0007.");
4673  case 0x08:
4674  emit_error("Control character U+0008 (BS) must be escaped to \\b or \\u0008.");
4675  case 0x09: // HT
4676  // horizontal tabs (\t) are safe to use without escaping.
4677  break;
4678  // 0x0A(LF) has already been handled above.
4679  case 0x0B:
4680  emit_error("Control character U+000B (VT) must be escaped to \\v or \\u000B.");
4681  case 0x0C:
4682  emit_error("Control character U+000C (FF) must be escaped to \\f or \\u000C.");
4683  // 0x0D(CR) has already been handled above.
4684  case 0x0E:
4685  emit_error("Control character U+000E (SO) must be escaped to \\u000E.");
4686  case 0x0F:
4687  emit_error("Control character U+000F (SI) must be escaped to \\u000F.");
4688  case 0x10:
4689  emit_error("Control character U+0010 (DLE) must be escaped to \\u0010.");
4690  case 0x11:
4691  emit_error("Control character U+0011 (DC1) must be escaped to \\u0011.");
4692  case 0x12:
4693  emit_error("Control character U+0012 (DC2) must be escaped to \\u0012.");
4694  case 0x13:
4695  emit_error("Control character U+0013 (DC3) must be escaped to \\u0013.");
4696  case 0x14:
4697  emit_error("Control character U+0014 (DC4) must be escaped to \\u0014.");
4698  case 0x15:
4699  emit_error("Control character U+0015 (NAK) must be escaped to \\u0015.");
4700  case 0x16:
4701  emit_error("Control character U+0016 (SYN) must be escaped to \\u0016.");
4702  case 0x17:
4703  emit_error("Control character U+0017 (ETB) must be escaped to \\u0017.");
4704  case 0x18:
4705  emit_error("Control character U+0018 (CAN) must be escaped to \\u0018.");
4706  case 0x19:
4707  emit_error("Control character U+0019 (EM) must be escaped to \\u0019.");
4708  case 0x1A:
4709  emit_error("Control character U+001A (SUB) must be escaped to \\u001A.");
4710  case 0x1B:
4711  emit_error("Control character U+001B (ESC) must be escaped to \\e or \\u001B.");
4712  case 0x1C:
4713  emit_error("Control character U+001C (FS) must be escaped to \\u001C.");
4714  case 0x1D:
4715  emit_error("Control character U+001D (GS) must be escaped to \\u001D.");
4716  case 0x1E:
4717  emit_error("Control character U+001E (RS) must be escaped to \\u001E.");
4718  case 0x1F:
4719  emit_error("Control character U+001F (US) must be escaped to \\u001F.");
4720  default:
4721  break;
4722  }
4723  }
4724  }
4725 
4730  block_scalar_header convert_to_block_scalar_header(str_view line)
4731  {
4732  constexpr str_view comment_prefix{" #"};
4733  const std::size_t comment_begin_pos = line.find(comment_prefix);
4734  if (comment_begin_pos != str_view::npos)
4735  {
4736  line = line.substr(0, comment_begin_pos);
4737  }
4738 
4739  if (line.empty())
4740  {
4741  return {};
4742  }
4743 
4744  block_scalar_header header{};
4745  for (const char c : line)
4746  {
4747  switch (c)
4748  {
4749  case '-':
4750  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (header.chomp != chomping_indicator_t::CLIP)
4751  {
4752  emit_error("Too many block chomping indicators specified.");
4753  }
4754  header.chomp = chomping_indicator_t::STRIP;
4755  break;
4756  case '+':
4757  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (header.chomp != chomping_indicator_t::CLIP)
4758  {
4759  emit_error("Too many block chomping indicators specified.");
4760  }
4761  header.chomp = chomping_indicator_t::KEEP;
4762  break;
4763  case '0':
4764  emit_error("An indentation level for a block scalar cannot be 0.");
4765  case '1':
4766  case '2':
4767  case '3':
4768  case '4':
4769  case '5':
4770  case '6':
4771  case '7':
4772  case '8':
4773  case '9':
4774  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (header.indent > 0)
4775  {
4776  emit_error("Invalid indentation level for a block scalar. It must be between 1 "
4777  "and 9.");
4778  }
4779  header.indent = static_cast<uint32_t>(c - '0');
4780  break;
4781  case ' ':
4782  case '\t':
4783  break;
4784  default:
4785  emit_error("Invalid character found in a block scalar header.");
4786  }
4787  }
4788 
4789  return header;
4790  }
4791 
4793  void skip_white_spaces()
4794  {
4795  m_cur_itr =
4796  std::find_if_not(m_cur_itr, m_end_itr, [](char c) { return (c == ' ' || c == '\t'); });
4797  }
4798 
4800  void skip_white_spaces_and_newline_codes()
4801  {
4802  if (m_cur_itr != m_end_itr)
4803  {
4804  m_cur_itr = std::find_if_not(m_cur_itr, m_end_itr, [](char c) {
4805  switch (c)
4806  {
4807  case ' ':
4808  case '\t':
4809  case '\n':
4810  return true;
4811  default:
4812  return false;
4813  }
4814  });
4815  }
4816  }
4817 
4819  void skip_until_line_end()
4820  {
4821  while (m_cur_itr != m_end_itr)
4822  {
4823  switch (*m_cur_itr)
4824  {
4825  case '\n':
4826  ++m_cur_itr;
4827  return;
4828  default:
4829  ++m_cur_itr;
4830  break;
4831  }
4832  }
4833  }
4834 
4837  [[noreturn]] void emit_error(const char *msg) const
4838  {
4839  m_pos_tracker.update_position(m_cur_itr);
4840  throw fkyaml::parse_error(msg, m_pos_tracker.get_lines_read(),
4841  m_pos_tracker.get_cur_pos_in_line());
4842  }
4843 
4844  private:
4846  str_view m_input_buffer;
4848  const char *m_cur_itr{};
4850  const char *m_token_begin_itr{};
4852  const char *m_end_itr{};
4854  mutable position_tracker m_pos_tracker{};
4856  str_view m_yaml_version;
4858  str_view m_tag_handle;
4860  str_view m_tag_prefix;
4862  block_scalar_header m_block_scalar_header{};
4864  uint32_t m_last_token_begin_pos{0};
4866  uint32_t m_last_token_begin_line{0};
4868  uint32_t m_state{0};
4869 };
4870 
4871 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
4872 
4873 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_LEXICAL_ANALYZER_HPP */
4874

4876 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
4877 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
4878 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
4879 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
4880 //
4881 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
4882 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
4883 
4884 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_SCALAR_PARSER_HPP
4885 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_SCALAR_PARSER_HPP
4886 
4887 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
4888 
4889 // #include <fkYAML/detail/assert.hpp>
4890 
4891 // #include <fkYAML/detail/conversions/scalar_conv.hpp>
4892 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
4893 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
4894 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
4895 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
4896 //
4897 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
4898 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
4899 
4900 // **NOTE FOR LIBARARY DEVELOPERS**:
4901 // Implementations in this header file are intentionally optimized for conversions between YAML
4902 // scalars and native C++ types. So, some implementations don't follow the convensions in the
4903 // standard C++ functions. For example, octals must begin with "0o" (not "0"), which is specified in
4904 // the YAML spec 1.2.
4905 
4906 #ifndef FK_YAML_CONVERSIONS_SCALAR_CONV_HPP
4907 #define FK_YAML_CONVERSIONS_SCALAR_CONV_HPP
4908 
4909 #include <cmath>
4910 #include <cstdint>
4911 #include <cstring>
4912 #include <limits>
4913 
4914 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
4915 
4916 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
4917 
4918 #if FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS
4919 // Prefer std::to_chars() and std::from_chars() functions if available.
4920 #include <charconv>
4921 #else
4922 // Fallback to legacy string conversion functions otherwise.
4923 #include <string> // std::stof(), std::stod(), std::stold()
4924 #endif
4925 
4926 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
4927 
4929 // conv_limits_base //
4931 
4935 template <std::size_t NumBytes> struct conv_limits_base
4936 {
4937 };
4938 
4940 template <> struct conv_limits_base<1u>
4941 {
4943  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_oct = 3;
4945  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_hex = 2;
4946 
4951  static bool check_if_octs_safe(const char *octs, std::size_t len) noexcept
4952  {
4953  return (len < max_chars_oct) || (len == max_chars_oct && octs[0] <= '3');
4954  }
4955 
4960  static bool check_if_hexs_safe(const char * /*unused*/, std::size_t len) noexcept
4961  {
4962  return len <= max_chars_hex;
4963  }
4964 };
4965 
4967 template <> struct conv_limits_base<2u>
4968 {
4970  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_oct = 6;
4972  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_hex = 4;
4973 
4978  static bool check_if_octs_safe(const char *octs, std::size_t len) noexcept
4979  {
4980  return (len < max_chars_oct) || (len == max_chars_oct && octs[0] <= '1');
4981  }
4982 
4987  static bool check_if_hexs_safe(const char * /*unused*/, std::size_t len) noexcept
4988  {
4989  return len <= max_chars_hex;
4990  }
4991 };
4992 
4994 template <> struct conv_limits_base<4u>
4995 {
4997  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_oct = 11;
4999  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_hex = 8;
5000 
5005  static bool check_if_octs_safe(const char *octs, std::size_t len) noexcept
5006  {
5007  return (len < max_chars_oct) || (len == max_chars_oct && octs[0] <= '3');
5008  }
5009 
5014  static bool check_if_hexs_safe(const char * /*unused*/, std::size_t len) noexcept
5015  {
5016  return len <= max_chars_hex;
5017  }
5018 };
5019 
5021 template <> struct conv_limits_base<8u>
5022 {
5024  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_oct = 22;
5026  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_hex = 16;
5027 
5032  static bool check_if_octs_safe(const char *octs, std::size_t len) noexcept
5033  {
5034  return (len < max_chars_oct) || (len == max_chars_oct && octs[0] <= '1');
5035  }
5036 
5041  static bool check_if_hexs_safe(const char * /*unused*/, std::size_t len) noexcept
5042  {
5043  return len <= max_chars_hex;
5044  }
5045 };
5046 
5048 // conv_limits //
5050 
5055 template <std::size_t NumBytes, bool IsSigned> struct conv_limits
5056 {
5057 };
5058 
5060 template <> struct conv_limits<1u, true> : conv_limits_base<1u>
5061 {
5063  static constexpr bool is_signed = true;
5064 
5066  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 3;
5067 
5069  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5070  {
5071  // Making this function a static constexpr variable, a link error happens.
5072  // Although the issue has been fixed since C++17, this workaround is necessary to let this
5073  // functionality work with C++11 (the library's default C++ standard version). The same
5074  // thing is applied to similar functions in the other specializations.
5075 
5076  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "127";
5077  return &max_value_chars[0];
5078  }
5079 
5081  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5082  {
5083  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "128";
5084  return &min_value_chars[0];
5085  }
5086 };
5087 
5089 template <> struct conv_limits<1u, false> : conv_limits_base<1u>
5090 {
5092  static constexpr bool is_signed = false;
5093 
5095  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 3;
5096 
5098  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5099  {
5100  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "255";
5101  return &max_value_chars[0];
5102  }
5103 
5105  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5106  {
5107  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "0";
5108  return &min_value_chars[0];
5109  }
5110 };
5111 
5113 template <> struct conv_limits<2u, true> : conv_limits_base<2u>
5114 {
5116  static constexpr bool is_signed = true;
5117 
5119  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 5;
5120 
5122  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5123  {
5124  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "32767";
5125  return &max_value_chars[0];
5126  }
5127 
5129  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5130  {
5131  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "32768";
5132  return &min_value_chars[0];
5133  }
5134 };
5135 
5137 template <> struct conv_limits<2u, false> : conv_limits_base<2u>
5138 {
5140  static constexpr bool is_signed = false;
5141 
5143  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 5;
5144 
5146  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5147  {
5148  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "65535";
5149  return &max_value_chars[0];
5150  }
5151 
5153  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5154  {
5155  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "0";
5156  return &min_value_chars[0];
5157  }
5158 };
5159 
5161 template <> struct conv_limits<4u, true> : conv_limits_base<4u>
5162 {
5164  static constexpr bool is_signed = true;
5165 
5167  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 10;
5168 
5170  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5171  {
5172  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "2147483647";
5173  return &max_value_chars[0];
5174  }
5175 
5177  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5178  {
5179  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "2147483648";
5180  return &min_value_chars[0];
5181  }
5182 };
5183 
5185 template <> struct conv_limits<4u, false> : conv_limits_base<4u>
5186 {
5188  static constexpr bool is_signed = false;
5189 
5191  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 10;
5192 
5194  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5195  {
5196  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "4294967295";
5197  return &max_value_chars[0];
5198  }
5199 
5201  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5202  {
5203  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "0";
5204  return &min_value_chars[0];
5205  }
5206 };
5207 
5209 template <> struct conv_limits<8u, true> : conv_limits_base<8u>
5210 {
5212  static constexpr bool is_signed = true;
5213 
5215  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 19;
5216 
5218  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5219  {
5220  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "9223372036854775807";
5221  return &max_value_chars[0];
5222  }
5223 
5225  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5226  {
5227  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "9223372036854775808";
5228  return &min_value_chars[0];
5229  }
5230 };
5231 
5233 template <> struct conv_limits<8u, false> : conv_limits_base<8u>
5234 {
5236  static constexpr bool is_signed = false;
5237 
5239  static constexpr std::size_t max_chars_dec = 20;
5240 
5242  static const char *max_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5243  {
5244  static constexpr char max_value_chars[] = "18446744073709551615";
5245  return &max_value_chars[0];
5246  }
5247 
5249  static const char *min_value_chars_dec() noexcept
5250  {
5251  static constexpr char min_value_chars[] = "0";
5252  return &min_value_chars[0];
5253  }
5254 };
5255 
5257 // scalar <--> null //
5259 
5266 template <typename CharItr>
5267 inline bool aton(CharItr begin, CharItr end, std::nullptr_t & /*unused*/) noexcept
5268 {
5269  static_assert(is_iterator_of<CharItr, char>::value, "aton() accepts iterators for char type");
5270 
5271  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
5272  {
5273  return false;
5274  }
5275 
5276  const auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::distance(begin, end));
5277 
5278  // This path is the most probable case, so check it first.
5279  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (len == 4)
5280  {
5281  const char *p_begin = &*begin;
5282  return (std::strncmp(p_begin, "null", 4) == 0) || (std::strncmp(p_begin, "Null", 4) == 0) ||
5283  (std::strncmp(p_begin, "NULL", 4) == 0);
5284  }
5285 
5286  if (len == 1)
5287  {
5288  return *begin == '~';
5289  }
5290 
5291  return false;
5292 }
5293 
5295 // scalar <--> boolean //
5297 
5305 template <typename CharItr, typename BoolType>
5306 inline bool atob(CharItr begin, CharItr end, BoolType &boolean) noexcept
5307 {
5308  static_assert(is_iterator_of<CharItr, char>::value, "atob() accepts iterators for char type");
5309 
5310  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
5311  {
5312  return false;
5313  }
5314 
5315  const auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::distance(begin, end));
5316  const char *p_begin = &*begin;
5317 
5318  if (len == 4)
5319  {
5320  const bool is_true = (std::strncmp(p_begin, "true", 4) == 0) ||
5321  (std::strncmp(p_begin, "True", 4) == 0) ||
5322  (std::strncmp(p_begin, "TRUE", 4) == 0);
5323 
5324  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (is_true)
5325  {
5326  boolean = static_cast<BoolType>(true);
5327  }
5328  return is_true;
5329  }
5330 
5331  if (len == 5)
5332  {
5333  const bool is_false = (std::strncmp(p_begin, "false", 5) == 0) ||
5334  (std::strncmp(p_begin, "False", 5) == 0) ||
5335  (std::strncmp(p_begin, "FALSE", 5) == 0);
5336 
5337  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (is_false)
5338  {
5339  boolean = static_cast<BoolType>(false);
5340  }
5341  return is_false;
5342  }
5343 
5344  return false;
5345 }
5346 
5348 // scalar <--> integer //
5350 
5351 //
5352 // scalar --> decimals
5353 //
5354 
5366 template <typename IntType>
5367 inline bool atoi_dec_unchecked(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, IntType &i) noexcept
5368 {
5369  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5370  "atoi_dec_unchecked() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5371 
5372  i = 0;
5373  do
5374  {
5375  const char c = *p_begin;
5376  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (c < '0' || '9' < c)
5377  {
5378  return false;
5379  }
5380  // Overflow is intentional when the IntType is signed.
5381  i = i * static_cast<IntType>(10) + static_cast<IntType>(c - '0');
5382  } while (++p_begin != p_end);
5383 
5384  return true;
5385 }
5386 
5395 template <typename IntType>
5396 inline bool atoi_dec_pos(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, IntType &i) noexcept
5397 {
5398  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5399  "atoi_dec_pos() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5400 
5401  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin == p_end)
5402  {
5403  return false;
5404  }
5405 
5406  using conv_limits_type = conv_limits<sizeof(IntType), std::is_signed<IntType>::value>;
5407 
5408  const auto len = static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5409  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (len > conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec)
5410  {
5411  // Overflow will happen.
5412  return false;
5413  }
5414 
5415  if (len == conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec)
5416  {
5417  const char *p_max_value_chars_dec = conv_limits_type::max_value_chars_dec();
5418 
5419  for (std::size_t idx = 0; idx < conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec; idx++)
5420  {
5421  if (p_begin[idx] < p_max_value_chars_dec[idx])
5422  {
5423  // No need to check the lower digits. Overflow will no longer happen.
5424  break;
5425  }
5426 
5427  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin[idx] > p_max_value_chars_dec[idx])
5428  {
5429  // Overflow will happen.
5430  return false;
5431  }
5432  }
5433  }
5434 
5435  return atoi_dec_unchecked(p_begin, p_end, i);
5436 }
5437 
5446 template <typename IntType>
5447 inline bool atoi_dec_neg(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, IntType &i) noexcept
5448 {
5449  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5450  "atoi_dec_neg() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5451 
5452  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin == p_end)
5453  {
5454  return false;
5455  }
5456 
5457  using conv_limits_type = conv_limits<sizeof(IntType), std::is_signed<IntType>::value>;
5458 
5459  const auto len = static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5460  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (len > conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec)
5461  {
5462  // Underflow will happen.
5463  return false;
5464  }
5465 
5466  if (len == conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec)
5467  {
5468  const char *p_min_value_chars_dec = conv_limits_type::min_value_chars_dec();
5469 
5470  for (std::size_t idx = 0; idx < conv_limits_type::max_chars_dec; idx++)
5471  {
5472  if (p_begin[idx] < p_min_value_chars_dec[idx])
5473  {
5474  // No need to check the lower digits. Underflow will no longer happen.
5475  break;
5476  }
5477 
5478  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin[idx] > p_min_value_chars_dec[idx])
5479  {
5480  // Underflow will happen.
5481  return false;
5482  }
5483  }
5484  }
5485 
5486  return atoi_dec_unchecked(p_begin, p_end, i);
5487 }
5488 
5489 //
5490 // scalar --> octals
5491 //
5492 
5500 template <typename IntType>
5501 inline bool atoi_oct(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, IntType &i) noexcept
5502 {
5503  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5504  "atoi_oct() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5505 
5506  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin == p_end)
5507  {
5508  return false;
5509  }
5510 
5511  using conv_limits_type = conv_limits<sizeof(IntType), std::is_signed<IntType>::value>;
5512 
5513  const auto len = static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5514  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!conv_limits_type::check_if_octs_safe(p_begin, len))
5515  {
5516  return false;
5517  }
5518 
5519  i = 0;
5520  do
5521  {
5522  const char c = *p_begin;
5523  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (c < '0' || '7' < c)
5524  {
5525  return false;
5526  }
5527  i = i * static_cast<IntType>(8) + static_cast<IntType>(c - '0');
5528  } while (++p_begin != p_end);
5529 
5530  return true;
5531 }
5532 
5533 //
5534 // scalar --> hexadecimals
5535 //
5536 
5545 template <typename IntType>
5546 inline bool atoi_hex(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, IntType &i) noexcept
5547 {
5548  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5549  "atoi_hex() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5550 
5551  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (p_begin == p_end)
5552  {
5553  return false;
5554  }
5555 
5556  using conv_limits_type = conv_limits<sizeof(IntType), std::is_signed<IntType>::value>;
5557 
5558  const auto len = static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5559  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!conv_limits_type::check_if_hexs_safe(p_begin, len))
5560  {
5561  return false;
5562  }
5563 
5564  i = 0;
5565  do
5566  {
5567  // NOLINTBEGIN(bugprone-misplaced-widening-cast)
5568  const char c = *p_begin;
5569  IntType ci = 0;
5570  if ('0' <= c && c <= '9')
5571  {
5572  ci = static_cast<IntType>(c - '0');
5573  }
5574  else if ('A' <= c && c <= 'F')
5575  {
5576  ci = static_cast<IntType>(c - 'A' + 10);
5577  }
5578  else if ('a' <= c && c <= 'f')
5579  {
5580  ci = static_cast<IntType>(c - 'a' + 10);
5581  }
5582  else
5583  {
5584  return false;
5585  }
5586  i = i * static_cast<IntType>(16) + ci;
5587  // NOLINTEND(bugprone-misplaced-widening-cast)
5588  } while (++p_begin != p_end);
5589 
5590  return true;
5591 }
5592 
5593 //
5594 // atoi() & itoa()
5595 //
5596 
5605 template <typename CharItr, typename IntType>
5606 inline bool atoi(CharItr begin, CharItr end, IntType &i) noexcept
5607 {
5608  static_assert(is_iterator_of<CharItr, char>::value, "atoi() accepts iterators for char type");
5609  static_assert(is_non_bool_integral<IntType>::value,
5610  "atoi() accepts non-boolean integral types as an output type");
5611 
5612  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
5613  {
5614  return false;
5615  }
5616 
5617  const auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::distance(begin, end));
5618  const char *p_begin = &*begin;
5619  const char *p_end = p_begin + len;
5620 
5621  const char first = *begin;
5622  if (first == '+')
5623  {
5624  return atoi_dec_pos(p_begin + 1, p_end, i);
5625  }
5626 
5627  if (first == '-')
5628  {
5629  if (!std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_signed)
5630  {
5631  return false;
5632  }
5633 
5634  const bool success = atoi_dec_neg(p_begin + 1, p_end, i);
5635  if (success)
5636  {
5637  i *= static_cast<IntType>(-1);
5638  }
5639 
5640  return success;
5641  }
5642 
5643  if (first != '0')
5644  {
5645  return atoi_dec_pos(p_begin, p_end, i);
5646  }
5647 
5648  if (p_begin + 1 != p_end)
5649  {
5650  switch (*(p_begin + 1))
5651  {
5652  case 'o':
5653  return atoi_oct(p_begin + 2, p_end, i);
5654  case 'x':
5655  return atoi_hex(p_begin + 2, p_end, i);
5656  default:
5657  // The YAML spec doesn't allow decimals starting with 0.
5658  return false;
5659  }
5660  }
5661 
5662  i = 0;
5663  return true;
5664 }
5665 
5667 // scalar <--> float //
5669 
5673 inline void set_infinity(float &f, const float sign) noexcept
5674 {
5675  f = std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity() * sign;
5676 }
5677 
5681 inline void set_infinity(double &f, const double sign) noexcept
5682 {
5683  f = std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity() * sign;
5684 }
5685 
5688 inline void set_nan(float &f) noexcept
5689 {
5690  f = std::nanf("");
5691 }
5692 
5695 inline void set_nan(double &f) noexcept
5696 {
5697  f = std::nan("");
5698 }
5699 
5700 #if FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS
5701 
5708 template <typename FloatType>
5709 inline bool atof_impl(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, FloatType &f) noexcept
5710 {
5711  static_assert(std::is_floating_point_v<FloatType>,
5712  "atof_impl() accepts floating point types as an output type");
5713  if (auto [ptr, ec] = std::from_chars(p_begin, p_end, f); ec == std::errc{})
5714  {
5715  return ptr == p_end;
5716  }
5717  return false;
5718 }
5719 
5720 #else
5721 
5728 inline bool atof_impl(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, float &f)
5729 {
5730  std::size_t idx = 0;
5731  f = std::stof(std::string(p_begin, p_end), &idx);
5732  return idx == static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5733 }
5734 
5741 inline bool atof_impl(const char *p_begin, const char *p_end, double &f)
5742 {
5743  std::size_t idx = 0;
5744  f = std::stod(std::string(p_begin, p_end), &idx);
5745  return idx == static_cast<std::size_t>(p_end - p_begin);
5746 }
5747 
5748 #endif // FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS
5749 
5757 template <typename CharItr, typename FloatType>
5758 inline bool atof(CharItr begin, CharItr end,
5759  FloatType &f) noexcept(noexcept(atof_impl(&*begin, &*begin, f)))
5760 {
5761  static_assert(is_iterator_of<CharItr, char>::value, "atof() accepts iterators for char type");
5762  static_assert(std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value,
5763  "atof() accepts floating point types as an output type");
5764 
5765  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
5766  {
5767  return false;
5768  }
5769 
5770  const auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::distance(begin, end));
5771  const char *p_begin = &*begin;
5772  const char *p_end = p_begin + len;
5773 
5774  if (*p_begin == '-' || *p_begin == '+')
5775  {
5776  if (len == 5)
5777  {
5778  const char *p_from_second = p_begin + 1;
5779  const bool is_inf = (std::strncmp(p_from_second, ".inf", 4) == 0) ||
5780  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, ".Inf", 4) == 0) ||
5781  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, ".INF", 4) == 0);
5782  if (is_inf)
5783  {
5784  set_infinity(f, *p_begin == '-' ? static_cast<FloatType>(-1.)
5785  : static_cast<FloatType>(1.));
5786  return true;
5787  }
5788  }
5789 
5790  if (*p_begin == '+')
5791  {
5792  // Skip the positive sign since it's sometimes not recognized as part of float value.
5793  ++p_begin;
5794  }
5795  }
5796  else if (len == 4)
5797  {
5798  const bool is_inf = (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".inf", 4) == 0) ||
5799  (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".Inf", 4) == 0) ||
5800  (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".INF", 4) == 0);
5801  if (is_inf)
5802  {
5803  set_infinity(f, static_cast<FloatType>(1.));
5804  return true;
5805  }
5806 
5807  const bool is_nan = (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".nan", 4) == 0) ||
5808  (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".NaN", 4) == 0) ||
5809  (std::strncmp(p_begin, ".NAN", 4) == 0);
5810  if (is_nan)
5811  {
5812  set_nan(f);
5813  return true;
5814  }
5815  }
5816 
5817 #if FK_YAML_HAS_TO_CHARS
5818  return atof_impl(p_begin, p_end, f);
5819 #else
5820  bool success = false;
5821  try
5822  {
5823  success = atof_impl(p_begin, p_end, f);
5824  }
5825  catch (const std::exception & /*unused*/)
5826  {
5827  success = false;
5828  }
5829 
5830  return success;
5831 #endif
5832 }
5833 
5834 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
5835 
5836 #endif /* FK_YAML_CONVERSIONS_SCALAR_CONV_HPP */
5837 
5838 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/yaml_escaper.hpp>
5839 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
5840 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
5841 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
5842 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
5843 //
5844 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
5845 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
5846 
5847 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_YAML_ESCAPER_HPP
5848 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_YAML_ESCAPER_HPP
5849 
5850 #include <string>
5851 
5852 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
5853 
5854 // #include <fkYAML/detail/assert.hpp>
5855 
5856 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/utf_encodings.hpp>
5857 
5858 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
5859 
5860 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
5861 
5862 class yaml_escaper
5863 {
5864  using iterator = ::std::string::const_iterator;
5865 
5866  public:
5867  static bool unescape(const char *&begin, const char *end, std::string &buff)
5868  {
5869  FK_YAML_ASSERT(*begin == '\\' && std::distance(begin, end) > 0);
5870  bool ret = true;
5871 
5872  switch (*++begin)
5873  {
5874  case 'a':
5875  buff.push_back('\a');
5876  break;
5877  case 'b':
5878  buff.push_back('\b');
5879  break;
5880  case 't':
5881  case '\t':
5882  buff.push_back('\t');
5883  break;
5884  case 'n':
5885  buff.push_back('\n');
5886  break;
5887  case 'v':
5888  buff.push_back('\v');
5889  break;
5890  case 'f':
5891  buff.push_back('\f');
5892  break;
5893  case 'r':
5894  buff.push_back('\r');
5895  break;
5896  case 'e':
5897  buff.push_back(static_cast<char>(0x1B));
5898  break;
5899  case ' ':
5900  buff.push_back(' ');
5901  break;
5902  case '\"':
5903  buff.push_back('\"');
5904  break;
5905  case '/':
5906  buff.push_back('/');
5907  break;
5908  case '\\':
5909  buff.push_back('\\');
5910  break;
5911  case 'N': // next line
5912  unescape_escaped_unicode(0x85u, buff);
5913  break;
5914  case '_': // non-breaking space
5915  unescape_escaped_unicode(0xA0u, buff);
5916  break;
5917  case 'L': // line separator
5918  unescape_escaped_unicode(0x2028u, buff);
5919  break;
5920  case 'P': // paragraph separator
5921  unescape_escaped_unicode(0x2029u, buff);
5922  break;
5923  case 'x': {
5924  char32_t codepoint{0};
5925  ret = extract_codepoint(begin, end, 1, codepoint);
5926  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (ret)
5927  {
5928  unescape_escaped_unicode(codepoint, buff);
5929  }
5930  break;
5931  }
5932  case 'u': {
5933  char32_t codepoint{0};
5934  ret = extract_codepoint(begin, end, 2, codepoint);
5935  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (ret)
5936  {
5937  unescape_escaped_unicode(codepoint, buff);
5938  }
5939  break;
5940  }
5941  case 'U': {
5942  char32_t codepoint{0};
5943  ret = extract_codepoint(begin, end, 4, codepoint);
5944  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (ret)
5945  {
5946  unescape_escaped_unicode(codepoint, buff);
5947  }
5948  break;
5949  }
5950  default:
5951  // Unsupported escape sequence is found in a string token.
5952  ret = false;
5953  break;
5954  }
5955 
5956  return ret;
5957  }
5958 
5959  static ::std::string escape(const char *begin, const char *end, bool &is_escaped)
5960  {
5961  ::std::string escaped{};
5962  escaped.reserve(std::distance(begin, end));
5963  for (; begin != end; ++begin)
5964  {
5965  switch (*begin)
5966  {
5967  case 0x01:
5968  escaped += "\\u0001";
5969  is_escaped = true;
5970  break;
5971  case 0x02:
5972  escaped += "\\u0002";
5973  is_escaped = true;
5974  break;
5975  case 0x03:
5976  escaped += "\\u0003";
5977  is_escaped = true;
5978  break;
5979  case 0x04:
5980  escaped += "\\u0004";
5981  is_escaped = true;
5982  break;
5983  case 0x05:
5984  escaped += "\\u0005";
5985  is_escaped = true;
5986  break;
5987  case 0x06:
5988  escaped += "\\u0006";
5989  is_escaped = true;
5990  break;
5991  case '\a':
5992  escaped += "\\a";
5993  is_escaped = true;
5994  break;
5995  case '\b':
5996  escaped += "\\b";
5997  is_escaped = true;
5998  break;
5999  case '\t':
6000  escaped += "\\t";
6001  is_escaped = true;
6002  break;
6003  case '\n':
6004  escaped += "\\n";
6005  is_escaped = true;
6006  break;
6007  case '\v':
6008  escaped += "\\v";
6009  is_escaped = true;
6010  break;
6011  case '\f':
6012  escaped += "\\f";
6013  is_escaped = true;
6014  break;
6015  case '\r':
6016  escaped += "\\r";
6017  is_escaped = true;
6018  break;
6019  case 0x0E:
6020  escaped += "\\u000E";
6021  is_escaped = true;
6022  break;
6023  case 0x0F:
6024  escaped += "\\u000F";
6025  is_escaped = true;
6026  break;
6027  case 0x10:
6028  escaped += "\\u0010";
6029  is_escaped = true;
6030  break;
6031  case 0x11:
6032  escaped += "\\u0011";
6033  is_escaped = true;
6034  break;
6035  case 0x12:
6036  escaped += "\\u0012";
6037  is_escaped = true;
6038  break;
6039  case 0x13:
6040  escaped += "\\u0013";
6041  is_escaped = true;
6042  break;
6043  case 0x14:
6044  escaped += "\\u0014";
6045  is_escaped = true;
6046  break;
6047  case 0x15:
6048  escaped += "\\u0015";
6049  is_escaped = true;
6050  break;
6051  case 0x16:
6052  escaped += "\\u0016";
6053  is_escaped = true;
6054  break;
6055  case 0x17:
6056  escaped += "\\u0017";
6057  is_escaped = true;
6058  break;
6059  case 0x18:
6060  escaped += "\\u0018";
6061  is_escaped = true;
6062  break;
6063  case 0x19:
6064  escaped += "\\u0019";
6065  is_escaped = true;
6066  break;
6067  case 0x1A:
6068  escaped += "\\u001A";
6069  is_escaped = true;
6070  break;
6071  case 0x1B:
6072  escaped += "\\e";
6073  is_escaped = true;
6074  break;
6075  case 0x1C:
6076  escaped += "\\u001C";
6077  is_escaped = true;
6078  break;
6079  case 0x1D:
6080  escaped += "\\u001D";
6081  is_escaped = true;
6082  break;
6083  case 0x1E:
6084  escaped += "\\u001E";
6085  is_escaped = true;
6086  break;
6087  case 0x1F:
6088  escaped += "\\u001F";
6089  is_escaped = true;
6090  break;
6091  case '\"':
6092  escaped += "\\\"";
6093  is_escaped = true;
6094  break;
6095  case '\\':
6096  escaped += "\\\\";
6097  is_escaped = true;
6098  break;
6099  default:
6100  const std::ptrdiff_t diff = static_cast<int>(std::distance(begin, end));
6101  if (diff > 1)
6102  {
6103  if (*begin == static_cast<char>(0xC2u) &&
6104  *(begin + 1) == static_cast<char>(0x85u))
6105  {
6106  escaped += "\\N";
6107  std::advance(begin, 1);
6108  is_escaped = true;
6109  break;
6110  }
6111  if (*begin == static_cast<char>(0xC2u) &&
6112  *(begin + 1) == static_cast<char>(0xA0u))
6113  {
6114  escaped += "\\_";
6115  std::advance(begin, 1);
6116  is_escaped = true;
6117  break;
6118  }
6119 
6120  if (diff > 2)
6121  {
6122  if (*begin == static_cast<char>(0xE2u) &&
6123  *(begin + 1) == static_cast<char>(0x80u) &&
6124  *(begin + 2) == static_cast<char>(0xA8u))
6125  {
6126  escaped += "\\L";
6127  std::advance(begin, 2);
6128  is_escaped = true;
6129  break;
6130  }
6131  if (*begin == static_cast<char>(0xE2u) &&
6132  *(begin + 1) == static_cast<char>(0x80u) &&
6133  *(begin + 2) == static_cast<char>(0xA9u))
6134  {
6135  escaped += "\\P";
6136  std::advance(begin, 2);
6137  is_escaped = true;
6138  break;
6139  }
6140  }
6141  }
6142  escaped += *begin;
6143  break;
6144  }
6145  }
6146  return escaped;
6147  } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
6148 
6149  private:
6150  static bool convert_hexchar_to_byte(char source, uint8_t &byte)
6151  {
6152  if ('0' <= source && source <= '9')
6153  {
6154  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(bugprone-narrowing-conversions,cppcoreguidelines-narrowing-conversions)
6155  byte = static_cast<uint8_t>(source - '0');
6156  return true;
6157  }
6158 
6159  if ('A' <= source && source <= 'F')
6160  {
6161  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(bugprone-narrowing-conversions,cppcoreguidelines-narrowing-conversions)
6162  byte = static_cast<uint8_t>(source - 'A' + 10);
6163  return true;
6164  }
6165 
6166  if ('a' <= source && source <= 'f')
6167  {
6168  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(bugprone-narrowing-conversions,cppcoreguidelines-narrowing-conversions)
6169  byte = static_cast<uint8_t>(source - 'a' + 10);
6170  return true;
6171  }
6172 
6173  // The given character is not hexadecimal.
6174  return false;
6175  }
6176 
6177  static bool extract_codepoint(const char *&begin, const char *end, int bytes_to_read,
6178  char32_t &codepoint)
6179  {
6180  const bool has_enough_room =
6181  static_cast<int>(std::distance(begin, end)) >= (bytes_to_read - 1);
6182  if (!has_enough_room)
6183  {
6184  return false;
6185  }
6186 
6187  const int read_size = bytes_to_read * 2;
6188  uint8_t byte{0};
6189  codepoint = 0;
6190 
6191  for (int i = read_size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
6192  {
6193  const bool is_valid = convert_hexchar_to_byte(*++begin, byte);
6194  if (!is_valid)
6195  {
6196  return false;
6197  }
6198  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(bugprone-narrowing-conversions,cppcoreguidelines-narrowing-conversions)
6199  codepoint |= static_cast<char32_t>(byte << (4 * i));
6200  }
6201 
6202  return true;
6203  }
6204 
6205  static void unescape_escaped_unicode(char32_t codepoint, std::string &buff)
6206  {
6207  // the inner curly braces are necessary to build with older compilers.
6208  std::array<uint8_t, 4> encode_buff{{}};
6209  uint32_t encoded_size{0};
6210  utf8::from_utf32(codepoint, encode_buff, encoded_size);
6211  buff.append(reinterpret_cast<char *>(encode_buff.data()), encoded_size);
6212  }
6213 };
6214 
6215 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
6216 
6217 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_YAML_ESCAPER_HPP */
6218 
6219 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/block_scalar_header.hpp>
6220 
6221 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/scalar_scanner.hpp>
6222 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
6223 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
6224 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
6225 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
6226 //
6227 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
6228 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
6229 
6230 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_SCALAR_SCANNER_HPP
6231 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_SCALAR_SCANNER_HPP
6232 
6233 #include <cstring>
6234 #include <string>
6235 
6236 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
6237 
6238 // #include <fkYAML/detail/assert.hpp>
6239 
6240 // #include <fkYAML/node_type.hpp>
6241 
6242 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
6243 
6245 class scalar_scanner
6246 {
6247  public:
6252  static node_type scan(const char *begin, const char *end) noexcept
6253  {
6254  if (begin == end)
6255  {
6256  return node_type::STRING;
6257  }
6258 
6259  const auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::distance(begin, end));
6260  if (len > 5)
6261  {
6262  return scan_possible_number_token(begin, len);
6263  }
6264 
6265  const char *p_begin = &*begin;
6266 
6267  switch (len)
6268  {
6269  case 1:
6270  if (*p_begin == '~')
6271  {
6272  return node_type::NULL_OBJECT;
6273  }
6274  break;
6275  case 4:
6276  switch (*p_begin)
6277  {
6278  case 'n':
6279  // no possible case of begin a number otherwise.
6280  return (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "ull", 3) == 0) ? node_type::NULL_OBJECT
6281  : node_type::STRING;
6282  case 'N':
6283  // no possible case of begin a number otherwise.
6284  return ((std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "ull", 3) == 0) ||
6285  (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "ULL", 3) == 0))
6286  ? node_type::NULL_OBJECT
6287  : node_type::STRING;
6288  case 't':
6289  // no possible case of being a number otherwise.
6290  return (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "rue", 3) == 0) ? node_type::BOOLEAN
6291  : node_type::STRING;
6292  case 'T':
6293  // no possible case of being a number otherwise.
6294  return ((std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "rue", 3) == 0) ||
6295  (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "RUE", 3) == 0))
6296  ? node_type::BOOLEAN
6297  : node_type::STRING;
6298  case '.': {
6299  const char *p_from_second = p_begin + 1;
6300  const bool is_inf_or_nan_scalar = (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "inf", 3) == 0) ||
6301  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "Inf", 3) == 0) ||
6302  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "INF", 3) == 0) ||
6303  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "nan", 3) == 0) ||
6304  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "NaN", 3) == 0) ||
6305  (std::strncmp(p_from_second, "NAN", 3) == 0);
6306  if (is_inf_or_nan_scalar)
6307  {
6308  return node_type::FLOAT;
6309  }
6310  // maybe a number.
6311  break;
6312  }
6313  default:
6314  break;
6315  }
6316  break;
6317  case 5:
6318  switch (*p_begin)
6319  {
6320  case 'f':
6321  // no possible case of being a number otherwise.
6322  return (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "alse", 4) == 0) ? node_type::BOOLEAN
6323  : node_type::STRING;
6324  case 'F':
6325  // no possible case of being a number otherwise.
6326  return ((std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "alse", 4) == 0) ||
6327  (std::strncmp(p_begin + 1, "ALSE", 4) == 0))
6328  ? node_type::BOOLEAN
6329  : node_type::STRING;
6330  case '+':
6331  case '-':
6332  if (*(p_begin + 1) == '.')
6333  {
6334  const char *p_from_third = p_begin + 2;
6335  const bool is_min_inf = (std::strncmp(p_from_third, "inf", 3) == 0) ||
6336  (std::strncmp(p_from_third, "Inf", 3) == 0) ||
6337  (std::strncmp(p_from_third, "INF", 3) == 0);
6338  if (is_min_inf)
6339  {
6340  return node_type::FLOAT;
6341  }
6342  }
6343  // maybe a number.
6344  break;
6345  default:
6346  break;
6347  }
6348  break;
6349  default:
6350  break;
6351  }
6352 
6353  return scan_possible_number_token(begin, len);
6354  }
6355 
6356  private:
6362  static node_type scan_possible_number_token(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6363  {
6364  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6365 
6366  switch (*itr)
6367  {
6368  case '-':
6369  return (len > 1) ? scan_negative_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6370  case '+':
6371  return (len > 1) ? scan_decimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6372  case '.':
6373  // some integer(s) required after the decimal point as a floating point value.
6374  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_decimal_point(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6375  case '0':
6376  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_zero_at_first(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6377  case '1':
6378  case '2':
6379  case '3':
6380  case '4':
6381  case '5':
6382  case '6':
6383  case '7':
6384  case '8':
6385  case '9':
6386  return (len > 1) ? scan_decimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6387  default:
6388  return node_type::STRING;
6389  }
6390  }
6391 
6396  static node_type scan_negative_number(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6397  {
6398  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6399 
6400  if (is_digit(*itr))
6401  {
6402  return (len > 1) ? scan_decimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6403  }
6404 
6405  if (*itr == '.')
6406  {
6407  // some integer(s) required after "-." as a floating point value.
6408  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_decimal_point(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6409  }
6410 
6411  return node_type::STRING;
6412  }
6413 
6418  static node_type scan_after_zero_at_first(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6419  {
6420  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6421 
6422  if (is_digit(*itr))
6423  {
6424  // a token consisting of the beginning '0' and some following numbers, e.g., `0123`, is
6425  // not an integer according to https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#10213-integer.
6426  return node_type::STRING;
6427  }
6428 
6429  switch (*itr)
6430  {
6431  case '.':
6432  // 0 can be omitted after `0.`.
6433  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_decimal_point(++itr, --len) : node_type::FLOAT;
6434  case 'e':
6435  case 'E':
6436  // some integer(s) required after the exponent sign as a floating point value.
6437  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_exponent(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6438  case 'o':
6439  return (len > 1) ? scan_octal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6440  case 'x':
6441  return (len > 1) ? scan_hexadecimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6442  default:
6443  return node_type::STRING;
6444  }
6445  }
6446 
6451  static node_type scan_decimal_number(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6452  {
6453  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6454 
6455  if (is_digit(*itr))
6456  {
6457  return (len > 1) ? scan_decimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6458  }
6459 
6460  switch (*itr)
6461  {
6462  case '.': {
6463  // 0 can be omitted after the decimal point
6464  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_decimal_point(++itr, --len) : node_type::FLOAT;
6465  }
6466  case 'e':
6467  case 'E':
6468  // some integer(s) required after the exponent
6469  return (len > 1) ? scan_after_exponent(++itr, --len) : node_type::STRING;
6470  default:
6471  return node_type::STRING;
6472  }
6473  }
6474 
6479  static node_type scan_after_decimal_point(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6480  {
6481  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6482 
6483  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < len; i++)
6484  {
6485  const char c = *itr++;
6486 
6487  if (is_digit(c))
6488  {
6489  continue;
6490  }
6491 
6492  if (c == 'e' || c == 'E')
6493  {
6494  if (i == len - 1)
6495  {
6496  // some integer(s) required after the exponent
6497  return node_type::STRING;
6498  }
6499  return scan_after_exponent(itr, len - i - 1);
6500  }
6501 
6502  return node_type::STRING;
6503  }
6504 
6505  return node_type::FLOAT;
6506  }
6507 
6513  static node_type scan_after_exponent(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6514  {
6515  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6516 
6517  const char c = *itr;
6518  if (c == '+' || c == '-')
6519  {
6520  if (len == 1)
6521  {
6522  // some integer(s) required after the sign.
6523  return node_type::STRING;
6524  }
6525  ++itr;
6526  --len;
6527  }
6528 
6529  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < len; i++)
6530  {
6531  if (!is_digit(*itr++))
6532  {
6533  return node_type::STRING;
6534  }
6535  }
6536 
6537  return node_type::FLOAT;
6538  }
6539 
6544  static node_type scan_octal_number(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6545  {
6546  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6547 
6548  switch (*itr)
6549  {
6550  case '0':
6551  case '1':
6552  case '2':
6553  case '3':
6554  case '4':
6555  case '5':
6556  case '6':
6557  case '7':
6558  return (len > 1) ? scan_octal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6559  default:
6560  return node_type::STRING;
6561  }
6562  }
6563 
6568  static node_type scan_hexadecimal_number(const char *itr, uint32_t len) noexcept
6569  {
6570  FK_YAML_ASSERT(len > 0);
6571 
6572  if (is_xdigit(*itr))
6573  {
6574  return (len > 1) ? scan_hexadecimal_number(++itr, --len) : node_type::INTEGER;
6575  }
6576  return node_type::STRING;
6577  }
6578 
6584  static bool is_digit(char c)
6585  {
6586  return ('0' <= c && c <= '9');
6587  }
6588 
6594  static bool is_xdigit(char c)
6595  {
6596  return (('0' <= c && c <= '9') || ('A' <= c && c <= 'F') || ('a' <= c && c <= 'f'));
6597  }
6598 };
6599 
6600 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
6601 
6602 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_SCALAR_SCANNER_HPP */
6603 
6604 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/tag_t.hpp>
6605 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
6606 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
6607 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
6608 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
6609 //
6610 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
6611 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
6612 
6613 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_TAG_T_HPP
6614 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_TAG_T_HPP
6615 
6616 #include <cstdint>
6617 
6618 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
6619 
6620 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
6621 
6623 enum class tag_t : std::uint8_t
6624 {
6625  NONE,
6626  NON_SPECIFIC,
6627  CUSTOM_TAG,
6628  SEQUENCE,
6629  MAPPING,
6630  NULL_VALUE,
6631  BOOLEAN,
6632  INTEGER,
6633  FLOATING_NUMBER,
6634  STRING,
6635 };
6636 
6637 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
6638 
6639 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_TAG_T_HPP */
6640 
6641 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
6642 
6643 // #include <fkYAML/detail/str_view.hpp>
6644 
6645 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/lexical_token_t.hpp>
6646 
6647 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
6648 
6649 // #include <fkYAML/node_type.hpp>
6650 
6651 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
6652 
6655 template <typename BasicNodeType> class scalar_parser
6656 {
6657  static_assert(is_basic_node<BasicNodeType>::value,
6658  "scalar_parser only accepts basic_node<...>");
6659 
6660  public:
6661  using basic_node_type = BasicNodeType;
6662 
6663  private:
6665  using boolean_type = typename basic_node_type::boolean_type;
6667  using integer_type = typename basic_node_type::integer_type;
6669  using float_number_type = typename basic_node_type::float_number_type;
6671  using string_type = typename basic_node_type::string_type;
6672 
6673  public:
6677  scalar_parser(uint32_t line, uint32_t indent) noexcept : m_line(line), m_indent(indent)
6678  {
6679  }
6680 
6682  ~scalar_parser() noexcept = default;
6683 
6684  // std::string's copy constructor/assignment operator may throw a exception.
6685  scalar_parser(const scalar_parser &) = default;
6686  scalar_parser &operator=(const scalar_parser &) = default;
6687 
6688  scalar_parser(scalar_parser &&) noexcept = default;
6689  scalar_parser &operator=(scalar_parser &&) noexcept(
6690  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<std::string>::value) = default;
6691 
6697  basic_node_type parse_flow(lexical_token_t lex_type, tag_t tag_type, str_view token)
6698  {
6699  FK_YAML_ASSERT(lex_type == lexical_token_t::PLAIN_SCALAR ||
6700  lex_type == lexical_token_t::SINGLE_QUOTED_SCALAR ||
6701  lex_type == lexical_token_t::DOUBLE_QUOTED_SCALAR);
6702  FK_YAML_ASSERT(tag_type != tag_t::SEQUENCE && tag_type != tag_t::MAPPING);
6703 
6704  token = parse_flow_scalar_token(lex_type, token);
6705  const node_type value_type = decide_value_type(lex_type, tag_type, token);
6706  return create_scalar_node(value_type, tag_type, token);
6707  }
6708 
6715  basic_node_type parse_block(lexical_token_t lex_type, tag_t tag_type, str_view token,
6716  const block_scalar_header &header)
6717  {
6718  FK_YAML_ASSERT(lex_type == lexical_token_t::BLOCK_LITERAL_SCALAR ||
6719  lex_type == lexical_token_t::BLOCK_FOLDED_SCALAR);
6720  FK_YAML_ASSERT(tag_type != tag_t::SEQUENCE && tag_type != tag_t::MAPPING);
6721 
6722  if (lex_type == lexical_token_t::BLOCK_LITERAL_SCALAR)
6723  {
6724  token = parse_block_literal_scalar(token, header);
6725  }
6726  else
6727  {
6728  token = parse_block_folded_scalar(token, header);
6729  }
6730 
6731  const node_type value_type = decide_value_type(lex_type, tag_type, token);
6732  return create_scalar_node(value_type, tag_type, token);
6733  }
6734 
6735  private:
