9439  }
9440 
9441  if (byte0 == static_cast<uint8_t>(0xFFu) && byte1 == static_cast<uint8_t>(0xFEu))
9442  {
9443  has_bom = true;
9444  return utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE;
9445  }
9446 
9447  // Test the first character assuming it's an ASCII character.
9448 
9449  if (byte0 == 0 && byte1 == 0 && byte2 == 0 && 0 < byte3 && byte3 < static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80u))
9450  {
9451  return utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE;
9452  }
9453 
9454  if (0 < byte0 && byte0 < static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80u) && byte1 == 0 && byte2 == 0 && byte3 == 0)
9455  {
9456  return utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE;
9457  }
9458 
9459  if (byte0 == 0 && 0 < byte1 && byte1 < static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80u))
9460  {
9461  return utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE;
9462  }
9463 
9464  if (0 < byte0 && byte0 < static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80u) && byte1 == 0)
9465  {
9466  return utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE;
9467  }
9468 
9469  return utf_encode_t::UTF_8;
9470 }
9471 
9474 template <typename ItrType, typename = void> struct utf_encode_detector
9475 {
9476 };
9477 
9480 template <typename ItrType>
9481 struct utf_encode_detector<ItrType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<ItrType, char>::value>>
9482 {
9487  static utf_encode_t detect(ItrType &begin, const ItrType &end) noexcept
9488  {
9489  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
9490  {
9491  return utf_encode_t::UTF_8;
9492  }
9493 
9494  // the inner curly braces are necessary for older compilers
9495  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{{}};
9496  bytes.fill(0xFFu);
9497  for (int i = 0; i < 4 && begin + i != end; i++)
9498  {
9499  bytes[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(
9500  begin[i]); // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9501  }
9502 
9503  bool has_bom = false;
9504  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9505 
9506  if (has_bom)
9507  {
9508  // skip reading the BOM.
9509  switch (encode_type)
9510  {
9511  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
9512  std::advance(begin, 3);
9513  break;
9514  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
9515  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
9516  std::advance(begin, 2);
9517  break;
9518  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
9519  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
9520  std::advance(begin, 4);
9521  break;
9522  }
9523  }
9524 
9525  return encode_type;
9526  }
9527 };
9528 
9529 #if FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T
9530 
9533 template <typename ItrType>
9534 struct utf_encode_detector<ItrType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<ItrType, char8_t>::value>>
9535 {
9540  static utf_encode_t detect(ItrType &begin, const ItrType &end)
9541  {
9542  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
9543  {
9544  return utf_encode_t::UTF_8;
9545  }
9546 
9547  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{};
9548  bytes.fill(0xFFu);
9549  for (int i = 0; i < 4 && begin + i != end; i++)
9550  {
9551  bytes[i] =
9552  uint8_t(begin[i]); // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9553  }
9554 
9555  bool has_bom = false;
9556  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9557 
9558  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (encode_type != utf_encode_t::UTF_8)
9559  {
9560  throw exception("char8_t characters must be encoded in the UTF-8 format.");
9561  }
9562 
9563  if (has_bom)
9564  {
9565  // skip reading the BOM.
9566  std::advance(begin, 3);
9567  }
9568 
9569  return encode_type;
9570  }
9571 };
9572 
9573 #endif // FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T
9574 
9577 template <typename ItrType>
9578 struct utf_encode_detector<ItrType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<ItrType, char16_t>::value>>
9579 {
9584  static utf_encode_t detect(ItrType &begin, const ItrType &end)
9585  {
9586  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
9587  {
9588  return utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE;
9589  }
9590 
9591  // the inner curly braces are necessary for older compilers
9592  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{{}};
9593  bytes.fill(0xFFu);
9594  for (int i = 0; i < 2 && begin + i != end; i++)
9595  {
9596  // NOLINTBEGIN(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9597  const char16_t elem = begin[i];
9598  const int idx_base = i * 2;
9599  bytes[idx_base] = static_cast<uint8_t>((elem & 0xFF00u) >> 8);
9600  bytes[idx_base + 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(elem & 0xFFu);
9601  // NOLINTEND(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9602  }
9603 
9604  bool has_bom = false;
9605  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9606 
9607  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (encode_type != utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE &&
9608  encode_type != utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE)
9609  {
9610  throw exception("char16_t characters must be encoded in the UTF-16 format.");
9611  }
9612 
9613  if (has_bom)
9614  {
9615  // skip reading the BOM.
9616  std::advance(begin, 1);
9617  }
9618 
9619  return encode_type;
9620  }
9621 };
9622 
9625 template <typename ItrType>
9626 struct utf_encode_detector<ItrType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<ItrType, char32_t>::value>>
9627 {
9632  static utf_encode_t detect(ItrType &begin, const ItrType &end)
9633  {
9634  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (begin == end)
9635  {
9636  return utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE;
9637  }
9638 
9639  // the inner curly braces are necessary for older compilers
9640  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{{}};
9641  const char32_t elem = *begin;
9642  bytes[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>((elem & 0xFF000000u) >> 24);
9643  bytes[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>((elem & 0x00FF0000u) >> 16);
9644  bytes[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>((elem & 0x0000FF00u) >> 8);
9645  bytes[3] = static_cast<uint8_t>(elem & 0x000000FFu);
9646 
9647  bool has_bom = false;
9648  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9649 
9650  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (encode_type != utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE &&
9651  encode_type != utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE)
9652  {
9653  throw exception("char32_t characters must be encoded in the UTF-32 format.");
9654  }
9655 
9656  if (has_bom)
9657  {
9658  // skip reading the BOM.
9659  std::advance(begin, 1);
9660  }
9661 
9662  return encode_type;
9663  }
9664 };
9665 
9667 struct file_utf_encode_detector
9668 {
9672  static utf_encode_t detect(std::FILE *p_file) noexcept
9673  {
9674  // the inner curly braces are necessary for older compilers
9675  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{{}};
9676  bytes.fill(0xFFu);
9677  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
9678  {
9679  char byte = 0;
9680  const std::size_t size = std::fread(&byte, sizeof(char), 1, p_file);
9681  if (size != sizeof(char))
9682  {
9683  break;
9684  }
9685  bytes[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(
9686  byte & 0xFF); // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9687  }
9688 
9689  bool has_bom = false;
9690  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9691 
9692  // move back to the beginning if a BOM doesn't exist.
9693  long offset = 0; // NOLINT(google-runtime-int)
9694  if (has_bom)
9695  {
9696  switch (encode_type)
9697  {
9698  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
9699  offset = 3;
9700  break;
9701  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
9702  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
9703  offset = 2;
9704  break;
9705  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
9706  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
9707  offset = 4;
9708  break;
9709  }
9710  }
9711  std::fseek(p_file, offset, SEEK_SET); // NOLINT(cert-err33-c)
9712 
9713  return encode_type;
9714  }
9715 };
9716 
9718 struct stream_utf_encode_detector
9719 {
9723  static utf_encode_t detect(std::istream &is) noexcept
9724  {
9725  // the inner curly braces are necessary for older compilers
9726  std::array<uint8_t, 4> bytes{{}};
9727  bytes.fill(0xFFu);
9728  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
9729  {
9730  char ch = 0;
9731  is.read(&ch, 1);
9732  const std::streamsize size = is.gcount();
9733  if (size != 1)
9734  {
9735  // without this, seekg() will fail.
9736  is.clear();
9737  break;
9738  }
9739  bytes[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(
9740  ch & 0xFF); // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9741  }
9742 
9743  bool has_bom = false;
9744  const utf_encode_t encode_type = detect_encoding_type(bytes, has_bom);
9745 
9746  // move back to the beginning if a BOM doesn't exist.
9747  std::streamoff offset = 0;
9748  if (has_bom)
9749  {
9750  switch (encode_type)
9751  {
9752  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
9753  offset = 3;
9754  break;
9755  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
9756  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
9757  offset = 2;
9758  break;
9759  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
9760  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
9761  offset = 4;
9762  break;
9763  }
9764  }
9765  is.seekg(offset, std::ios_base::beg);
9766 
9767  return encode_type;
9768  }
9769 };
9770 
9771 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
9772 
9773 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ENCODINGS_UTF_ENCODE_DETECTOR_HPP */
9774 
9775 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/utf_encode_t.hpp>
9776 
9777 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/utf_encodings.hpp>
9778 
9779 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/input_adapter_traits.hpp>
9780 
9781 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
9782 
9783 // #include <fkYAML/detail/str_view.hpp>
9784 
9785 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
9786 
9787 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
9788 
9790 // input_adapter //
9792 
9793 template <typename IterType, typename = void> class iterator_input_adapter;
9794 
9797 template <typename IterType>
9798 class iterator_input_adapter<IterType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<IterType, char>::value>>
9799 {
9800  public:
9802  iterator_input_adapter() = default;
9803 
9809  iterator_input_adapter(IterType begin, IterType end, utf_encode_t encode_type,
9810  bool is_contiguous) noexcept
9811  : m_begin(begin), m_end(end), m_encode_type(encode_type), m_is_contiguous(is_contiguous)
9812  {
9813  }
9814 
9815  // allow only move construct/assignment like other input adapters.
9816  iterator_input_adapter(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
9817  iterator_input_adapter(iterator_input_adapter &&rhs) = default;
9818  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
9819  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(iterator_input_adapter &&) = default;
9820  ~iterator_input_adapter() = default;
9821 
9824  str_view get_buffer_view()
9825  {
9826  m_buffer.clear();
9827 
9828  switch (m_encode_type)
9829  {
9830  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
9831  return get_buffer_view_utf8();
9832  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
9833  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
9834  return get_buffer_view_utf16();
9835  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
9836  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
9837  return get_buffer_view_utf32();
9838  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9839  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9840  }
9841  }
9842 
9843  private:
9846  str_view get_buffer_view_utf8()
9847  {
9848  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_8);
9849 
9850  IterType current = m_begin;
9851  while (current != m_end)
9852  {
9853  const auto first = static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++);
9854  const uint32_t num_bytes = utf8::get_num_bytes(first);
9855 
9856  switch (num_bytes)
9857  {
9858  case 2: {
9859  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
9860  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
9861  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
9862  {
9863  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
9864  }
9865  break;
9866  }
9867  case 3: {
9868  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
9869  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
9870  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
9871  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
9872  {
9873  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
9874  }
9875  break;
9876  }
9877  case 4: {
9878  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
9879  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
9880  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
9881  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
9882  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
9883  {
9884  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
9885  }
9886  break;
9887  }
9888  case 1:
9889  default:
9890  break;
9891  }
9892  }
9893 
9894  IterType cr_or_end_itr = std::find(m_begin, m_end, '\r');
9895  const bool is_contiguous_no_cr = (cr_or_end_itr == m_end) && m_is_contiguous;
9896  if (is_contiguous_no_cr)
9897  {
9898  // The input iterators (begin, end) can be used as-is during parsing.
9899  return str_view{m_begin, m_end};
9900  }
9901 
9902  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end));
9903 
9904  current = m_begin;
9905  do
9906  {
9907  m_buffer.append(current, cr_or_end_itr);
9908  if (cr_or_end_itr == m_end)
9909  {
9910  break;
9911  }
9912  current = std::next(cr_or_end_itr);
9913  cr_or_end_itr = std::find(current, m_end, '\r');
9914  } while (current != m_end);
9915 
9916  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
9917  }
9918 
9921  str_view get_buffer_view_utf16()
9922  {
9923  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE ||
9924  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE);
9925 
9926  // Assume the input characters are all ASCII characters.
9927  // That's the most probably the case.
9928  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end) / 2);
9929 
9930  int shift_bits[2]{0, 0};
9931  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE)
9932  {
9933  shift_bits[0] = 8;
9934  }
9935  else // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE
9936  {
9937  shift_bits[1] = 8;
9938  }
9939 
9940  std::array<char16_t, 2> encoded_buffer{{0, 0}};
9941  uint32_t encoded_buf_size{0};
9942  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
9943  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
9944 
9945  IterType current = m_begin;
9946  while (current != m_end || encoded_buf_size != 0)
9947  {
9948  while (current != m_end && encoded_buf_size < 2)
9949  {
9950  auto utf16 =
9951  static_cast<char16_t>(static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++) << shift_bits[0]);
9952  utf16 |= static_cast<char16_t>(static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++) << shift_bits[1]);
9953 
9954  // skip appending CRs.
9955  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf16 != char16_t(0x000Du))
9956  {
9957  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
9958  encoded_buffer[encoded_buf_size++] = utf16;
9959  }
9960  }
9961 
9962  uint32_t consumed_size = 0;
9963  utf8::from_utf16(encoded_buffer, utf8_buffer, consumed_size, utf8_buf_size);
9964 
9965  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (consumed_size == 1)
9966  {
9967  encoded_buffer[0] = encoded_buffer[1];
9968  }
9969  encoded_buf_size -= consumed_size;
9970 
9971  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
9972  }
9973 
9974  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
9975  }
9976 
9979  str_view get_buffer_view_utf32()
9980  {
9981  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE ||
9982  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE);
9983 
9984  // Assume the input characters are all ASCII characters.
9985  // That's the most probably the case.
9986  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end) / 4);
9987 
9988  int shift_bits[4]{0, 0, 0, 0};
9989  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE)
9990  {
9991  shift_bits[0] = 24;
9992  shift_bits[1] = 16;
9993  shift_bits[2] = 8;
9994  }
9995  else // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE
9996  {
9997  shift_bits[1] = 8;
9998  shift_bits[2] = 16;
9999  shift_bits[3] = 24;
10000  }
10001 
10002  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10003  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10004 
10005  IterType current = m_begin;
10006  while (current != m_end)
10007  {
10008  auto utf32 = static_cast<char32_t>(*current++ << shift_bits[0]);
10009  utf32 |= static_cast<char32_t>(*current++ << shift_bits[1]);
10010  utf32 |= static_cast<char32_t>(*current++ << shift_bits[2]);
10011  utf32 |= static_cast<char32_t>(*current++ << shift_bits[3]);
10012 
10013  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf32 != char32_t(0x0000000Du))
10014  {
10015  utf8::from_utf32(utf32, utf8_buffer, utf8_buf_size);
10016  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10017  }
10018  }
10019 
10020  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10021  }
10022 
10023  private:
10025  IterType m_begin{};
10027  IterType m_end{};
10029  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_8};
10031  std::string m_buffer;
10033  bool m_is_contiguous{false};
10034 };
10035 
10036 #if FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T
10037 
10040 template <typename IterType>
10041 class iterator_input_adapter<IterType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<IterType, char8_t>::value>>
10042 {
10043  public:
10045  iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10046 
10052  iterator_input_adapter(IterType begin, IterType end, utf_encode_t encode_type,
10053  bool is_contiguous) noexcept
10054  : m_begin(begin), m_end(end), m_encode_type(encode_type), m_is_contiguous(is_contiguous)
10055  {
10056  // char8_t characters must be encoded in the UTF-8 format.
10057  // See https://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2018/p0482r6.html.
10058  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_8);
10059  }
10060 
10061  // allow only move construct/assignment like other input adapters.
10062  iterator_input_adapter(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10063  iterator_input_adapter(iterator_input_adapter &&rhs) = default;
10064  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10065  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(iterator_input_adapter &&) = default;
10066  ~iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10067 
10070  str_view get_buffer_view()
10071  {
10072  IterType current = m_begin;
10073  while (current != m_end)
10074  {
10075  const auto first = static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++);
10076  const uint32_t num_bytes = utf8::get_num_bytes(first);
10077 
10078  switch (num_bytes)
10079  {
10080  case 2: {
10081  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, uint8_t(*current++)};
10082  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10083  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10084  {
10085  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10086  }
10087  break;
10088  }
10089  case 3: {
10090  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, uint8_t(*current++),
10091  uint8_t(*current++)};
10092  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10093  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10094  {
10095  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10096  }
10097  break;
10098  }
10099  case 4: {
10100  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{
10101  first, uint8_t(*current++), uint8_t(*current++), uint8_t(*current++)};
10102  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10103  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10104  {
10105  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10106  }
10107  break;
10108  }
10109  case 1:
10110  default:
10111  break;
10112  }
10113  }
10114 
10115  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end));
10116  current = m_begin;
10117 
10118  while (current != m_end)
10119  {
10120  const auto c = static_cast<char>(*current++);
10121  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (c != '\r')
10122  {
10123  m_buffer.push_back(c);
10124  }
10125  }
10126 
10127  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10128  }
10129 
10130  private:
10132  IterType m_begin{};
10134  IterType m_end{};
10136  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_8};
10138  std::string m_buffer;
10140  bool m_is_contiguous{false};
10141 };
10142 
10143 #endif // FK_YAML_HAS_CHAR8_T
10144 
10147 template <typename IterType>
10148 class iterator_input_adapter<IterType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<IterType, char16_t>::value>>
10149 {
10150  public:
10152  iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10153 
10159  iterator_input_adapter(IterType begin, IterType end, utf_encode_t encode_type,
10160  bool is_contiguous) noexcept
10161  : m_begin(begin), m_end(end), m_encode_type(encode_type), m_is_contiguous(is_contiguous)
10162  {
10163  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE ||
10164  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE);
10165  }
10166 
10167  // allow only move construct/assignment like other input adapters.
10168  iterator_input_adapter(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10169  iterator_input_adapter(iterator_input_adapter &&rhs) = default;
10170  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10171  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(iterator_input_adapter &&) = default;
10172  ~iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10173 
10176  str_view get_buffer_view()
10177  {
10178  const int shift_bits = (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE) ? 0 : 8;
10179 
10180  std::array<char16_t, 2> encoded_buffer{{0, 0}};
10181  uint32_t encoded_buf_size{0};
10182  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10183  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10184 
10185  // Assume the input characters are all ASCII characters.
10186  // That's the most probably the case.
10187  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end));
10188 
10189  IterType current = m_begin;
10190  while (current != m_end || encoded_buf_size != 0)
10191  {
10192  while (current != m_end && encoded_buf_size < 2)
10193  {
10194  char16_t utf16 = *current++;
10195  utf16 = static_cast<char16_t>(((utf16 & 0x00FFu) << shift_bits) |
10196  ((utf16 & 0xFF00u) >> shift_bits));
10197 
10198  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf16 != char16_t(0x000Du))
10199  {
10200  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
10201  encoded_buffer[encoded_buf_size++] = utf16;
10202  }
10203  }
10204 
10205  uint32_t consumed_size = 0;
10206  utf8::from_utf16(encoded_buffer, utf8_buffer, consumed_size, utf8_buf_size);
10207 
10208  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (consumed_size == 1)
10209  {
10210  encoded_buffer[0] = encoded_buffer[1];
10211  encoded_buffer[1] = 0;
10212  }
10213  encoded_buf_size -= consumed_size;
10214 
10215  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10216  }
10217 
10218  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10219  }
10220 
10221  private:
10223  IterType m_begin{};
10225  IterType m_end{};
10227  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE};
10229  std::string m_buffer;
10231  bool m_is_contiguous{false};
10232 };
10233 
10236 template <typename IterType>
10237 class iterator_input_adapter<IterType, enable_if_t<is_iterator_of<IterType, char32_t>::value>>
10238 {
10239  public:
10241  iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10242 
10248  iterator_input_adapter(IterType begin, IterType end, utf_encode_t encode_type,
10249  bool is_contiguous) noexcept
10250  : m_begin(begin), m_end(end), m_encode_type(encode_type), m_is_contiguous(is_contiguous)
10251  {
10252  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE ||
10253  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE);
10254  }
10255 
10256  // allow only move construct/assignment like other input adapters.
10257  iterator_input_adapter(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10258  iterator_input_adapter(iterator_input_adapter &&rhs) = default;
10259  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(const iterator_input_adapter &) = delete;
10260  iterator_input_adapter &operator=(iterator_input_adapter &&) = default;
10261  ~iterator_input_adapter() = default;
10262 
10265  str_view get_buffer_view()
10266  {
10267  int shift_bits[4]{0, 0, 0, 0};
10268  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE)
10269  {
10270  shift_bits[0] = 24;
10271  shift_bits[1] = 8;
10272  shift_bits[2] = 8;
10273  shift_bits[3] = 24;
10274  }
10275 
10276  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10277  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10278 
10279  // Assume the input characters are all ASCII characters.
10280  // That's the most probably the case.
10281  m_buffer.reserve(std::distance(m_begin, m_end));
10282 
10283  IterType current = m_begin;
10284  while (current != m_end)
10285  {
10286  const char32_t tmp = *current++;
10287  const auto utf32 = static_cast<char32_t>(
10288  ((tmp & 0xFF000000u) >> shift_bits[0]) | ((tmp & 0x00FF0000u) >> shift_bits[1]) |
10289  ((tmp & 0x0000FF00u) << shift_bits[2]) | ((tmp & 0x000000FFu) << shift_bits[3]));
10290 
10291  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (utf32 != static_cast<char32_t>(0x0000000Du))
10292  {
10293  utf8::from_utf32(utf32, utf8_buffer, utf8_buf_size);
10294  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10295  }
10296  }
10297 
10298  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10299  }
10300 
10301  private:
10303  IterType m_begin{};
10305  IterType m_end{};
10307  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE};
10309  std::string m_buffer;
10311  bool m_is_contiguous{false};
10312 };
10313 
10315 class file_input_adapter
10316 {
10317  public:
10319  file_input_adapter() = default;
10320 
10327  explicit file_input_adapter(std::FILE *file, utf_encode_t encode_type) noexcept
10328  : m_file(file), m_encode_type(encode_type)
10329  {
10330  }
10331 
10332  // allow only move construct/assignment
10333  file_input_adapter(const file_input_adapter &) = delete;
10334  file_input_adapter(file_input_adapter &&rhs) = default;
10335  file_input_adapter &operator=(const file_input_adapter &) = delete;
10336  file_input_adapter &operator=(file_input_adapter &&) = default;
10337  ~file_input_adapter() = default;
10338 
10341  str_view get_buffer_view()
10342  {
10343  switch (m_encode_type)
10344  {
10345  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
10346  return get_buffer_view_utf8();
10347  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
10348  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
10349  return get_buffer_view_utf16();
10350  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
10351  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
10352  return get_buffer_view_utf32();
10353  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10354  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10355  }
10356  }
10357 
10358  private:
10361  str_view get_buffer_view_utf8()
10362  {
10363  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_8);
10364 
10365  char tmp_buf[256]{};
10366  constexpr std::size_t buf_size = sizeof(tmp_buf) / sizeof(tmp_buf[0]);
10367  std::size_t read_size = 0;
10368  while ((read_size = std::fread(&tmp_buf[0], sizeof(char), buf_size, m_file)) > 0)
10369  {
10370  char *p_current = &tmp_buf[0];
10371  char *p_end = p_current + read_size;
10372  do
10373  {
10374  // find CR in `tmp_buf`.
10375  char *p_cr_or_end = p_current;
10376  while (p_cr_or_end != p_end)
10377  {
10378  if (*p_cr_or_end == '\r')
10379  {
10380  break;
10381  }
10382  ++p_cr_or_end;
10383  }
10384 
10385  m_buffer.append(p_current, p_cr_or_end);
10386  p_current = (p_cr_or_end == p_end) ? p_end : p_cr_or_end + 1;
10387  } while (p_current != p_end);
10388  }
10389 
10390  auto current = m_buffer.begin();
10391  auto end = m_buffer.end();
10392  while (current != end)
10393  {
10394  const auto first = static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++);
10395  const uint32_t num_bytes = utf8::get_num_bytes(first);
10396 
10397  switch (num_bytes)
10398  {
10399  case 2: {
10400  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10401  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10402  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10403  {
10404  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10405  }
10406  break;
10407  }
10408  case 3: {
10409  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10410  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10411  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10412  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10413  {
10414  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10415  }
10416  break;
10417  }
10418  case 4: {
10419  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10420  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10421  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10422  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10423  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10424  {
10425  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10426  }
10427  break;
10428  }
10429  case 1:
10430  default:
10431  break;
10432  }
10433  }
10434 
10435  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10436  }
10437 
10440  str_view get_buffer_view_utf16()
10441  {
10442  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE ||
10443  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE);
10444 
10445  int shift_bits[2]{0, 0};
10446  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE)
10447  {
10448  shift_bits[0] = 8;
10449  }
10450  else
10451  { // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE
10452  shift_bits[1] = 8;
10453  }
10454 
10455  char chars[2] = {0, 0};
10456  std::array<char16_t, 2> encoded_buffer{{0, 0}};
10457  uint32_t encoded_buf_size{0};
10458  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10459  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10460 
10461  while (std::feof(m_file) == 0)
10462  {
10463  while (encoded_buf_size < 2 && std::fread(&chars[0], sizeof(char), 2, m_file) == 2)
10464  {
10465  const auto utf16 =
10466  static_cast<char16_t>((static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[0]) << shift_bits[0]) |
10467  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[1]) << shift_bits[1]));
10468  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf16 != static_cast<char16_t>(0x000Du))
10469  {
10470  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
10471  encoded_buffer[encoded_buf_size++] = utf16;
10472  }
10473  }
10474 
10475  uint32_t consumed_size = 0;
10476  utf8::from_utf16(encoded_buffer, utf8_buffer, consumed_size, utf8_buf_size);
10477 
10478  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (consumed_size == 1)
10479  {
10480  encoded_buffer[0] = encoded_buffer[1];
10481  }
10482  encoded_buf_size -= consumed_size;
10483 
10484  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10485  }
10486 
10487  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10488  }
10489 
10492  str_view get_buffer_view_utf32()
10493  {
10494  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE ||
10495  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE);
10496 
10497  int shift_bits[4]{0, 0, 0, 0};
10498  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE)
10499  {
10500  shift_bits[0] = 24;
10501  shift_bits[1] = 16;
10502  shift_bits[2] = 8;
10503  }
10504  else
10505  { // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE
10506  shift_bits[1] = 8;
10507  shift_bits[2] = 16;
10508  shift_bits[3] = 24;
10509  }
10510 
10511  char chars[4] = {0, 0, 0, 0};
10512  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10513  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10514 
10515  while (std::feof(m_file) == 0)
10516  {
10517  const std::size_t size = std::fread(&chars[0], sizeof(char), 4, m_file);
10518  if (size != 4)
10519  {
10520  break;
10521  }
10522 
10523  const auto utf32 =
10524  static_cast<char32_t>((static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[0]) << shift_bits[0]) |
10525  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[1]) << shift_bits[1]) |
10526  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[2]) << shift_bits[2]) |
10527  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[3]) << shift_bits[3]));
10528 
10529  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf32 != char32_t(0x0000000Du))
10530  {
10531  utf8::from_utf32(utf32, utf8_buffer, utf8_buf_size);
10532  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10533  }
10534  }
10535 
10536  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10537  }
10538 
10539  private:
10541  std::FILE *m_file{nullptr};
10543  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_8};
10545  std::string m_buffer;
10546 };
10547 
10549 class stream_input_adapter
10550 {
10551  public:
10553  stream_input_adapter() = default;
10554 
10558  explicit stream_input_adapter(std::istream &is, utf_encode_t encode_type) noexcept
10559  : m_istream(&is), m_encode_type(encode_type)
10560  {
10561  }
10562 
10563  // allow only move construct/assignment
10564  stream_input_adapter(const stream_input_adapter &) = delete;
10565  stream_input_adapter &operator=(const stream_input_adapter &) = delete;
10566  stream_input_adapter(stream_input_adapter &&) = default;
10567  stream_input_adapter &operator=(stream_input_adapter &&) = default;
10568  ~stream_input_adapter() = default;
10569 
10572  str_view get_buffer_view()
10573  {
10574  switch (m_encode_type)
10575  {
10576  case utf_encode_t::UTF_8:
10577  return get_buffer_view_utf8();
10578  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE:
10579  case utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE:
10580  return get_buffer_view_utf16();
10581  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE:
10582  case utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE:
10583  return get_buffer_view_utf32();
10584  default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10585  detail::unreachable(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10586  }
10587  }
10588 
10589  private:
10592  str_view get_buffer_view_utf8()
10593  {
10594  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_8);
10595 
10596  char tmp_buf[256]{};
10597  do
10598  {
10599  m_istream->read(&tmp_buf[0], 256);
10600  const auto read_size = static_cast<std::size_t>(m_istream->gcount());
10601 
10602  char *p_current = &tmp_buf[0];
10603  char *p_end = p_current + read_size;
10604  do
10605  {
10606  // find CR in `tmp_buf`.
10607  char *p_cr_or_end = p_current;
10608  while (p_cr_or_end != p_end)
10609  {
10610  if (*p_cr_or_end == '\r')
10611  {
10612  break;
10613  }
10614  ++p_cr_or_end;
10615  }
10616 
10617  m_buffer.append(p_current, p_cr_or_end);
10618  p_current = (p_cr_or_end == p_end) ? p_end : p_cr_or_end + 1;
10619  } while (p_current != p_end);
10620  } while (!m_istream->eof());
10621 
10622  auto current = m_buffer.begin();
10623  auto end = m_buffer.end();
10624  while (current != end)
10625  {
10626  const auto first = static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++);
10627  const uint32_t num_bytes = utf8::get_num_bytes(first);
10628 
10629  switch (num_bytes)
10630  {
10631  case 2: {
10632  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10633  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10634  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10635  {
10636  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10637  }
10638  break;
10639  }
10640  case 3: {
10641  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10642  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10643  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10644  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10645  {
10646  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10647  }
10648  break;
10649  }
10650  case 4: {
10651  const std::initializer_list<uint8_t> bytes{first, static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10652  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++),
10653  static_cast<uint8_t>(*current++)};
10654  const bool is_valid = utf8::validate(bytes);
10655  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!is_valid)
10656  {
10657  throw fkyaml::invalid_encoding("Invalid UTF-8 encoding.", bytes);
10658  }
10659  break;
10660  }
10661  case 1:
10662  default:
10663  break;
10664  }
10665  }
10666 
10667  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10668  }
10669 
10672  str_view get_buffer_view_utf16()
10673  {
10674  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE ||
10675  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE);
10676 
10677  int shift_bits[2]{0, 0};
10678  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16BE)
10679  {
10680  shift_bits[0] = 8;
10681  }
10682  else
10683  { // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_16LE
10684  shift_bits[1] = 8;
10685  }
10686 
10687  char chars[2] = {0, 0};
10688  std::array<char16_t, 2> encoded_buffer{{0, 0}};
10689  uint32_t encoded_buf_size{0};
10690  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10691  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10692 
10693  do
10694  {
10695  while (encoded_buf_size < 2)
10696  {
10697  m_istream->read(&chars[0], 2);
10698  const std::streamsize size = m_istream->gcount();
10699  if (size != 2)
10700  {
10701  break;
10702  }
10703 
10704  const auto utf16 =
10705  static_cast<char16_t>((static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[0]) << shift_bits[0]) |
10706  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[1]) << shift_bits[1]));
10707 
10708  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf16 != static_cast<char16_t>(0x000Du))
10709  {
10710  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-constant-array-index)
10711  encoded_buffer[encoded_buf_size++] = utf16;
10712  }
10713  }
10714 
10715  uint32_t consumed_size = 0;
10716  utf8::from_utf16(encoded_buffer, utf8_buffer, consumed_size, utf8_buf_size);
10717 
10718  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (consumed_size == 1)
10719  {
10720  encoded_buffer[0] = encoded_buffer[1];
10721  }
10722  encoded_buf_size -= consumed_size;
10723 
10724  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10725  } while (!m_istream->eof());
10726 
10727  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10728  }
10729 
10732  str_view get_buffer_view_utf32()
10733  {
10734  FK_YAML_ASSERT(m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE ||
10735  m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE);
10736 
10737  int shift_bits[4]{0, 0, 0, 0};
10738  if (m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32BE)
10739  {
10740  shift_bits[0] = 24;
10741  shift_bits[1] = 16;
10742  shift_bits[2] = 8;
10743  }
10744  else
10745  { // m_encode_type == utf_encode_t::UTF_32LE
10746  shift_bits[1] = 8;
10747  shift_bits[2] = 16;
10748  shift_bits[3] = 24;
10749  }
10750 
10751  char chars[4] = {0, 0, 0, 0};
10752  std::array<uint8_t, 4> utf8_buffer{{0, 0, 0, 0}};
10753  uint32_t utf8_buf_size{0};
10754 
10755  do
10756  {
10757  m_istream->read(&chars[0], 4);
10758  const std::streamsize size = m_istream->gcount();
10759  if (size != 4)
10760  {
10761  break;
10762  }
10763 
10764  const auto utf32 =
10765  static_cast<char32_t>((static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[0]) << shift_bits[0]) |
10766  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[1]) << shift_bits[1]) |
10767  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[2]) << shift_bits[2]) |
10768  (static_cast<uint8_t>(chars[3]) << shift_bits[3]));
10769 
10770  if FK_YAML_LIKELY (utf32 != char32_t(0x0000000Du))
10771  {
10772  utf8::from_utf32(utf32, utf8_buffer, utf8_buf_size);
10773  m_buffer.append(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(utf8_buffer.data()), utf8_buf_size);
10774  }
10775  } while (!m_istream->eof());
10776 
10777  return str_view{m_buffer.begin(), m_buffer.end()};
10778  }
10779 
10780  private:
10782  std::istream *m_istream{nullptr};
10784  utf_encode_t m_encode_type{utf_encode_t::UTF_8};
10786  std::string m_buffer;
10787 };
10788 
10790 // input_adapter providers //
10792 
10799 template <typename ItrType>
10800 inline iterator_input_adapter<ItrType> create_iterator_input_adapter(ItrType begin, ItrType end,
10801  bool is_contiguous)
10802 {
10803  const utf_encode_t encode_type = utf_encode_detector<ItrType>::detect(begin, end);
10804  return iterator_input_adapter<ItrType>(begin, end, encode_type, is_contiguous);
10805 }
10806 
10813 template <typename ItrType>
10814 inline iterator_input_adapter<ItrType> input_adapter(ItrType begin, ItrType end)
10815 {
10816  constexpr bool is_random_access_itr =
10817  std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<ItrType>::iterator_category,
10818  std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value;
10819 
10820  // Check if `begin` & `end` are contiguous iterators.
10821  // Getting distance between begin and (end - 1) avoids dereferencing an invalid sentinel.
10822  bool is_contiguous = false;
10823  if (is_random_access_itr)
10824  {
10825  const auto size = static_cast<ptrdiff_t>(std::distance(begin, end - 1));
10826 
10827  using CharPtr = remove_cvref_t<typename std::iterator_traits<ItrType>::pointer>;
10828  CharPtr p_begin = &*begin;
10829  CharPtr p_second_last = &*(end - 1);
10830  is_contiguous = (p_second_last - p_begin == size);
10831  }
10832  return create_iterator_input_adapter(begin, end, is_contiguous);
10833 }
10834 
10840 template <typename T, std::size_t N>
10841 inline auto input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
10842  -> decltype(create_iterator_input_adapter(array, array + (N - 1), true))
10843 {
10844  return create_iterator_input_adapter(array, array + (N - 1), true);
10845 }
10846 
10848 namespace input_adapter_factory
10849 {
10850 
10851 using std::begin;
10852 using std::end;
10853 
10857 template <typename ContainerType, typename = void> struct container_input_adapter_factory
10858 {
10859 };
10860 
10864 template <typename ContainerType>
10865 struct container_input_adapter_factory<
10866  ContainerType,
10867  void_t<decltype(begin(std::declval<ContainerType>()), end(std::declval<ContainerType>()))>>
10868 {
10870  static constexpr bool is_contiguous = is_contiguous_container<ContainerType>::value;
10871 
10873  using adapter_type = decltype(create_iterator_input_adapter(
10874  begin(std::declval<ContainerType>()), end(std::declval<ContainerType>()), is_contiguous));
10875 
10879  static adapter_type create(const ContainerType &container)
10880  {
10881  return create_iterator_input_adapter(begin(container), end(container), is_contiguous);
10882  }
10883 };
10884 
10885 } // namespace input_adapter_factory
10886 
10891 template <typename ContainerType>
10892 inline typename input_adapter_factory::container_input_adapter_factory<ContainerType>::adapter_type
10893 input_adapter(const ContainerType &container)
10894 {
10895  return input_adapter_factory::container_input_adapter_factory<ContainerType>::create(container);
10896 }
10897 
10901 inline file_input_adapter input_adapter(std::FILE *file)
10902 {
10903  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!file)
10904  {
10905  throw fkyaml::exception("Invalid FILE object pointer.");
10906  }
10907 
10908  const utf_encode_t encode_type = file_utf_encode_detector::detect(file);
10909  return file_input_adapter(file, encode_type);
10910 }
10911 
10915 inline stream_input_adapter input_adapter(std::istream &stream)
10916 {
10917  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!stream.good())
10918  {
10919  throw fkyaml::exception("Invalid stream.");
10920  }
10921 
10922  const utf_encode_t encode_type = stream_utf_encode_detector::detect(stream);
10923  return stream_input_adapter(stream, encode_type);
10924 }
10925 
10926 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
10927 
10928 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_INPUT_INPUT_ADAPTER_HPP */
10929 
10930 // #include <fkYAML/detail/iterator.hpp>
10931 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
10932 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
10933 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
10934 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
10935 //
10936 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
10937 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
10938 
10939 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_ITERATOR_HPP
10940 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_ITERATOR_HPP
10941 
10942 #include <cstddef>
10943 #include <iterator>
10944 
10945 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
10946 
10947 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
10948 
10949 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
10950 
10951 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
10952 
10955 template <typename ValueType> struct iterator_traits
10956 {
10958  using value_type = typename ValueType::value_type;
10960  using difference_type = typename ValueType::difference_type;
10962  using pointer = typename ValueType::pointer;
10964  using reference = typename ValueType::reference;
10965 };
10966 
10969 template <typename ValueType> struct iterator_traits<const ValueType>
10970 {
10972  using value_type = typename ValueType::value_type;
10974  using difference_type = typename ValueType::difference_type;
10976  using pointer = typename ValueType::const_pointer;
10978  using reference = typename ValueType::const_reference;
10979 };
10980 
10982 enum class iterator_t : std::uint8_t
10983 {
10984  SEQUENCE,
10985  MAPPING,
10986 };
10987 
10989 template <typename BasicNodeType> struct iterator_holder
10990 {
10991  static_assert(is_basic_node<BasicNodeType>::value,
10992  "iterator_holder class only accepts a basic_node as its template parameter.");
10993 
10995  typename BasicNodeType::sequence_type::iterator sequence_iterator{};
10997  typename BasicNodeType::mapping_type::iterator mapping_iterator{};
10998 };
10999 
11002 template <typename ValueType> class iterator
11003 {
11005  using other_iterator_type =
11006  typename std::conditional<std::is_const<ValueType>::value,
11007  iterator<typename std::remove_const<ValueType>::type>,
11008  iterator<const ValueType>>::type;
11009 
11010  friend other_iterator_type;
11011 
11012  public:
11014  using iterator_traits_type = iterator_traits<ValueType>;
11015 
11017  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
11019  using value_type = typename iterator_traits_type::value_type;
11021  using difference_type = typename iterator_traits_type::difference_type;
11023  using pointer = typename iterator_traits_type::pointer;
11025  using reference = typename iterator_traits_type::reference;
11026 
11027  static_assert(is_basic_node<value_type>::value,
11028  "iterator class only accepts a basic_node as its value type.");
11029 
11031  iterator() = default;
11032 
11035  iterator(const typename value_type::sequence_type::iterator &itr) noexcept
11036  {
11037  m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator = itr;
11038  }
11039 
11042  iterator(const typename value_type::mapping_type::iterator &itr) noexcept
11043  : m_inner_iterator_type(iterator_t::MAPPING)
11044  {
11045  m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator = itr;
11046  }
11047 
11049  iterator(const iterator &) = default;
11050 
11057  template <typename OtherIterator,
11058  enable_if_t<conjunction<std::is_same<OtherIterator, other_iterator_type>,
11059  std::is_const<ValueType>>::value,
11060  int> = 0>
11061  iterator(const OtherIterator &other) noexcept
11062  : m_inner_iterator_type(other.m_inner_iterator_type),
11063  m_iterator_holder(other.m_iterator_holder)
11064  {
11065  }
11066 
11068  iterator &operator=(const iterator &) = default;
11069 
11070  template <typename OtherIterator,
11071  enable_if_t<conjunction<std::is_same<OtherIterator, other_iterator_type>,
11072  std::is_const<ValueType>>::value,
11073  int> = 0>
11074  iterator &operator=(const OtherIterator &other) noexcept
11075  {
11076  m_inner_iterator_type = other.m_inner_iterator_type;
11077  m_iterator_holder = other.m_iterator_holder;
11078  return *this;
11079  }
11080 
11082  iterator(iterator &&) = default;
11083 
11085  iterator &operator=(iterator &&) = default;
11086 
11088  ~iterator() = default;
11089 
11093  pointer operator->() noexcept
11094  {
11095  if (m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::SEQUENCE)
11096  {
11097  return &(*(m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator));
11098  }
11099 
11100  // m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::MAPPING:
11101  return &(m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator->second);
11102  }
11103 
11107  reference operator*() noexcept
11108  {
11109  if (m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::SEQUENCE)
11110  {
11111  return *(m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator);
11112  }
11113 
11114  // m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::MAPPING:
11115  return m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator->second;
11116  }
11117 
11121  iterator &operator+=(difference_type i) noexcept
11122  {
11123  switch (m_inner_iterator_type)
11124  {
11125  case iterator_t::SEQUENCE:
11126  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator, i);
11127  break;
11128  case iterator_t::MAPPING:
11129  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator, i);
11130  break;
11131  }
11132  return *this;
11133  }
11134 
11138  iterator operator+(difference_type i) const noexcept
11139  {
11140  auto result = *this;
11141  result += i;
11142  return result;
11143  }
11144 
11147  iterator &operator++() noexcept
11148  {
11149  switch (m_inner_iterator_type)
11150  {
11151  case iterator_t::SEQUENCE:
11152  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator, 1);
11153  break;
11154  case iterator_t::MAPPING:
11155  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator, 1);
11156  break;
11157  }
11158  return *this;
11159  }
11160 
11163  iterator operator++(int) &noexcept
11164  {
11165  auto result = *this;
11166  ++(*this);
11167  return result;
11168  }
11169 
11173  iterator &operator-=(difference_type i) noexcept
11174  {
11175  return operator+=(-i);
11176  }
11177 
11181  iterator operator-(difference_type i) const noexcept
11182  {
11183  auto result = *this;
11184  result -= i;
11185  return result;
11186  }
11187 
11190  iterator &operator--() noexcept
11191  {
11192  switch (m_inner_iterator_type)
11193  {
11194  case iterator_t::SEQUENCE:
11195  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator, -1);
11196  break;
11197  case iterator_t::MAPPING:
11198  std::advance(m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator, -1);
11199  break;
11200  }
11201  return *this;
11202  }
11203 
11206  iterator operator--(int) &noexcept
11207  {
11208  auto result = *this;
11209  --(*this);
11210  return result;
11211  }
11212 
11217  template <typename Iterator,
11218  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11219  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11220  int> = 0>
11221  bool operator==(const Iterator &rhs) const
11222  {
11223  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_inner_iterator_type != rhs.m_inner_iterator_type)
11224  {
11225  throw fkyaml::exception("Cannot compare iterators of different container types.");
11226  }
11227 
11228  if (m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::SEQUENCE)
11229  {
11230  return (m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator == rhs.m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator);
11231  }
11232 
11233  // m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::MAPPING
11234  return (m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator == rhs.m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator);
11235  }
11236 
11241  template <typename Iterator,
11242  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11243  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11244  int> = 0>
11245  bool operator!=(const Iterator &rhs) const
11246  {
11247  return !operator==(rhs);
11248  }
11249 
11254  template <typename Iterator,
11255  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11256  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11257  int> = 0>
11258  bool operator<(const Iterator &rhs) const
11259  {
11260  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_inner_iterator_type != rhs.m_inner_iterator_type)
11261  {
11262  throw fkyaml::exception("Cannot compare iterators of different container types.");
11263  }
11264 
11265  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::MAPPING)
11266  {
11267  throw fkyaml::exception(
11268  "Cannot compare order of iterators of the mapping container type");
11269  }
11270 
11271  return (m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator < rhs.m_iterator_holder.sequence_iterator);
11272  }
11273 
11278  template <typename Iterator,
11279  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11280  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11281  int> = 0>
11282  bool operator<=(const Iterator &rhs) const
11283  {
11284  return !rhs.operator<(*this);
11285  }
11286 
11291  template <typename Iterator,
11292  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11293  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11294  int> = 0>
11295  bool operator>(const Iterator &rhs) const
11296  {
11297  return !operator<=(rhs);
11298  }
11299 
11304  template <typename Iterator,
11305  enable_if_t<disjunction<std::is_same<Iterator, iterator>,
11306  std::is_same<Iterator, other_iterator_type>>::value,
11307  int> = 0>
11308  bool operator>=(const Iterator &rhs) const
11309  {
11310  return !operator<(rhs);
11311  }
11312 
11313  public:
11316  iterator_t type() const noexcept
11317  {
11318  return m_inner_iterator_type;
11319  }
11320 
11323  const typename value_type::mapping_type::key_type &key() const
11324  {
11325  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (m_inner_iterator_type == iterator_t::SEQUENCE)
11326  {
11327  throw fkyaml::exception("Cannot retrieve key from non-mapping iterators.");
11328  }
11329 
11330  return m_iterator_holder.mapping_iterator->first;
11331  }
11332 
11335  reference value() noexcept
11336  {
11337  return operator*();
11338  }
11339 
11340  private:
11342  iterator_t m_inner_iterator_type{iterator_t::SEQUENCE};
11344  iterator_holder<value_type> m_iterator_holder{};
11345 };
11346 
11347 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
11348 
11349 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_ITERATOR_HPP */
11350 
11351 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
11352 
11353 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
11354 
11355 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
11356 
11357 // #include <fkYAML/detail/node_attrs.hpp>
11358 
11359 // #include <fkYAML/detail/node_property.hpp>
11360 
11361 // #include <fkYAML/detail/node_ref_storage.hpp>
11362 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
11363 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
11364 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
11365 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
11366 //
11367 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
11368 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
11369 
11370 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_NODE_REF_STORAGE_HPP
11371 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_NODE_REF_STORAGE_HPP
11372 
11373 #include <initializer_list>
11374 #include <type_traits>
11375 #include <utility>
11376 
11377 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
11378 
11379 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
11380 
11381 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
11382 
11383 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
11384 
11389 template <typename BasicNodeType> class node_ref_storage
11390 {
11391  static_assert(is_basic_node<BasicNodeType>::value,
11392  "node_ref_storage only accepts basic_node<...>");
11393 
11394  using node_type = BasicNodeType;
11395 
11396  public:
11399  explicit node_ref_storage(node_type &&n) noexcept(
11400  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<node_type>::value)
11401  : m_owned_value(std::move(n))
11402  {
11403  }
11404 
11407  explicit node_ref_storage(const node_type &n) noexcept : m_value_ref(&n)
11408  {
11409  }
11410 
11413  node_ref_storage(std::initializer_list<node_ref_storage> init) : m_owned_value(init)
11414  {
11415  }
11416 
11420  template <typename... Args,
11421  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<node_type, Args...>::value, int> = 0>
11422  node_ref_storage(Args &&...args) : m_owned_value(std::forward<Args>(args)...)
11423  {
11424  }
11425 
11426  // allow only move construct/assignment
11427  node_ref_storage(const node_ref_storage &) = delete;
11428  node_ref_storage(node_ref_storage &&) = default;
11429  node_ref_storage &operator=(const node_ref_storage &) = delete;
11430  node_ref_storage &operator=(node_ref_storage &&) = default;
11431 
11432  ~node_ref_storage() = default;
11433 
11434  public:
11437  const node_type *operator->() const noexcept
11438  {
11439  return m_value_ref ? m_value_ref : &m_owned_value;
11440  }
11441 
11444  node_type release() const noexcept
11445  {
11446  return m_value_ref ? *m_value_ref : std::move(m_owned_value);
11447  }
11448 
11449  private:
11451  mutable node_type m_owned_value = nullptr;
11453  const node_type *m_value_ref = nullptr;
11454 };
11455 
11456 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
11457 
11458 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_NODE_REF_STORAGE_HPP */
11459 
11460 // #include <fkYAML/detail/output/serializer.hpp>
11461 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
11462 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
11463 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
11464 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
11465 //
11466 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
11467 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
11468 
11469 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_OUTPUT_SERIALIZER_HPP
11470 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_OUTPUT_SERIALIZER_HPP
11471 
11472 #include <cmath>
11473 #include <sstream>
11474 #include <string>
11475 #include <vector>
11476 
11477 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
11478 
11479 // #include <fkYAML/detail/conversions/to_string.hpp>
11480 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
11481 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
11482 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
11483 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
11484 //
11485 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
11486 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
11487 
11488 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_CONVERSIONS_TO_STRING_HPP
11489 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_CONVERSIONS_TO_STRING_HPP
11490 
11491 #include <cmath>
11492 #include <limits>
11493 #include <sstream>
11494 #include <string>
11495 #include <type_traits>
11496 
11497 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
11498 
11499 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
11500 
11501 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
11502 
11503 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
11504 
11510 template <typename ValueType, typename CharType>
11511 inline void to_string(ValueType v, std::basic_string<CharType> &s) noexcept;
11512 
11516 template <> inline void to_string(std::nullptr_t /*unused*/, std::string &s) noexcept
11517 {
11518  s = "null";
11519 }
11520 
11524 template <> inline void to_string(bool v, std::string &s) noexcept
11525 {
11526  s = v ? "true" : "false";
11527 }
11528 
11533 template <typename IntegerType>
11534 inline enable_if_t<is_non_bool_integral<IntegerType>::value> to_string(IntegerType v,
11535  std::string &s) noexcept
11536 {
11537  s = std::to_string(v);
11538 }
11539 
11544 template <typename FloatType>
11545 inline enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value> to_string(FloatType v,
11546  std::string &s) noexcept
11547 {
11548  if (std::isnan(v))
11549  {
11550  s = ".nan";
11551  return;
11552  }
11553 
11554  if (std::isinf(v))
11555  {
11556  if (v == std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity())
11557  {
11558  s = ".inf";
11559  }
11560  else
11561  {
11562  s = "-.inf";
11563  }
11564  return;
11565  }
11566 
11567  std::ostringstream oss;
11568  oss << v;
11569  s = oss.str();
11570 
11571  // If `v` is actually an integer and no scientific notation is used for serialization, ".0" must
11572  // be appended. The result would cause a roundtrip issue otherwise.
11573  // https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML/issues/405
11574  const std::size_t pos = s.find_first_of(".e");
11575  if (pos == std::string::npos)
11576  {
11577  s += ".0";
11578  }
11579 }
11580 
11581 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
11582 
11583 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_CONVERSIONS_TO_STRING_HPP */
11584 
11585 // #include <fkYAML/detail/encodings/yaml_escaper.hpp>
11586 
11587 // #include <fkYAML/detail/input/scalar_scanner.hpp>
11588 
11589 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
11590 
11591 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
11592 
11593 // #include <fkYAML/node_type.hpp>
11594 
11595 // #include <fkYAML/yaml_version_type.hpp>
11596 
11597 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
11598 
11601 template <typename BasicNodeType> class basic_serializer
11602 {
11603  static_assert(detail::is_basic_node<BasicNodeType>::value,
11604  "basic_serializer only accepts basic_node<...>");
11605 
11606  public:
11608  basic_serializer() = default;
11609 
11613  std::string serialize(const BasicNodeType &node)
11614  {
11615  std::string str{};
11616  serialize_document(node, str);
11617  return str;
11618  } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11619 
11620  std::string serialize_docs(const std::vector<BasicNodeType> &docs)
11621  {
11622  std::string str{};
11623 
11624  const auto size = static_cast<uint32_t>(docs.size());
11625  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < size; i++)
11626  {
11627  serialize_document(docs[i], str);
11628  if (i + 1 < size)
11629  {
11630  // Append the end-of-document marker for the next document.
11631  str += "...\n";
11632  }
11633  }
11634 
11635  return str;
11636  } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11637 
11638  private:
11639  void serialize_document(const BasicNodeType &node, std::string &str)
11640  {
11641  const bool dirs_serialized = serialize_directives(node, str);
11642 
11643  // the root node cannot be an alias node.
11644  const bool root_has_props = node.is_anchor() || node.has_tag_name();
11645 
11646  if (root_has_props)
11647  {
11648  if (dirs_serialized)
11649  {
11650  str.back() = ' '; // replace the last LF with a white space
11651  }
11652  bool is_anchor_appended = try_append_anchor(node, false, str);
11653  try_append_tag(node, is_anchor_appended, str);
11654  str += "\n";
11655  }
11656  serialize_node(node, 0, str);
11657  }
11658 
11663  bool serialize_directives(const BasicNodeType &node, std::string &str)
11664  {
11665  const auto &p_meta = node.mp_meta;
11666  bool needs_directive_end = false;
11667 
11668  if (p_meta->is_version_specified)
11669  {
11670  str += "%YAML ";
11671  switch (p_meta->version)
11672  {
11673  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_1:
11674  str += "1.1\n";
11675  break;
11676  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_2:
11677  str += "1.2\n";
11678  break;
11679  }
11680  needs_directive_end = true;
11681  }
11682 
11683  if (!p_meta->primary_handle_prefix.empty())
11684  {
11685  str += "%TAG ! ";
11686  str += p_meta->primary_handle_prefix;
11687  str += "\n";
11688  needs_directive_end = true;
11689  }
11690 
11691  if (!p_meta->secondary_handle_prefix.empty())
11692  {
11693  str += "%TAG !! ";
11694  str += p_meta->secondary_handle_prefix;
11695  str += "\n";
11696  needs_directive_end = true;
11697  }
11698 
11699  if (!p_meta->named_handle_map.empty())
11700  {
11701  for (const auto &itr : p_meta->named_handle_map)
11702  {
11703  str += "%TAG ";
11704  str += itr.first;
11705  str += " ";
11706  str += itr.second;
11707  str += "\n";
11708  }
11709  needs_directive_end = true;
11710  }
11711 
11712  if (needs_directive_end)
11713  {
11714  str += "---\n";
11715  }
11716 
11717  return needs_directive_end;
11718  }
11719 
11724  void serialize_node(const BasicNodeType &node, const uint32_t cur_indent, std::string &str)
11725  {
11726  switch (node.get_type())
11727  {
11728  case node_type::SEQUENCE:
11729  for (const auto &seq_item : node)
11730  {
11731  insert_indentation(cur_indent, str);
11732  str += "-";
11733 
11734  const bool is_appended = try_append_alias(seq_item, true, str);
11735  if (is_appended)
11736  {
11737  str += "\n";
11738  continue;
11739  }
11740 
11741  try_append_anchor(seq_item, true, str);
11742  try_append_tag(seq_item, true, str);
11743 
11744  const bool is_scalar = seq_item.is_scalar();
11745  if (is_scalar)
11746  {
11747  str += " ";
11748  serialize_node(seq_item, cur_indent, str);
11749  str += "\n";
11750  }
11751  else
11752  {
11753  str += "\n";
11754  serialize_node(seq_item, cur_indent + 2, str);
11755  }
11756  }
11757  break;
11758  case node_type::MAPPING:
11759  for (auto itr = node.begin(); itr != node.end(); ++itr)
11760  {
11761  insert_indentation(cur_indent, str);
11762 
11763  bool is_appended = try_append_alias(itr.key(), false, str);
11764  if (is_appended)
11765  {
11766  // The trailing white space is necessary since anchor names can contain a colon
11767  // (:) at its end.
11768  str += " ";
11769  }
11770  else
11771  {
11772  const bool is_anchor_appended = try_append_anchor(itr.key(), false, str);
11773  const bool is_tag_appended = try_append_tag(itr.key(), is_anchor_appended, str);
11774  if (is_anchor_appended || is_tag_appended)
11775  {
11776  str += " ";
11777  }
11778 
11779  const bool is_container = !itr.key().is_scalar();
11780  if (is_container)
11781  {
11782  str += "? ";
11783  }
11784  const auto indent = static_cast<uint32_t>(get_cur_indent(str));
11785  serialize_node(itr.key(), indent, str);
11786  if (is_container)
11787  {
11788  // a newline code is already inserted in the above serialize_node() call.
11789  insert_indentation(indent - 2, str);
11790  }
11791  }
11792 
11793  str += ":";
11794 
11795  is_appended = try_append_alias(*itr, true, str);
11796  if (is_appended)
11797  {
11798  str += "\n";
11799  continue;
11800  }
11801 
11802  try_append_anchor(*itr, true, str);
11803  try_append_tag(*itr, true, str);
11804 
11805  const bool is_scalar = itr->is_scalar();
11806  if (is_scalar)
11807  {
11808  str += " ";
11809  serialize_node(*itr, cur_indent, str);
11810  str += "\n";
11811  }
11812  else
11813  {
11814  str += "\n";
11815  serialize_node(*itr, cur_indent + 2, str);
11816  }
11817  }
11818  break;
11819  case node_type::NULL_OBJECT:
11820  to_string(nullptr, m_tmp_str_buff);
11821  str += m_tmp_str_buff;
11822  break;
11823  case node_type::BOOLEAN:
11824  to_string(node.template get_value<typename BasicNodeType::boolean_type>(),
11825  m_tmp_str_buff);
11826  str += m_tmp_str_buff;
11827  break;
11828  case node_type::INTEGER:
11829  to_string(node.template get_value<typename BasicNodeType::integer_type>(),
11830  m_tmp_str_buff);
11831  str += m_tmp_str_buff;
11832  break;
11833  case node_type::FLOAT:
11834  to_string(node.template get_value<typename BasicNodeType::float_number_type>(),
11835  m_tmp_str_buff);
11836  str += m_tmp_str_buff;
11837  break;
11838  case node_type::STRING: {
11839  bool is_escaped = false;
11840  auto str_val = get_string_node_value(node, is_escaped);
11841 
11842  if (is_escaped)
11843  {
11844  // There's no other token type with escapes than strings.
11845  // Also, escapes must be in double-quoted strings.
11846  str += '\"';
11847  str += str_val;
11848  str += '\"';
11849  break;
11850  }
11851 
11852  // The next line is intentionally excluded from the LCOV coverage target since the next
11853  // line is somehow misrecognized as it has a binary branch. Possibly begin() or end()
11854  // has some conditional branch(es) internally. Confirmed with LCOV 1.14 on Ubuntu22.04.
11855  const node_type type_if_plain = scalar_scanner::scan(
11856  str_val.c_str(), str_val.c_str() + str_val.size()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11857 
11858  if (type_if_plain != node_type::STRING)
11859  {
11860  // Surround a string value with double quotes to keep semantic equality.
11861  // Without them, serialized values will become non-string. (e.g., "1" -> 1)
11862  str += '\"';
11863  str += str_val;
11864  str += '\"';
11865  }
11866  else
11867  {
11868  str += str_val;
11869  }
11870  break;
11871  }
11872  }
11873  }
11874 
11878  std::size_t get_cur_indent(const std::string &s) const noexcept
11879  {
11880  const bool is_empty = s.empty();
11881  if (is_empty)
11882  {
11883  return 0;
11884  }
11885 
11886  const std::size_t last_lf_pos = s.rfind('\n');
11887  return (last_lf_pos != std::string::npos) ? s.size() - last_lf_pos - 1 : s.size();
11888  }
11889 
11893  void insert_indentation(const uint32_t indent, std::string &str) const noexcept
11894  {
11895  if (indent == 0)
11896  {
11897  return;
11898  }
11899 
11900  str.append(indent - get_cur_indent(str), ' ');
11901  }
11902 
11908  bool try_append_anchor(const BasicNodeType &node, bool prepends_space, std::string &str) const
11909  {
11910  if (node.is_anchor())
11911  {
11912  if (prepends_space)
11913  {
11914  str += " ";
11915  }
11916  str += "&" + node.get_anchor_name();
11917  return true;
11918  }
11919  return false;
11920  }
11921 
11927  bool try_append_alias(const BasicNodeType &node, bool prepends_space, std::string &str) const
11928  {
11929  if (node.is_alias())
11930  {
11931  if (prepends_space)
11932  {
11933  str += " ";
11934  }
11935  str += "*" + node.get_anchor_name();
11936  return true;
11937  }
11938  return false;
11939  }
11940 
11945  bool try_append_tag(const BasicNodeType &node, bool prepends_space, std::string &str) const
11946  {
11947  if (node.has_tag_name())
11948  {
11949  if (prepends_space)
11950  {
11951  str += " ";
11952  }
11953  str += node.get_tag_name();
11954  return true;
11955  }
11956  return false;
11957  }
11958 
11963  typename BasicNodeType::string_type get_string_node_value(const BasicNodeType &node,
11964  bool &is_escaped)
11965  {
11966  FK_YAML_ASSERT(node.is_string());
11967 
11968  const auto &s = node.template get_value_ref<const typename BasicNodeType::string_type &>();
11969  return yaml_escaper::escape(s.c_str(), s.c_str() + s.size(), is_escaped);
11970  } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11971 
11972  private:
11974  std::string m_tmp_str_buff;
11975 };
11976 
11977 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
11978 
11979 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_OUTPUT_SERIALIZER_HPP */
11980 
11981 // #include <fkYAML/detail/reverse_iterator.hpp>
11982 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
11983 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
11984 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
11985 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
11986 //
11987 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
11988 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
11989 
11990 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_REVERSE_ITERATOR_HPP
11991 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_REVERSE_ITERATOR_HPP
11992 
11993 #include <iterator>
11994 
11995 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
11996 
11997 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
11998 
11999 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
12000 
12003 template <typename Iterator> class reverse_iterator
12004 {
12005  static_assert(
12006  is_basic_node<typename std::remove_const<typename Iterator::value_type>::type>::value,
12007  "reverse_iterator only accepts a basic_node type as the underlying iterator's value type");
12008 
12009  public:
12011  using iterator_type = Iterator;
12012 
12014  using iterator_category = typename Iterator::iterator_category;
12015 
12017  using value_type = typename Iterator::value_type;
12018 
12021  using difference_type = typename Iterator::difference_type;
12022 
12024  using pointer = typename Iterator::pointer;
12025 
12027  using reference = typename Iterator::reference;
12028 
12030  reverse_iterator() = default;
12031 
12033  reverse_iterator(const reverse_iterator &) = default;
12034 
12036  reverse_iterator &operator=(const reverse_iterator &) = default;
12037 
12039  reverse_iterator(reverse_iterator &&) = default;
12040 
12042  reverse_iterator &operator=(reverse_iterator &&) = default;
12043 
12046  reverse_iterator(const Iterator &i) noexcept : m_current(i)
12047  {
12048  }
12049 
12050  template <typename U, enable_if_t<negation<std::is_same<U, Iterator>>::value, int> = 0>
12051  reverse_iterator(const reverse_iterator<U> &other) noexcept : m_current(other.base())
12052  {
12053  }
12054 
12055  template <typename U, enable_if_t<negation<std::is_same<U, Iterator>>::value, int> = 0>
12056  reverse_iterator &operator=(const reverse_iterator<U> &other) noexcept
12057  {
12058  m_current = other.base();
12059  return *this;
12060  }
12061 
12063  ~reverse_iterator() = default;
12064 
12067  Iterator base() const noexcept
12068  {
12069  return m_current;
12070  }
12071 
12074  reference operator*() const noexcept
12075  {
12076  Iterator tmp = m_current;
12077  return *--tmp;
12078  }
12079 
12082  pointer operator->() const noexcept
12083  {
12084  return &(operator*());
12085  }
12086 
12089  reverse_iterator &operator++() noexcept
12090  {
12091  --m_current;
12092  return *this;
12093  }
12094 
12097  reverse_iterator operator++(int) &noexcept
12098  {
12099  auto result = *this;
12100  --m_current;
12101  return result;
12102  }
12103 
12106  reverse_iterator &operator--() noexcept
12107  {
12108  ++m_current;
12109  return *this;
12110  }
12111 
12114  reverse_iterator operator--(int) &noexcept
12115  {
12116  auto result = *this;
12117  ++m_current;
12118  return result;
12119  }
12120 
12124  reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type n) const noexcept
12125  {
12126  return reverse_iterator(m_current - n);
12127  }
12128 
12133  reverse_iterator &operator+=(difference_type n) noexcept
12134  {
12135  m_current -= n;
12136  return *this;
12137  }
12138 
12142  reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type n) const noexcept
12143  {
12144  return reverse_iterator(m_current + n);
12145  }
12146 
12151  reverse_iterator &operator-=(difference_type n) noexcept
12152  {
12153  m_current += n;
12154  return *this;
12155  }
12156 
12159  auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Iterator>().key())
12160  {
12161  Iterator itr = --(base());
12162  return itr.key();
12163  }
12164 
12167  reference value() noexcept
12168  {
12169  Iterator itr = --(base());
12170  return *itr;
12171  }
12172 
12173  private:
12174  Iterator m_current;
12175 };
12176 
12177 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12178 inline bool operator==(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12179  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12180 {
12181  return lhs.base() == rhs.base();
12182 }
12183 
12184 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12185 inline bool operator!=(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12186  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12187 {
12188  return lhs.base() != rhs.base();
12189 }
12190 
12191 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12192 inline bool operator<(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12193  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12194 {
12195  return lhs.base() > rhs.base();
12196 }
12197 
12198 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12199 inline bool operator<=(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12200  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12201 {
12202  return lhs.base() >= rhs.base();
12203 }
12204 
12205 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12206 inline bool operator>(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12207  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12208 {
12209  return lhs.base() < rhs.base();
12210 }
12211 
12212 template <typename IteratorL, typename IteratorR>
12213 inline bool operator>=(const reverse_iterator<IteratorL> &lhs,
12214  const reverse_iterator<IteratorR> &rhs)
12215 {
12216  return lhs.base() <= rhs.base();
12217 }
12218 
12219 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
12220 
12221 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_REVERSE_ITERATOR_HPP */
12222 
12223 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/node_t.hpp>
12224 
12225 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/yaml_version_t.hpp>
12226 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
12227 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
12228 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
12229 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
12230 //
12231 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
12232 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
12233 
12234 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_YAML_VERSION_T_HPP
12235 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_YAML_VERSION_T_HPP
12236 
12237 #include <cstdint>
12238 
12239 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
12240 
12241 // #include <fkYAML/yaml_version_type.hpp>
12242 
12243 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
12244 
12246 enum class yaml_version_t : std::uint8_t
12247 {
12248  VER_1_1,
12249  VER_1_2,
12250 };
12251 
12252 inline yaml_version_t convert_from_yaml_version_type(yaml_version_type t) noexcept
12253 {
12254  switch (t)
12255  {
12256  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_1:
12257  return yaml_version_t::VER_1_1;
12258  case yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_2:
12259  default:
12260  return yaml_version_t::VER_1_2;
12261  }
12262 }
12263 
12264 inline yaml_version_type convert_to_yaml_version_type(yaml_version_t t) noexcept
12265 {
12266  switch (t)
12267  {
12268  case yaml_version_t::VER_1_1:
12269  return yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_1;
12270  case yaml_version_t::VER_1_2:
12271  default:
12272  return yaml_version_type::VERSION_1_2;
12273  }
12274 }
12275 
12276 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_END
12277 
12278 #endif /* FK_YAML_DETAIL_TYPES_YAML_VERSION_T_HPP */
12279 
12280 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
12281 
12282 // #include <fkYAML/node_type.hpp>
12283 
12284 // #include <fkYAML/node_value_converter.hpp>
12285 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
12286 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
12287 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
12288 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
12289 //
12290 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
12291 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
12292 
12293 #ifndef FK_YAML_NODE_VALUE_CONVERTER_HPP
12294 #define FK_YAML_NODE_VALUE_CONVERTER_HPP
12295 
12296 #include <utility>
12297 
12298 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
12299 
12300 // #include <fkYAML/detail/conversions/from_node.hpp>
12301 // _______ __ __ __ _____ __ __ __
12302 // | __| |_/ | \_/ |/ _ \ / \/ \| | fkYAML: A C++ header-only YAML library
12303 // | __| _ < \_ _/| ___ | _ | |___ version 0.4.0
12304 // |__| |_| \__| |_| |_| |_|___||___|______| https://github.com/fktn-k/fkYAML
12305 //
12306 // SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2023-2024 Kensuke Fukutani <fktn.dev@gmail.com>
12307 // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
12308 
12309 #ifndef FK_YAML_DETAIL_CONVERSIONS_FROM_NODE_HPP
12310 #define FK_YAML_DETAIL_CONVERSIONS_FROM_NODE_HPP
12311 
12312 #include <array>
12313 #include <cmath>
12314 #include <forward_list>
12315 #include <limits>
12316 #include <utility>
12317 #include <valarray>
12318 
12319 // #include <fkYAML/detail/macros/define_macros.hpp>
12320 
12321 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/node_traits.hpp>
12322 
12323 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/stl_supplement.hpp>
12324 
12325 // #include <fkYAML/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
12326 
12327 // #include <fkYAML/detail/types/node_t.hpp>
12328 
12329 // #include <fkYAML/exception.hpp>
12330 
12331 #ifdef FK_YAML_HAS_CXX_17
12332 #include <optional>
12333 #endif
12334 
12335 FK_YAML_DETAIL_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
12336 
12338 // from_node //
12340 
12341 // utility type traits and functors
12342 
12346 template <typename T>
12347 using is_constructible_mapping_type =
12348  conjunction<detect::has_key_type<T>, detect::has_mapped_type<T>, detect::has_value_type<T>>;
12349 
12354 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T>
12355 using is_constructible_sequence_type =
12356  conjunction<negation<is_basic_node<T>>, detect::has_iterator<T>,
12357  detect::is_iterator_traits<typename T::iterator>, detect::has_begin_end<T>,
12358  negation<std::is_same<T, typename BasicNodeType::mapping_type>>,
12359  negation<is_constructible_mapping_type<T>>>;
12360 
12364 template <typename T>
12365 using is_sequence_container_adapter =
12366  conjunction<negation<is_basic_node<T>>, detect::has_container_type<T>,
12367  detect::has_value_type<T>, negation<detect::has_key_type<T>>>;
12368 
12372 template <typename ContainerType, typename = void> struct call_reserve_if_available
12373 {
12375  static void call(ContainerType & /*unused*/, typename ContainerType::size_type /*unused*/)
12376  {
12377  }
12378 };
12379 
12383 template <typename ContainerType>
12384 struct call_reserve_if_available<ContainerType,
12385  enable_if_t<detect::has_reserve<ContainerType>::value>>
12386 {
12390  static void call(ContainerType &c, typename ContainerType::size_type n)
12391  {
12392  c.reserve(n);
12393  }
12394 };
12395 
12396 // from_node() implementations
12397 
12405 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T, std::size_t N>
12406 inline auto from_node(const BasicNodeType &n, T (&array)[N])
12407  -> decltype(n.get_value_inplace(std::declval<T &>()), void())
12408 {
12409  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!n.is_sequence())
12410  {
12411  throw type_error("The target node value type is not sequence type.", n.get_type());
12412  }
12413 
12414  // call get_value_inplace(), not get_value(), since the storage to fill the result into is
12415  // already created.
12416  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; i++)
12417  {
12418  n.at(i).get_value_inplace(array[i]);
12419  }
12420 }
12421 
12430 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T, std::size_t N0, std::size_t N1>
12431 inline auto from_node(const BasicNodeType &n, T (&array)[N0][N1])
12432  -> decltype(n.get_value_inplace(std::declval<T &>()), void())
12433 {
12434  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!n.is_sequence())
12435  {
12436  throw type_error("The target node value type is not sequence type.", n.get_type());
12437  }
12438 
12439  // call get_value_inplace(), not get_value(), since the storage to fill the result into is
12440  // already created.
12441  for (std::size_t i0 = 0; i0 < N0; i0++)
12442  {
12443  for (std::size_t i1 = 0; i1 < N1; i1++)
12444  {
12445  n.at(i0).at(i1).get_value_inplace(array[i0][i1]);
12446  }
12447  }
12448 }
12449 
12459 template <typename BasicNodeType, typename T, std::size_t N0, std::size_t N1, std::size_t N2>
12460 inline auto from_node(const BasicNodeType &n, T (&array)[N0][N1][N2])
12461  -> decltype(n.get_value_inplace(std::declval<T &>()), void())
12462 {
12463  if FK_YAML_UNLIKELY (!n.is_sequence())
12464  {
